analyzed: ka ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The pillar, and so on.

original: 'dir chu'i 'khrul 'khor gyi don du shing sbom du sor drug pa khru bcu bzhi pa'o //🔽glang po che'i 'khrul 'khor la sor @217b nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dir chu'i 'khrul 'khor gyi don du shing sbom du sor drug pa khru bcu bzhi pa'o // glang po che'i 'khrul 'khor la sor @217b nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: Here, for the purpose of the water-machine, the tree is six finger-widths thick and fourteen cubits long.🔽The elephant-machine is twenty-four finger-widths.

original: rta'i 'khrul 'khor la sor nyi shu'o //
analyzed: rta'i 'khrul 'khor la sor nyi shu'o //
translated: The horse-machine is twenty finger-widths.

original: mi'i 'khrul 'khor la sor bcu drug go //
analyzed: mi'i 'khrul 'khor la sor bcu drug go //
translated: The human-machine is sixteen finger-widths.

original: khru bcu gnyis kyi bar bar la gnas pa'i ka ba drug po dag gis gnyis ka'i nang ni mnyam pa lhag chad med pa nyid do //
analyzed: khru bcu gnyis kyi bar bar la gnas pa'i ka ba drug po dag gis gnyis ka'i nang ni mnyam pa lhag chad med pa nyid do //
translated: The two interiors are equal, without excess or deficiency, by means of the six pillars that are placed every twelve cubits.

original: snying po re re ni khru bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: snying po re re ni khru bcu gnyis so //
translated: Each core is twelve cubits.

original: 'og gi nang dang steng gi nang la khru ni zung gi bar dag la ste /
analyzed: 'og gi nang dang steng gi nang la khru ni zung gi bar dag la ste /
translated: In the interior below and in the interior above, up to two cubits.

original: khru gnyis kyi bar la'o //
analyzed: khru gnyis kyi bar la'o //
translated: Up to two cubits.

original: ka ba drug dang nang gnyis kyis snying po re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ka ba drug dang nang gnyis kyis snying po re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: The six pillars and the two inner ones make up the heart of each.

original: zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule.

original: so so'i re mig kun la spang leb dag gis g-yogs pa ste /
analyzed: so so'i re mig kun la spang leb dag gis g-yogs pa ste /
translated: Each square is covered with a wooden plank.

original: 'dir ngos gnyis kar dpung pa rnams brus shing spang leb so so'i ngos gzhan la 'og dang steng gi spang leb kyi rtse mo bsrungs nas dbus su ngos gcig brus te /
analyzed: 'dir ngos gnyis kar dpung pa rnams brus shing spang leb so so'i ngos gzhan la 'og dang steng gi spang leb kyi rtse mo bsrungs nas dbus su ngos gcig brus te /
translated: Here, on both sides, the shoulders are dug out, and the other side of each plank is protected by the upper and lower ends of the plank, and in the middle, one side is dug out.

original: spang leb las sor mo gcig spang leb kyi dbus su bcug la ji ltar chu 'jug par mi 'gyur bar bsdam par bya'o //
analyzed: spang leb las sor mo gcig spang leb kyi dbus su bcug la ji ltar chu 'jug par mi 'gyur bar bsdam par bya'o //
translated: One finger breadth is left out from the plank, and the middle of the plank is inserted, and it should be fastened so that water does not enter.

original: de bzhin du 'og dang steng dang shar dang nub dang byang dang lho thams cad du bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og dang steng dang shar dang nub dang byang dang lho thams cad du bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be done on the bottom, top, east, west, north, and south.

original: glang po che rnams kyi snying po ni dpangs su khru gsum mo //
analyzed: glang po che rnams kyi snying po ni dpangs su khru gsum mo //
translated: The heart of the elephants is three cubits high.

original: rta rnams kyi ni phyed dang bcas pa'i khru gnyis so //
analyzed: rta rnams kyi ni phyed dang bcas pa'i khru gnyis so //
translated: The horses are one and a half cubits.

original: mi rnams kyi ni khru gnyis so //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi ni khru gnyis so //
translated: The humans are two cubits.

original: pags pa spra tshil gos rnams kyis zhes pa ni spang leb so so'i mtshams kyi gnas de rnams su pags pa bzhu ba dang spra tshil gos rnams kyis steng du rgyas gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: pags pa spra tshil gos rnams kyis zhes pa ni spang leb so so'i mtshams kyi gnas de rnams su pags pa bzhu ba dang spra tshil gos rnams kyis steng du rgyas gdab par bya'o //
translated: The skin, wax, and cloth are to be applied to the places between the individual boards.

original: ji ltar snying po'i dbus su rlabs kyi chu mi 'jug par khru gnyis kyi dpangs ni mgrin pa'i gnas su snying po'i dbus su 'jug pa'i slad du bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar snying po'i dbus su rlabs kyi chu mi 'jug par khru gnyis kyi dpangs ni mgrin pa'i gnas su snying po'i dbus su 'jug pa'i slad du bya'o //
translated: Just as the water of the waves does not enter the middle of the core, the height of two cubits is to be made in the place of the throat in order to enter the middle of the core.

original: snying po dman pa dang 'bring dang mchog gi dbye ba 'di rnams kyis 'khrul 'khor du mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying po dman pa dang 'bring dang mchog gi dbye ba 'di rnams kyis 'khrul 'khor du mar 'gyur ro //
translated: By these divisions of inferior, middling, and superior cores, there are many types of machines.

original: dus zhes pa snying po drug gis 'khrul 'khor du 'gyur te /🔽brgyad kyis sam skyon te /🔽bcva brgyad kyis sam sum 'gyur nyin byed de /🔽sum cu rtsa drug gis sam nyis 'gyur te /🔽snying po de'i nyis 'gyur dag gis 'khrul 'khor du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus zhes pa snying po drug gis 'khrul 'khor du 'gyur te / brgyad kyis sam skyon te / bcva brgyad kyis sam sum 'gyur nyin byed de / sum cu rtsa drug gis sam nyis 'gyur te / snying po de'i nyis 'gyur dag gis 'khrul 'khor du 'gyur ro //
translated: The time is the machine of the six cores.

original: rgya mtsho chen po rgal ba'i slad du /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po rgal ba'i slad du /
translated: By eight, or by ten, or by eighteen, or by thirty, or by thirty-six, or by the double, or by the triple, or by the quadruple, or by the quintuple, or by the sextuple, or by the septuple, or by the octuple, or by the nonuple, or by the denuple, or by the undecennary, or by the dozenary, or by the tredecennary, or by the quattuordecennary, or by the quindecennary, or by the sexdecennary, or by the septendecennary, or by the octodecennary, or by the novemdecennary, or by the vigesimal, or by the trigesimal, or by the quadragesimal, or by the quinquagesimal, or by the sexagesimal, or by the septuagesimal, or by the octogesimal, or by the nonagesimal, or by the centesimal, or by the millesimal, or by the myriadesimal, or by the hundred-myriadesimal, or by the thousand-myriadesimal, or by the hundred-thousand-myriadesimal, or by the hundred-hundred-thousand-myriadesimal, or by the hundred-hundred-thousand-hundred-thousand-myriadesimal, or by the hundred-hundred-thousand-hundred-thousand-hundred-thousand-myriadesimal, or by the hundred-hundred-thousand-hundred-thousand-hundred-thousand-hundred-thousand-myriadesimal, or by the hundred-hundred-thousand-hundred-thousand-hundred-thousand-hundred-thousand-hundred-thousand-myriadesimal, or by the hundred-hundred-thousand-hundred-thousand-hundred-thousand-hundred-thousand-hundred-thousand-hundred-thousand-myriadesimal, or by the hundred-hundred-thousand-hundred

original: snying po stong phrag gi mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: snying po stong phrag gi mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The heart is the end of a thousand cubits.

original: 'dir phyi rol du dpung pa bzhi rnams la ste /🔽snying po so so'i shar dang nub kyi dpung pa dag dang / nang gnyis kyi lus la @218a * //
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol du dpung pa bzhi rnams la ste / snying po so so'i shar dang nub kyi dpung pa dag dang / nang gnyis kyi lus la @218a * //
translated: Here, externally, there are four arms.

original: byang dang lhor g-yas dang g-yas min dag la'o //
analyzed: byang dang lhor g-yas dang g-yas min dag la'o //
translated: The heart is on the east and west arms, and internally, on the north and south arms, the right and left sides of the body.

original: dpung pa bzhi po de rnams dang / ka ba'i shing dpung pa phug pa'i bug pa nas phyung ba rgyar dpung ba'i sum cha dang ldan pa rnams la spang leb khru gsum pa rtse mo gnyis ka phug pas snying po thams cad phan tshun bsdam par bya ste /
analyzed: dpung pa bzhi po de rnams dang / ka ba'i shing dpung pa phug pa'i bug pa nas phyung ba rgyar dpung ba'i sum cha dang ldan pa rnams la spang leb khru gsum pa rtse mo gnyis ka phug pas snying po thams cad phan tshun bsdam par bya ste /
translated: Those four arms and the pillar wood that is inserted into the arm hole, which is one-third the width of the arm, have a three-cubit plank with both ends inserted into the heart, binding all the hearts together.

original: snying po'i gra bzhir ro //
analyzed: snying po'i gra bzhir ro //
translated: The four corners of the heart are the places of the beams.

original: lhag ma snang ba'i gnas rnams su skya ba rnams rgyu bar byed do //
analyzed: lhag ma snang ba'i gnas rnams su skya ba rnams rgyu bar byed do //
translated: The remaining places of light are the places where the rafters move.

original: skya ba rgyu ba'i gnas rnams spangs nas steng ngam shar dang nub kun nas rgya yis btab pa'o //
analyzed: skya ba rgyu ba'i gnas rnams spangs nas steng ngam shar dang nub kun nas rgya yis btab pa'o //
translated: Having abandoned the places where the rafters move, above or in the east and west, it is sealed all around.

original: 'khrul 'khor thams cad kyi rgyab tu skya  ba 'dzin pa drug ste /
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor thams cad kyi rgyab tu skya  ba 'dzin pa drug ste /
translated: Behind all the machines are six men holding the poles.

original: de bzhin du bcu gnyis dang sum cu dang brgya'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcu gnyis dang sum cu dang brgya'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: In the same way, there are twelve, thirty, and up to a hundred men.

original: skya ba 'dzin pa de rnams kyis mdun nas dpung pa gnyis ka mnyam pa 'khrul 'khor 'dren pas 'khrul 'khor dang rjes su mthun pas stong gi mthar thug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skya ba 'dzin pa de rnams kyis mdun nas dpung pa gnyis ka mnyam pa 'khrul 'khor 'dren pas 'khrul 'khor dang rjes su mthun pas stong gi mthar thug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those men, holding the poles, pull the machines from the front, and the machines move evenly, in accordance with the machines, up to a thousand.

original: yang na rlung rjes su mthun par shes nas ka ba'i khung bur rab tu btsugs pa'i g-yo ba'i rlung gi dar rnams kyis ni ste /
analyzed: yang na rlung rjes su mthun par shes nas ka ba'i khung bur rab tu btsugs pa'i g-yo ba'i rlung gi dar rnams kyis ni ste /
translated: Or, knowing the wind to be favorable, the machines are set up in the holes of the poles, and the moving flags of the wind

original: rlung dar rnams kyis 'khrul 'khor de rlung gis bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: rlung dar rnams kyis 'khrul 'khor de rlung gis bskyod pa ste /
translated: the flags of the wind move the machines.

original: de la zhon pa rang gi sde ni chu'i rdzong dag nyams pa'i don du chu'i gter la 'gro //
analyzed: de la zhon pa rang gi sde ni chu'i rdzong dag nyams pa'i don du chu'i gter la 'gro //
translated: Those who ride on them go to the water treasure for the purpose of destroying the water forts of their own faction

original: gling gzung ba'i don du'o zhes pa rigs pa ste /
analyzed: gling gzung ba'i don du'o zhes pa rigs pa ste /
translated: and for the purpose of seizing the islands.🔽This is the reasoning.

original: gdug pa rnams gdul ba'i don du'o zhes pa chu'i 'khrul 'khor gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gdug pa rnams gdul ba'i don du'o zhes pa chu'i 'khrul 'khor gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: For the purpose of subduing the wicked, this is the definition of the water machine.

original: da ni ri'i rdzong bshig pa'i don du me'i 'bru mar 'phen pa la rlung gi 'khrul 'khor gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni ri'i rdzong bshig pa'i don du me'i 'bru mar 'phen pa la rlung gi 'khrul 'khor gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to destroy the mountain fortress, the wind machine is taught for throwing the fire oil.

original: chu gter zhes pa la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: chu gter zhes pa la sogs pa ste //
translated: The water treasure and so forth.

original: 'dir spang leb gru bzhi pa khru bzhi pa'i stegs bu'i dbus su ka ba khru gsum pa rgyar zlum por sor bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir spang leb gru bzhi pa khru bzhi pa'i stegs bu'i dbus su ka ba khru gsum pa rgyar zlum por sor bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: Here, in the middle of a square platform of four cubits, there is a pillar three cubits high and twelve finger-widths thick.

original: g-yon dang g-yas dang rgyab dang mdun gyi zur rnams su lcags kyi phur ba aa long dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon dang g-yas dang rgyab dang mdun gyi zur rnams su lcags kyi phur ba aa long dang bcas pa'o //
translated: At the left, right, back, and front corners there are iron spikes with rings.

original: aa long de rnams la thag pa rnams kyis ka ba'i mgo bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: aa long de rnams la thag pa rnams kyis ka ba'i mgo bcing bar bya'o //
translated: The ropes are tied to those rings and the top of the pillar.

original: 'khrul 'khor gyi cha gnyis steng dang 'og gi mthar thug par sra ba'i gos rnams kyis g-yog par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor gyi cha gnyis steng dang 'og gi mthar thug par sra ba'i gos rnams kyis g-yog par bya'o //
translated: The two parts of the machine are covered with strong cloth from top to bottom.

original: 'dir zur du rgyal mtshan rnams ni khru lnga pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir zur du rgyal mtshan rnams ni khru lnga pa ste /
translated: Here, the banners are five cubits long.

original: rgyar gcig pa'o //
analyzed: rgyar gcig pa'o //
translated: They are one cubit wide.

original: 'og dang g-yon dang g-yas kyi zur gyi aa long 'khrul gnyis @218b kyi bar thag pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'og dang g-yon dang g-yas kyi zur gyi aa long 'khrul gnyis @218b kyi bar thag pa gsum mo //
translated: The ropes are three cubits long between the rings of the lower, left, and right corners.

original: der gcig tu bsdoms pas ri'i rdzong gi dpangs kyi tshad dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: der gcig tu bsdoms pas ri'i rdzong gi dpangs kyi tshad dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: When they are combined into one, it is equal to the height of the mountain fortress.

original: thag pa des rgyab nas mi rnams dag gis drangs shing sa las thag pas steng du 'gro ste /
analyzed: thag pa des rgyab nas mi rnams dag gis drangs shing sa las thag pas steng du 'gro ste /
translated: From behind, men pull on the rope and it goes up from the ground.

original: 'khrul 'khor de ni rlung gis rab tu bskyod par gyur pa nges par brag rdzong bshig pa'i don du mkha' la 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor de ni rlung gis rab tu bskyod par gyur pa nges par brag rdzong bshig pa'i don du mkha' la 'gro ba ste /
translated: That machine, well-blown by the wind, is certain to destroy the mountain fortress.

original: de'i steng du 'khrul 'khor der me'i 'bru mar dang me dang bcas pa'i skyes bu zhig gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du 'khrul 'khor der me'i 'bru mar dang me dang bcas pa'i skyes bu zhig gzhug par bya'o //
translated: On top of that, a man with fire and oil should be placed in that machine.

original: mi des rlung gi 'khrul 'khor de nas me'i 'bru mar 'phangs pas dgra'i dpung dang rdzong ni thams cad kun nas sreg par byed ces pa ste /
analyzed: mi des rlung gi 'khrul 'khor de nas me'i 'bru mar 'phangs pas dgra'i dpung dang rdzong ni thams cad kun nas sreg par byed ces pa ste /
translated: That man throws the fire and oil from that wind machine, and it completely burns the enemy army and fortress.

original: nges par ri yi rdzong gzhom pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: nges par ri yi rdzong gzhom pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: It is certain to destroy the mountain fortress.

original: gri gug gi 'khrul 'khor ni mngon sum du mthong bas rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: gri gug gi 'khrul 'khor ni mngon sum du mthong bas rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The machine of the curved knife should be understood by direct perception.

original: tshigs su bcad pas kyang gsal bar gsungs so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pas kyang gsal bar gsungs so //
translated: It is also clearly stated in the verse.

original: de bzhin du rtse mo 'byed pa yang rlung gi 'khrul 'khor yang rab tu gsal bar byas shing tshigs su bcad pa yang gsal te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtse mo 'byed pa yang rlung gi 'khrul 'khor yang rab tu gsal bar byas shing tshigs su bcad pa yang gsal te /
translated: Likewise, the peak-opening is also clearly explained by the wind machine, and the verse is also clear.

original: 'dir 'grel bshad kyi rnam par bshad pa med do //
analyzed: 'dir 'grel bshad kyi rnam par bshad pa med do //
translated: Here there is no explanation in the commentary.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje'i gur la yang rnam par bshad pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje'i gur la yang rnam par bshad pa med do //
translated: Likewise, there is no explanation for the vajra tent.

original: da ni g-yul du glang po che go cha dang bcas pa 'bugs pa'i slang du lcags mda'i 'khrul 'khor gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni g-yul du glang po che go cha dang bcas pa 'bugs pa'i slang du lcags mda'i 'khrul 'khor gsungs te /
translated: Now, for the purpose of piercing an armored elephant in battle, the iron arrow machine is taught.

original: chur sor drug pa lcags mda'i tshad kyi wa byas nas de'i 'og dang steng dang g-yas dang g-yon gyi char lcags kyi dbyug pa sor drug pa gru bzhi pa'i rtse mor rgyas btab pa'i bug pa la lcags kyi phur pa rnams kyis mtshams gnyis dang dbu ma la
analyzed: chur sor drug pa lcags mda'i tshad kyi wa byas nas de'i 'og dang steng dang g-yas dang g-yon gyi char lcags kyi dbyug pa sor drug pa gru bzhi pa'i rtse mor rgyas btab pa'i bug pa la lcags kyi phur pa rnams kyis mtshams gnyis dang dbu ma la
translated: Having made a trap the size of an iron arrow six finger-widths long, below and above that, in the east, west, and north, one should place four iron clubs six finger-widths long with square tips and sealed holes, with iron pegs in the two intermediate directions and the center.

original: rgyud dang bcas pa'i gzhi ni g-yo ba med par btags byas nas /
analyzed: rgyud dang bcas pa'i gzhi ni g-yo ba med par btags byas nas /
translated: Having made the base with the string motionless,

original: slar yang stegs bu de'i rgyab kyi char g-yas dang cig shos su lcags kyi phur pa gru bzhi pa gnyis so //
analyzed: slar yang stegs bu de'i rgyab kyi char g-yas dang cig shos su lcags kyi phur pa gru bzhi pa gnyis so //
translated: Again, in the back of the platform, on the right and the left, two square iron stakes.

original: lcags kyi dbyug pa'i rtse mor phur pa'i bug par 'khrul shing gi rtse mo gnyis po gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: lcags kyi dbyug pa'i rtse mor phur pa'i bug par 'khrul shing gi rtse mo gnyis po gzhug par bya'o //
translated: At the top of the iron staff, in the hole of the stake, one should insert the two ends of the cross-piece.

original: 'khrul shing gi dbus su sor mo rnams te /
analyzed: 'khrul shing gi dbus su sor mo rnams te /
translated: In the middle of the cross-piece, the fingers,

original: drug gam lnga'am bzhi'am gsum mam gnyis so //
analyzed: drug gam lnga'am bzhi'am gsum mam gnyis so //
translated: six, five, four, three, or two.

original: 'og tu lcags kyi dbyug gu mthe chung gi tshad chur sor gsum pa cig 'og gi phur pa'i aa long g-yo ba dang bcas pa la gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'og tu lcags kyi dbyug gu mthe chung gi tshad chur sor gsum pa cig 'og gi phur pa'i aa long g-yo ba dang bcas pa la gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Below, an iron staff, three finger-breadths long, the size of the little finger, with a hole in the lower stake, to be moved.

original: steng du rgyud @219a * //
analyzed: steng du rgyud @219a * //
translated: Above, the strings.

original: rnams sor mo'i rtse mor bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnams sor mo'i rtse mor bcing bar bya'o //
translated: They are tied to the tips of the fingers.

original: sor mo'i rtse mo de la so so'i mtshams su lcags mda' dang rgyud rnams so //
analyzed: sor mo'i rtse mo de la so so'i mtshams su lcags mda' dang rgyud rnams so //
translated: At the tips of the fingers, between each one, iron arrows and strings.

original: rgyud des mang zhing mnyam pa'i mda' 'am lcags mda' rnon po rnams g-yul gyi dus su 'phangs pas /
analyzed: rgyud des mang zhing mnyam pa'i mda' 'am lcags mda' rnon po rnams g-yul gyi dus su 'phangs pas /
translated: By means of those strings, many arrows or iron arrows of equal size are shot at the time of battle.

original: go cha dang bcas glang chen lus po phug nas rab tu 'gro bar 'gyur zhes pa ni lcags mda'i 'khrul 'khor gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: go cha dang bcas glang chen lus po phug nas rab tu 'gro bar 'gyur zhes pa ni lcags mda'i 'khrul 'khor gyi nges pa'o //
translated: Having pierced the body of the elephant, he will go forth is the definition of the iron arrow machine.

original: da ni rgyal po'i pho brang bsrung ba'i slad du sa 'og gi ral gri'i 'khrul 'khor gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rgyal po'i pho brang bsrung ba'i slad du sa 'og gi ral gri'i 'khrul 'khor gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to protect the king's palace, the underground sword machine is taught:

original: ka ba gnyis zhes pa ste /
analyzed: ka ba gnyis zhes pa ste /
translated: Two pillars and so forth.

original: 'dir ka ba gru bzhi pa rgyar sor bcu gnyis kyi tshad khru bzhi pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir ka ba gru bzhi pa rgyar sor bcu gnyis kyi tshad khru bzhi pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, two square pillars, twelve finger-widths in width and four cubits in height,

original: khru gnyis brkos pa'i 'og tu sa la nub cing khru gnyis brkos pa'i nang du gnas pa dag go //
analyzed: khru gnyis brkos pa'i 'og tu sa la nub cing khru gnyis brkos pa'i nang du gnas pa dag go //
translated: are buried in the ground two cubits below, and stand two cubits above.

original: de la brkos pa'i gnas nas steng du khru phyed dang gnyis dor te /
analyzed: de la brkos pa'i gnas nas steng du khru phyed dang gnyis dor te /
translated: Having left two and a half cubits above the place of the hole,

original: de nas g-yon dang g-yas kyi ka ba'i bug pa la rdang bu gzhug par bya'o ;
analyzed: de nas g-yon dang g-yas kyi ka ba'i bug pa la rdang bu gzhug par bya'o ;
translated: the holes of the left and right pillars should be inserted into the hole.

original: / steng du sor drug dor nas thag pa rnams kyis dkri bar bya ste /
analyzed: / steng du sor drug dor nas thag pa rnams kyis dkri bar bya ste /
translated: Having left six finger-widths above, the ropes should be wound around.

original: zlum po g-yo ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: zlum po g-yo ba'i don du'o //
translated: The circle is for the purpose of movement.

original: thag pa de dag gi dbus kyi zlum po'i dbus su ral gri'i chang gzungs bcug pa ste /
analyzed: thag pa de dag gi dbus kyi zlum po'i dbus su ral gri'i chang gzungs bcug pa ste /
translated: In the middle of those circles, a sword-handle is inserted.

original: dang por zlum po bskor ba du ma rnams kyis bskor te /
analyzed: dang por zlum po bskor ba du ma rnams kyis bskor te /
translated: First, many circles are drawn around it.

original: zlum po'i dbus su ral gri'i chang gzungs bcug pa rtse mo'i char gzer gyis btab pa'o //
analyzed: zlum po'i dbus su ral gri'i chang gzungs bcug pa rtse mo'i char gzer gyis btab pa'o //
translated: In the middle of the circle, a sword-handle is inserted, and a nail is driven into the tip of it.

original: de bzhin du mdun nas ka ba gnyis po lugs las bzlog pas bskor ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mdun nas ka ba gnyis po lugs las bzlog pas bskor ba ste /
translated: In the same way, two posts are drawn in front of it, in the reverse order.

original: ral gri'i rtse mo la gnas pa'i phyag rgya'i rtse mo'i cha la mnan pa'i ral gri'i rtse mo'i phyag rgya'i rtse mo la thag pas mnan pa'o ;
analyzed: ral gri'i rtse mo la gnas pa'i phyag rgya'i rtse mo'i cha la mnan pa'i ral gri'i rtse mo'i phyag rgya'i rtse mo la thag pas mnan pa'o ;
translated: The tip of the seal on the tip of the sword is pressed down. The tip of the seal of the sword is pressed down with a rope.

original: / ral gri'i chang gzungs kyi rtse mo'i 'khrul shing gi cha la 'khrul shing sor drug pa'i tshad do //
analyzed: / ral gri'i chang gzungs kyi rtse mo'i 'khrul shing gi cha la 'khrul shing sor drug pa'i tshad do //
translated: The part of the crossbar on the tip of the sword-handle is the size of a six-finger-width crossbar.

original: de nas ral gri 'byung ba spangs nas spang leb rnams kyis brkos pa'i steng du g-yog par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ral gri 'byung ba spangs nas spang leb rnams kyis brkos pa'i steng du g-yog par bya'o //
translated: Then, having removed the sword, it should be placed on top of the dug-up ground.

original: gang gis bskul bar gyur pa la 'thon par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gis bskul bar gyur pa la 'thon par 'gyur te /
translated: By whom is it activated? It is activated.

original: lcags las byas pa'i chung ngu'o //
analyzed: lcags las byas pa'i chung ngu'o //
translated: The small one is made of iron.

original: zla ba zhes pa ni gsang ba'i skad do //
analyzed: zla ba zhes pa ni gsang ba'i skad do //
translated: The word “moon” is a secret term.

original: dbus zhes pa ni spros pa ste /
analyzed: dbus zhes pa ni spros pa ste /
translated: The “middle” is the spreading out.

original: 'dir ral gri'i chang gzungs kyi rtse mor 'khrul shing gi steng du spang leb sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ral gri'i chang gzungs kyi rtse mor 'khrul shing gi steng du spang leb sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Here, on the tip of the sword-wheel, a plank is to be given on top of the axle.

original: spang leb de la gang gi rkang pa bzhag pa de ni ral gri yis gcod par byed @219b do zhes pa rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //🔽ral gri'i 'khrul 'khor gyi nges pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: spang leb de la gang gi rkang pa bzhag pa de ni ral gri yis gcod par byed @219b do zhes pa rang bzhin du shes par bya'o // ral gri'i 'khrul 'khor gyi nges pa zhes pa ste /
translated: That plank, on which one’s foot is placed, is to be cut by the sword. This is to be understood as the nature.🔽This is the ascertainment of the sword-wheel.

original: ral gri'i 'khrul 'khor gyi mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
analyzed: ral gri'i 'khrul 'khor gyi mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
translated: The ascertainment of the characteristics of the sword-wheel.

original: de ltar g-yul gyi dus su mkhar gyi sgo'i mtha' dang mi'i bdag po'i khang par rtag tu rtsa ba'i sgo'i lam spangs nas 'khrul 'khor du ma rnams te /
analyzed: de ltar g-yul gyi dus su mkhar gyi sgo'i mtha' dang mi'i bdag po'i khang par rtag tu rtsa ba'i sgo'i lam spangs nas 'khrul 'khor du ma rnams te /
translated: Thus, at the time of battle, having always abandoned the path of the main gate at the end of the city gate and the house of the lord of men, the many machines,

original: 'khrul 'khor kho na mtshon cha'o zhes pa sa 'og gi ral gri'i 'khrul 'khor gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor kho na mtshon cha'o zhes pa sa 'og gi ral gri'i 'khrul 'khor gyi nges pa'o //
translated: the machines alone are the weapons. This is the ascertainment of the underground sword-wheel.

original: da ni rgyal rigs 'thab pa la shing rta'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rgyal rigs 'thab pa la shing rta'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the characteristics of a chariot are taught for the battle of the royal class.🔽

original: srog shing steng du zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: srog shing steng du zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, having taught the characteristics of the chariot in the battle of the warrior class, [the Bhagavān] declares, “The life-tree is on top,” and so on.

original: 'dir shing rta'i don du dang por srog shing brtan por bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir shing rta'i don du dang por srog shing brtan por bya'o //
translated: Here, for the sake of the chariot, first the life-tree is made firm.

original: rta rnams kyi shing rta'i 'khor lo'i tshad ni phyed dang bcas pa'i khru gnyis so //
analyzed: rta rnams kyi shing rta'i 'khor lo'i tshad ni phyed dang bcas pa'i khru gnyis so //
translated: The size of the chariot wheel of the horses is two cubits and a half.

original: srog shing ni bzhi 'gyur cung zad lhag pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: srog shing ni bzhi 'gyur cung zad lhag pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The life-tree is four times that, with a little more.

original: tshad de nyid kyis gru bzhi dang zlum po'o //
analyzed: tshad de nyid kyis gru bzhi dang zlum po'o //
translated: By that very measure, it is square and round.

original: de nas srog shing gi steng du gdan te /
analyzed: de nas srog shing gi steng du gdan te /
translated: Then, on top of the life-tree, there is the seat.

original: phyogs brgyad dang dbus su 'khor lo'i tshad las dgu cha'i re mig bdag nyid do //
analyzed: phyogs brgyad dang dbus su 'khor lo'i tshad las dgu cha'i re mig bdag nyid do //
translated: In the eight directions and the center, the size of the wheel is one square of nine parts.

original: de nyid ni nyi ma'i lag pas zhes pa rgyar sor drug pa'i lag pa bcu gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: de nyid ni nyi ma'i lag pas zhes pa rgyar sor drug pa'i lag pa bcu gnyis kyis te /
translated: That very [seat] is “with the hand of the sun,” with twelve hands six fingers wide.

original: shar dang nub kyi drug dang lho dang byang gi drug gis gdan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shar dang nub kyi drug dang lho dang byang gi drug gis gdan du 'gyur ro //
translated: The east and west [hands] are six, and the south and north are six, making the seat.

original: srog shing rgyar sor bcu bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: srog shing rgyar sor bcu bzhi pa ste /
translated: The life-tree is fourteen finger-widths wide.

original: de cha gsum du byas nas dbus kyi cha spangs te /
analyzed: de cha gsum du byas nas dbus kyi cha spangs te /
translated: Having divided it into three parts, one should abandon the middle part.

original: rtse mo gnyis kyi gnas su bug pa bya'o //
analyzed: rtse mo gnyis kyi gnas su bug pa bya'o //
translated: One should make a hole in the place of the two tips.

original: bug pa de dag tu 'khor lo'i rtsibs bcug nas srog shing dang lhan cig gzer gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: bug pa de dag tu 'khor lo'i rtsibs bcug nas srog shing dang lhan cig gzer gdab par bya'o //
translated: Having inserted the spokes of the wheel into those holes, one should drive in a bolt together with the life-wood.

original: 'khor lo'i mu khyud la lcags kyi 'khrul shing g-yo ba med pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo'i mu khyud la lcags kyi 'khrul shing g-yo ba med pa ste /
translated: On the circumference of the wheel, one should place a fixed iron axle.

original: gzhi'i bug pa zlum po la bcug pa 'khor lo dang bcas pa 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: gzhi'i bug pa zlum po la bcug pa 'khor lo dang bcas pa 'khor ba'o //
translated: Having inserted the round hole of the base, together with the wheel, it turns.

original: de nas gdan de'i zur bzhi rnams su rgyar gnas kyi lag pa dang chur nyis 'gyur gyi ka ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: de nas gdan de'i zur bzhi rnams su rgyar gnas kyi lag pa dang chur nyis 'gyur gyi ka ba bzhi ste /
translated: Then, in the four corners of that base, there are four pillars, twice as deep as the width of the base.

original: de rnams kyang rdang bu rnams kyis phyogs bzhi rnams su phye ba dang 'og dang steng du phye pa'o //🔽mnyam pa'i shing rta ni mnyam pa'i rta rnams kyis bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang rdang bu rnams kyis phyogs bzhi rnams su phye ba dang 'og dang steng du phye pa'o // mnyam pa'i shing rta ni mnyam pa'i rta rnams kyis bskyod pa'o //
translated: Those are also divided into the four directions by the beams, and divided above and below.🔽An even chariot is moved by even horses.

original: mi mnyam pa'i shing rta ni mi mnyam pa'i rta rnams kyis bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa'i shing rta ni mi mnyam pa'i rta rnams kyis bskyod pa'o //
translated: An uneven chariot is moved by uneven horses.

original: gnyis dang bzhi dang drug ni mnyam pa'i rta rnams so //
analyzed: gnyis dang bzhi dang drug ni mnyam pa'i rta rnams so //
translated: Two, four, and six are the horses of the even.

original: gsum dang lnga dang bdun ni mi mnyam pa'i rta rnams so //🔽mi mnyam @220a * //
analyzed: gsum dang lnga dang bdun ni mi mnyam pa'i rta rnams so // mi mnyam @220a * //
translated: Three, five, and seven are the horses of the uneven.

original: pa'i shing rta ni gnas las mnyam pa'i phyed kyi tshad kyis so //
analyzed: pa'i shing rta ni gnas las mnyam pa'i phyed kyi tshad kyis so //
translated: The uneven chariot is by the measure of half the even.🔽The battleground is on the half-parts above.

original: steng gi cha phyed dag la 'thab mo pa'i sa ste zhes pa ni steng gi ka ba rnams kyi cha gcig gnas kyi tshad dor nas cha phyed la gnas steng du 'thab mo pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: steng gi cha phyed dag la 'thab mo pa'i sa ste zhes pa ni steng gi ka ba rnams kyi cha gcig gnas kyi tshad dor nas cha phyed la gnas steng du 'thab mo pa'i sa'o //
translated: Having removed one part of the upper pillars, on the half-part is the battleground above.

original: gnas kyi phyed kyi tshad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas kyi phyed kyi tshad du 'gyur te /
translated: It becomes the measure of half the site.

original: mnyam dang mi mnyam 'dren byed rta'am glang po rnams kyi dpangs kyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnyam dang mi mnyam 'dren byed rta'am glang po rnams kyi dpangs kyis 'gyur ro //
translated: The even and uneven are drawn by horses or elephants, by the height of the horses or elephants.

original: rgyar sor brgyad dang chur gnas kyi nyis 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyar sor brgyad dang chur gnas kyi nyis 'gyur te /
translated: In width, it is eight finger-widths and in depth, the double of the site.

original: rdang bu rnams dang lhan cig gzer gdab bo //
analyzed: rdang bu rnams dang lhan cig gzer gdab bo //
translated: Together with the rafters, it is pierced by pegs.

original: de nas gnas kyi cha'i 'og dang steng du mtshan ma'i phyed kyi sar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas gnas kyi cha'i 'og dang steng du mtshan ma'i phyed kyi sar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, below and above the part of the site, it becomes the half-part of the sign.

original: sor mo bzhi'i steng du'o //
analyzed: sor mo bzhi'i steng du'o //
translated: It is four finger-widths above.

original: sa de la me long do shal rgyal mtshan la sogs bkod pa ste /
analyzed: sa de la me long do shal rgyal mtshan la sogs bkod pa ste /
translated: On this level, there is the mirror, the necklace, the banner, and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras rnga yab dang bla re dang dril bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras rnga yab dang bla re dang dril bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word “and so on” refers to the yak-tail fan, the canopy, the bell, and so on.

original: 'thab mo pa'i sa dang mtshan ma'i sa dag gi dbus su 'thab mo'i don du phyogs bzhi rnams su rab tu gsal ba'o //
analyzed: 'thab mo pa'i sa dang mtshan ma'i sa dag gi dbus su 'thab mo'i don du phyogs bzhi rnams su rab tu gsal ba'o //
translated: In the middle of the level of the fighters and the level of the signs, there are four directions for the sake of the fight, which are very clear.

original: gcig phyed cha gnyis dag ste zhes pa ni rtsa ba'i gnas kyi 'og tu 'thab mo pa'i sa la cha gcig go //
analyzed: gcig phyed cha gnyis dag ste zhes pa ni rtsa ba'i gnas kyi 'og tu 'thab mo pa'i sa la cha gcig go //
translated: One part, two parts, and so on, means that below the fundamental place, on the level of the fighters, there is one part.

original: rab tu gsal ba la cha phyed dang mtshan ma dag ste /
analyzed: rab tu gsal ba la cha phyed dang mtshan ma dag ste /
translated: On the very clear [level], there are two parts of the signs.

original: 'di dag ni cha mnyam mo //
analyzed: 'di dag ni cha mnyam mo //
translated: These are equal parts.

original: zla ba lag pa rtse mo can rnams zhes pa ni ka ba'i rdang bu rnams kyi rtsa ba'i gnas kyi steng du 'dren pa'i gnas la sor bzhi pa rnams kyi cha gcig go //
analyzed: zla ba lag pa rtse mo can rnams zhes pa ni ka ba'i rdang bu rnams kyi rtsa ba'i gnas kyi steng du 'dren pa'i gnas la sor bzhi pa rnams kyi cha gcig go //
translated: The moon, the hand, and the peak, means that on the fundamental place of the capital pillars, there is one part of the four finger-widths of the place of the leader.

original: de nas ka ba rnams kyis 'thab mo pa 'thab pa'i gnas la sor bzhi pa rnams kyi cha gnyis so //
analyzed: de nas ka ba rnams kyis 'thab mo pa 'thab pa'i gnas la sor bzhi pa rnams kyi cha gnyis so //
translated: Then, on the capital pillars, there are two parts of the four finger-widths of the place of the fight of the fighters.

original: de nas ka ba rnams kyi steng du sor bzhi pa rnams kyi cha gsum ste /
analyzed: de nas ka ba rnams kyi steng du sor bzhi pa rnams kyi cha gsum ste /
translated: Then, on top of the pillars, there are three parts of four fingerbreadths each.

original: de'i steng du rgyal mtshan la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan ma'i sa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du rgyal mtshan la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan ma'i sa'o //
translated: On top of that, there is the ground of the victory banners, and so on.

original: zlum po phyed bcas gcig gi cha la gnas dang steng du sngar brjod pa rnams so //
analyzed: zlum po phyed bcas gcig gi cha la gnas dang steng du sngar brjod pa rnams so //
translated: The half-circle is one part, and above that are the previously mentioned [parts].

original: phyed dang bcas pa'i cha las zlum po'o //
analyzed: phyed dang bcas pa'i cha las zlum po'o //
translated: The circle is from the half-part.

original: dga' ba'i dbye ba dag la zhes pa ni dga' ba'i shing rta'i dbye ba la padma'i shing rta'i sa gru bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' ba'i dbye ba dag la zhes pa ni dga' ba'i shing rta'i dbye ba la padma'i shing rta'i sa gru bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: The divisions of joy are the divisions of the chariot of joy. The ground of the lotus chariot is square.

original: de ltar gsungs pa'i rim pas rten dang bcas pa'i 'khor lo'i tshad ni rta'i shing rta la phyed dang bcas pa'i khrur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gsungs pa'i rim pas rten dang bcas pa'i 'khor lo'i tshad ni rta'i shing rta la phyed dang bcas pa'i khrur 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, the measure of the wheel with its support, according to the stated sequence, is half a cubit in the horse chariot.

original: glang po'i shing rta la rta'i shing rta'i tshad las tshad rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: glang po'i shing rta la rta'i shing rta'i tshad las tshad rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: In the elephant chariot, the measure is twice the measure of the horse chariot.

original: 'khor lo dang gnas dang rdang bu dang mtshan @220b ma la sogs pa rnams kyi'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo dang gnas dang rdang bu dang mtshan @220b ma la sogs pa rnams kyi'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: The wheel, the ground, the axle, the flagpole, and so on, are the definite [parts].

original: 'dir lha rnams kyis ni padma'i rigs kyi shing rta zlum por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir lha rnams kyis ni padma'i rigs kyi shing rta zlum por 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the gods have a chariot of the lotus type, which is round.

original: lha yi bu yis bkod pa zhes pa sring sgrub kyi shing rta ni dga' ba'i rigs te gru bzhi'o //
analyzed: lha yi bu yis bkod pa zhes pa sring sgrub kyi shing rta ni dga' ba'i rigs te gru bzhi'o //
translated: The son of the gods has a chariot called Array, which is of the type of joy, and is square.

original: mi gzhan rnams kyi yang shing rta bkod pa ni gru bzhi ste rgyal rigs rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: mi gzhan rnams kyi yang shing rta bkod pa ni gru bzhi ste rgyal rigs rnams kyi'o //
translated: The chariots of other men are also square, and are of the type of the warrior class.

original: brgyad dang chu gter srog shing 'khor lo rnams kyis rnam gsum 'dir ni shing rta chen po phyed dang mnyam zhes pa ni 'dir srog shing bzhi dang 'khor lo brgyad kyis g-yul du phyir mi ldog pa'i shing rta chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brgyad dang chu gter srog shing 'khor lo rnams kyis rnam gsum 'dir ni shing rta chen po phyed dang mnyam zhes pa ni 'dir srog shing bzhi dang 'khor lo brgyad kyis g-yul du phyir mi ldog pa'i shing rta chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, a great chariot is half equal to one with three parts, with eight, a life-tree, and wheels. Here, with four life-trees and eight wheels, there is a great chariot that does not turn back in battle.

original: 'og dang steng du srog shing dag dang 'khor lo bzhi yis shing rta phyed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'og dang steng du srog shing dag dang 'khor lo bzhi yis shing rta phyed du 'gyur ro //
translated: With life-trees above and below, and four wheels, there is a half chariot.

original: de'i phyir brgyad ces pa ni 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brgyad ces pa ni 'khor lo'o //
translated: Therefore, “eight” refers to the wheels.

original: chu gter zhes pa ni srog shing bzhi'o //
analyzed: chu gter zhes pa ni srog shing bzhi'o //
translated: “Ocean” refers to the four life-trees.

original: de ltar rnam gsum zhes pa ste 'khor lo bzhi dang de bzhin du gnyis so //
analyzed: de ltar rnam gsum zhes pa ste 'khor lo bzhi dang de bzhin du gnyis so //
translated: Thus, the three types, i.e., the four wheels and likewise the two.

original: de bzhin du srog shing ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du srog shing ngo //
translated: Likewise, the life-tree.

original: shing rta ni shing rta'i phyed dang mnyam pa ste mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: shing rta ni shing rta'i phyed dang mnyam pa ste mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The chariot is equal to half of the chariot, i.e., equal.

original: nyi ma'i shing rta mchog ni 'khor lo gcig pa zhes pa ni 'khor lo gcig gis lha rnams kyi shing rtar 'gyur te de bzhin du nyi ma la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma'i shing rta mchog ni 'khor lo gcig pa zhes pa ni 'khor lo gcig gis lha rnams kyi shing rtar 'gyur te de bzhin du nyi ma la 'gyur ro //
translated: The supreme chariot of the sun is the single wheel, i.e., the chariot of the gods is by a single wheel, and likewise for the sun.

original: mi mnyam zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The uneven, etc., are easy to understand.

original: srog shing gcig dang 'khor lo gnyis kyis mnyam pa'i shing rta ste gnya' shing gi rgyab bcom par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni shing rta'i mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
analyzed: srog shing gcig dang 'khor lo gnyis kyis mnyam pa'i shing rta ste gnya' shing gi rgyab bcom par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni shing rta'i mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
translated: The chariot is equal by a single life-tree and two wheels, i.e., the back of the yoke is destroyed. This is the definition of the chariot.

original: da ni lha rnams kyi gzhal yas khang mi bdag rnams kyi ltad mo la bskyod pa'i khyim gyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa drug ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni lha rnams kyi gzhal yas khang mi bdag rnams kyi ltad mo la bskyod pa'i khyim gyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa drug ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the definition of the house of the gods, the moving house of the lords of men, is stated by six, etc.

original: 'dir ka ba khru nyi shu pa rgyar sor nyi shu pa bzhi ste 'di rnams kyi mtha' bzhir bug pa mnyam pa rnams su 'gyur te bug pa'i mtha' gcig ni khru drug gi cha la'o //
analyzed: 'dir ka ba khru nyi shu pa rgyar sor nyi shu pa bzhi ste 'di rnams kyi mtha' bzhir bug pa mnyam pa rnams su 'gyur te bug pa'i mtha' gcig ni khru drug gi cha la'o //
translated: Here, there are four pillars, twenty cubits high and twenty finger-widths wide. The four corners of these pillars are equal to the openings. One end of the opening is six cubits.

original: gnyis pa ni khru lnga'i cha la'o //🔽de la gsum pa ni khru bzhi'i cha la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni khru lnga'i cha la'o // de la gsum pa ni khru bzhi'i cha la 'gyur ro //
translated: The second is five cubits.🔽The third is four cubits.

original: bzhi pa ni khru gsum gyi cha la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni khru gsum gyi cha la 'gyur ro //
translated: The fourth is three cubits.

original: 'og dang steng du khru re re dor nas bug pa'i mtha' mngon du phyogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'og dang steng du khru re re dor nas bug pa'i mtha' mngon du phyogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having left one cubit above and below, the ends of the opening face outward.

original: rtsa ba'i char sa la khru bcu gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i char sa la khru bcu gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: The base is thirteen cubits.

original: rtsa ba'i cha las steng du sa la phyed kyi cha khru phyed dang bdun du 'gyur te rtseg ma so so'i dbang gis rtseg ma'i sa la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i cha las steng du sa la phyed kyi cha khru phyed dang bdun du 'gyur te rtseg ma so so'i dbang gis rtseg ma'i sa la 'gyur ro //
translated: From the base, above, the half-part is seven and a half cubits. The levels are individual levels by the power of the stories.

original: tshogs kyi gzhal yas khang la rdang bu bzhi bzhi'i steng du sar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshogs kyi gzhal yas khang la rdang bu bzhi bzhi'i steng du sar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the celestial mansion of the assembly, there are four stories above each pillar.

original: @221a * // de bzhin du sa la mi bdag rnams kyi rtseg ma rnam pa gsum gyi dbang gis yul gyi ltad mo dang dga' ston rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: @221a * // de bzhin du sa la mi bdag rnams kyi rtseg ma rnam pa gsum gyi dbang gis yul gyi ltad mo dang dga' ston rnams la yang ngo //
translated: Likewise, in the land, due to the power of the three stories of the king's palace, there are also the spectacles and festivals of the country.

original: dang po'i rtseg ma la ka ba'i phyi rol gyi bug pa las phyi rol tu byung ba'i rdang bu'i steng du spang leb rnams kyis thams cad du 'khor ba ni khru gsum gyis 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: dang po'i rtseg ma la ka ba'i phyi rol gyi bug pa las phyi rol tu byung ba'i rdang bu'i steng du spang leb rnams kyis thams cad du 'khor ba ni khru gsum gyis 'khor ba'o //
translated: On the first story, outside the pillars, the boards that come out from the holes are on top of the beams, and the planks go all around, going around three cubits.

original: gnyis pa'i rtseg ma la phyogs thams cad du khru gcig 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i rtseg ma la phyogs thams cad du khru gcig 'khor ba'o //
translated: On the second story, they go around in all directions one cubit.

original: lha'i gzhal yas khang dang bgrod pa'i khyim gyi mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i gzhal yas khang dang bgrod pa'i khyim gyi mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of the celestial palace and the house of travel are ascertained.

original: da ni dpyid kyi dga' ston gyi slad du 'khor lo'i khyogs kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa 'khor lo'i steng du zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni dpyid kyi dga' ston gyi slad du 'khor lo'i khyogs kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa 'khor lo'i steng du zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, for the sake of the spring festival, the characteristics of the wheel palanquin are stated: On top of the wheel, etc.

original: 'dir sngar gyi shing rta bzhi pa /
analyzed: 'dir sngar gyi shing rta bzhi pa /
translated: Here, the four previous chariots

original: 'khor lo brgyad dang rtsa ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: 'khor lo brgyad dang rtsa ba'i gnas so //
translated: are the eight wheels and the fundamental abode.

original: de'i steng du glang po che'i shing rta'i ka ba'i khyon gyis ka pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du glang po che'i shing rta'i ka ba'i khyon gyis ka pa bzhi'o //
translated: On top of that, the area of the elephant chariot's pillars is four kapas.

original: gzhal yas khang bzhin du rtseg ma rnam pa gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi phyogs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhal yas khang bzhin du rtseg ma rnam pa gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi phyogs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Like the celestial mansion, it has three stories.

original: rdang bu bzhi bzhi'i steng du brgyad gnyis brgyad dang de nas phyed de zhes pa ni rtseg ma dang po la phyogs bzhi rnams su khyogs bcu drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdang bu bzhi bzhi'i steng du brgyad gnyis brgyad dang de nas phyed de zhes pa ni rtseg ma dang po la phyogs bzhi rnams su khyogs bcu drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: On top of the four sets of four pillars, eight times two is sixteen, and then half of that, that is, eight. On the first story, in the four directions, there are sixteen platforms.

original: gnyis pa la brgyad do //
analyzed: gnyis pa la brgyad do //
translated: On the second, there are eight.

original: gsum pa la bzhi'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la bzhi'o //
translated: On the third, there are four.

original: rtseg ma dang po la phyogs te lag pa bcu rdang bu'i steng na gnas shing g-yas dang g-yon dang shar dang nub na gnas pa rnams kyi khyogs so //
analyzed: rtseg ma dang po la phyogs te lag pa bcu rdang bu'i steng na gnas shing g-yas dang g-yon dang shar dang nub na gnas pa rnams kyi khyogs so //
translated: On the first story, in the four directions, there are ten pillars on top of the pillars, and the platforms are on the right, left, east, and west.

original: gnyis pa la dus te drug gis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa la dus te drug gis 'gyur ro //
translated: On the second, there are six.

original: gsum pa la bzhis so //
analyzed: gsum pa la bzhis so //
translated: On the third, there are four.

original: khyogs rnams kyi lag pa rten nyid sa gsum la zhes pa ste lag pa gnyis gnyis la 'khrul shing re re bug pa'i gzhi la bcug pa'o //
analyzed: khyogs rnams kyi lag pa rten nyid sa gsum la zhes pa ste lag pa gnyis gnyis la 'khrul shing re re bug pa'i gzhi la bcug pa'o //
translated: The pillars of the platforms are the three supports, that is, two pillars each, with a hole in the base for each pillar.

original: 'khrul shing re re la bu mo rnams kyi gdan bzhi bzhir 'gyur te nang dang phyi rol dag tu gnas pa 'og dang steng du son zhing phyogs brgyad du ni 'khyog pa rnams zhes pa ni 'khor lo'i khyogs kyi mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul shing re re la bu mo rnams kyi gdan bzhi bzhir 'gyur te nang dang phyi rol dag tu gnas pa 'og dang steng du son zhing phyogs brgyad du ni 'khyog pa rnams zhes pa ni 'khor lo'i khyogs kyi mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
translated: For each of the four girls there are four seats, which are located inside and outside, above and below, and which are crooked in the eight directions. This is the definition of the wheel-palanquin.

original: da ni ldum ra la sogs pa bcu pa'i don du chu'i 'khrul 'khor gyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa steng zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni ldum ra la sogs pa bcu pa'i don du chu'i 'khrul 'khor gyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa steng zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, in order to explain the meaning of the tenth chapter, the garden, etc., he states the definition of the water machine:

original: steng dang 'og dang g-yon dang g-yas su 'khrul 'khor 'khyog po sbubs kyi rnam pa'o /
analyzed: steng dang 'og dang g-yon dang g-yas su 'khrul 'khor 'khyog po sbubs kyi rnam pa'o /
translated: above, below, to the left, and to the right, the machine is crooked, tubular in form.

original: dbus su bug pa dang bcas pa'i dbu ma khru bzhi pa ni rtsa ba'i 'khrul 'khor ro //
analyzed: dbus su bug pa dang bcas pa'i dbu ma khru bzhi pa ni rtsa ba'i 'khrul 'khor ro //
translated: In the middle, the central channel, four cubits long, with an opening, is the basic machine.

original: de'i sbubs kyi rtse mo la bum pa'i kha'i mgrin pa'i sbubs kyi rtse mo bcug par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sbubs kyi rtse mo la bum pa'i kha'i mgrin pa'i sbubs kyi rtse mo bcug par gyur pa'o //
translated: At the tip of its tube, the tip of the tube of the neck of the vase is inserted.

original: 'og tu bum pa la bug pa ni sbubs kyi bug pa'i @221b tshad do //
analyzed: 'og tu bum pa la bug pa ni sbubs kyi bug pa'i @221b tshad do //
translated: Below, the opening in the vase is the size of the opening of the tube.

original: 'khrul 'khor gyi rgyab tu sbubs kyi rtse mor sbubs gzhan chu'i nang du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor gyi rgyab tu sbubs kyi rtse mor sbubs gzhan chu'i nang du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Behind the machine, at the tip of the tube, another tube should be inserted into the water.

original: de nas bum pa'i bug pa dang chur son pa'i sbubs kyi bug pa'am sbubs kyi bug pa mdun nas rgyas gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bum pa'i bug pa dang chur son pa'i sbubs kyi bug pa'am sbubs kyi bug pa mdun nas rgyas gdab par bya'o //
translated: Then the hole of the pot and the hole of the tube reaching into the water or the hole of the tube should be covered from the front.

original: de nas ji srid 'khrul 'khor chus gang bar gyur gyi bar du rtsa ba'i 'khrul 'khor gyi dbus su bug pa nas chu gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ji srid 'khrul 'khor chus gang bar gyur gyi bar du rtsa ba'i 'khrul 'khor gyi dbus su bug pa nas chu gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then, as long as the machine is filled with water, water should be poured through the hole in the center of the basic machine.

original: de nas chu'i nang gi bug pa'am bum pa'i bug pa dang sbubs kyi bug pas cig car mtsho las bum par chu 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: de nas chu'i nang gi bug pa'am bum pa'i bug pa dang sbubs kyi bug pas cig car mtsho las bum par chu 'dren par byed do //
translated: Then, through the hole in the water or the hole of the pot and the tube, water is drawn from the lake into the pot simultaneously.

original: chu de nyid skyed mos tshal lam ldum rar 'gro ste mnyam pa'i sa la gang du drangs pa der ni 'gro bar 'gyur zhes pa chu bcu pa'i 'khrul 'khor gyi mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
analyzed: chu de nyid skyed mos tshal lam ldum rar 'gro ste mnyam pa'i sa la gang du drangs pa der ni 'gro bar 'gyur zhes pa chu bcu pa'i 'khrul 'khor gyi mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
translated: That water goes to a garden or a pond, and wherever it is drawn, it will go. This is the definition of the machine of the tenth water drawing.

original: da ni 'jam dpal gyis nyi ma'i shing rta la nges pa sbyin pa gsungs pa rab mchog ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni 'jam dpal gyis nyi ma'i shing rta la nges pa sbyin pa gsungs pa rab mchog ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, Mañjuśrī teaches the bestowal of certainty to Sūryaratha:

original: 'dir gdug pa can rnams bsgrub pa'i don du dang po'i sangs rgyas su ni srid gsum bla ma sh'akya seng ges phyag na rdo rje'i sprul pa'i sku zla ba bzang po la dbyangs 'char ba dang 'khrul 'khor gyi mtshan nyid thams cad sngon du gsungs pa gang yin
analyzed: 'dir gdug pa can rnams bsgrub pa'i don du dang po'i sangs rgyas su ni srid gsum bla ma sh'akya seng ges phyag na rdo rje'i sprul pa'i sku zla ba bzang po la dbyangs 'char ba dang 'khrul 'khor gyi mtshan nyid thams cad sngon du gsungs pa gang yin
translated: Here, for the sake of accomplishing the wicked, the Lion of the Śākyas, the Guru of the Three Worlds, first taught to the emanation of Vajrapāṇi, Sucandra, the arising of the vowels and all the characteristics of the yantras.

original: pa de yi nang nas te dbyangs 'char ba dang 'khrul 'khor brjod pa de'i nang nas 'dir ni de ring sham bha la zhes bya ba'i yul 'dir nyi ma'i shing rta khyod la 'jam dpal mi'i dbang po grags pa bdag gis gsal bar bstan to //
analyzed: pa de yi nang nas te dbyangs 'char ba dang 'khrul 'khor brjod pa de'i nang nas 'dir ni de ring sham bha la zhes bya ba'i yul 'dir nyi ma'i shing rta khyod la 'jam dpal mi'i dbang po grags pa bdag gis gsal bar bstan to //
translated: From among those, from within the arising of the vowels and the description of the yantras, here today in this land called Śambhala, Mañjuśrī, the lord of men, the famous one, has clearly taught to you, Sūryaratha.

original: rang gnas bsrung ba'i don du 'di dag mtha' dag gyis shig zhe sdang chags pas min no nyi ma kye zhes pa ste nyi ma'i shing rta'i nges pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dus kyi 'khor lo yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa gzhan rnams kyi yang
analyzed: rang gnas bsrung ba'i don du 'di dag mtha' dag gyis shig zhe sdang chags pas min no nyi ma kye zhes pa ste nyi ma'i shing rta'i nges pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dus kyi 'khor lo yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa gzhan rnams kyi yang
translated: For the sake of protecting one's own place, all of these should be done, not out of hatred or attachment.  O Sun! - just as the certainty of the chariot of the sun is, so too is the complete knowledge of the Wheel of Time of others.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the certainty of the Bhagavān.

original: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las dbyangs 'char ba dang 'khrul 'khor gyi cho ga nges pa'i mdor bsdus chen po ste bcu pa'o //
analyzed: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las dbyangs 'char ba dang 'khrul 'khor gyi cho ga nges pa'i mdor bsdus chen po ste bcu pa'o //
translated: From the Stainless Light, the commentary on the twelve-thousand-verse King of Tantras, the Wheel of Time, the supreme primordial buddha, this is the tenth great summary, the section on the certainty of the sounds and the certainty of the yantras.

original: da ni 'khor los sgyur ba chen pos kla klo'i chos 'joms pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos rab tu 'jog pa nyid la sogs pa go sla ste des na 'grel bshad du ma brjod do //
analyzed: da ni 'khor los sgyur ba chen pos kla klo'i chos 'joms pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos rab tu 'jog pa nyid la sogs pa go sla ste des na 'grel bshad du ma brjod do //
translated: Now, the great cakravartin's destruction of the barbarian religion and establishment of the Buddha's teachings, and so forth, are easy to understand, so it is not explained in the commentary.

original: 'jig rten khams kyi le'u'i 'grel bshad rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'jig rten khams kyi le'u'i 'grel bshad rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the chapter of the world realms is complete.

original: // / @222a * //  dpal dus kyi 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: // / @222a * //  dpal dus kyi 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to glorious Kālacakra.

original: gang zhig chen po'i mi rnams smin par bya ba'i don du mngal ni 'dzin pa 'di mdzad cing //
analyzed: gang zhig chen po'i mi rnams smin par bya ba'i don du mngal ni 'dzin pa 'di mdzad cing //
translated: He who, for the sake of ripening great beings, takes on a womb,

original: srid pa'i 'ching las nges par grol yang srog chags rnams kyi lam gyi slad du srid pa ste //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'ching las nges par grol yang srog chags rnams kyi lam gyi slad du srid pa ste //
translated: and, though definitely liberated from the bonds of existence, for the sake of the path of living beings, existence,

original: sna tshogs skyes rabs phreng ba yon tan dang ldan sems can don gnyer rnams kyis mthong gyur pa //
analyzed: sna tshogs skyes rabs phreng ba yon tan dang ldan sems can don gnyer rnams kyis mthong gyur pa //
translated: the garland of various birth stories, seen by those who strive for the benefit of sentient beings endowed with good qualities,

original: dang po'i sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul che ldan spyod pa dag ste skyob pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dang po'i sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul che ldan spyod pa dag ste skyob pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: the conduct of the primordial buddha endowed with great miraculous powers, I pay homage to that protector.

original: sh'akya seng ge de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: sh'akya seng ge de bzhin gshegs //
translated: The Tathāgata Śākyasiṃha,

original: dpal ldan rdo rje sems dpa' la //
analyzed: dpal ldan rdo rje sems dpa' la //
translated: to the glorious Vajrasattva,

original: btud de padma dkar po dpal //
analyzed: btud de padma dkar po dpal //
translated: bowing to the glorious White Lotus,

original: 'jam dpal gyis ni bskul gyur zhing //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis ni bskul gyur zhing //
translated: urged on by Mañjuśrī,

original: bde bar gshegs pas lung bstan pa //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas lung bstan pa //
translated: the one prophesied by the Sugata,

original: 'gro la snying rje'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: 'gro la snying rje'i bdag nyid can //
translated: the one with a nature of compassion for beings,

original: 'jig rten mgon po bdag gis ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po bdag gis ni //
translated: I, Lokanatha,

original: nang gi le'u'i 'grel bshad bri //
analyzed: nang gi le'u'i 'grel bshad bri //
translated: have written the commentary on the Inner Chapter.

original: 'dir dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa'i shar sgo'i mthar dpal ldan rin po che'i khang  bzangs chen po rin po che'i seng ge'i khri la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: 'dir dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa'i shar sgo'i mthar dpal ldan rin po che'i khang  bzangs chen po rin po che'i seng ge'i khri la bzhugs pa /
translated: Here, at the end of the eastern door of the mandala palace of Shri Kalachakra, the glorious and precious great mansion, seated on a precious lion throne,

original: nyi ma'i shing rtas gsol ba btab par gyur pa /
analyzed: nyi ma'i shing rtas gsol ba btab par gyur pa /
translated: is the one who is requested by Suryadeva.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyi sprul pa'i sku /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyi sprul pa'i sku /
translated: The Bhagavān, the nirmāṇakāya of Mañjuśrī,🔽the lord of men, is requested by Sucandra to explain the meaning of the Inner Chapter to Bhagavān Śākyamuni, the supreme primordial buddha.

original: mi'i dbang po grags pas nang gi le'u bstan pa'i don du mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la zla ba bzang pos gsol ba btab pa tshigs su bcad pa dang po gsungs pa /
analyzed: mi'i dbang po grags pas nang gi le'u bstan pa'i don du mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la zla ba bzang pos gsol ba btab pa tshigs su bcad pa dang po gsungs pa /
translated: The first verse is spoken:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus it is:

original: mi shes sna tshogs tshad ni gang dag rgyal ba skyed mdzad khyod kyis bstan pa rnams kyang bdag gis te //
analyzed: mi shes sna tshogs tshad ni gang dag rgyal ba skyed mdzad khyod kyis bstan pa rnams kyang bdag gis te //
translated: The various immeasurable ignorances that are taught by you, the Victorious One, the producer of the Victorious Ones, are mine as well.

original: slar yang bdag ni nyan par 'tshal lo srid pa gsum po mtha' dag lus kyi dbus su ji ltar lags //
analyzed: slar yang bdag ni nyan par 'tshal lo srid pa gsum po mtha' dag lus kyi dbus su ji ltar lags //
translated: Again, I wish to listen, O Blessed One, how the three existences are in the middle of the body.

original: zla ba bzang po'i tshig dag gsan nas bde bar gshegs pas legs zhes bya ba byin nas rab gsungs pa //
analyzed: zla ba bzang po'i tshig dag gsan nas bde bar gshegs pas legs zhes bya ba byin nas rab gsungs pa //
translated: Having heard the words of Sucandra, the Sugata gave his approval and spoke:

original: sems can rnams ni thar pa'i slad du mchog gi thugs rjes sna tshogs tshad rnams dag kyang lus la'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni thar pa'i slad du mchog gi thugs rjes sna tshogs tshad rnams dag kyang lus la'o //
translated: For the sake of the liberation of beings, the various measures are also in the body, O Great Being, through supreme compassion.

original: 'dir nang gi le'u la mi shes zhes pa la sogs pas gsol ba 'debs pa po dang ston pa po bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yang dag par sdud par mdzad pa po 'jam dpal gyis bsdus pa'i rgyud las bstan pa ni bdag gis dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir nang gi le'u la mi shes zhes pa la sogs pas gsol ba 'debs pa po dang ston pa po bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yang dag par sdud par mdzad pa po 'jam dpal gyis bsdus pa'i rgyud las bstan pa ni bdag gis dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: Here, in the chapter on the inner, the one who supplicates and the teacher are summarized in the verse I do not know... The one who compiles the tantra, Mañjuśrī, will release what is taught in the compiled tantra.

original: 'dir @222b lus kyi dbus su sna tshogs tshad ni mi shes te rgyal ba skyed mdzad ces pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' sh'akya thub pa sgrib pa med pa'i phung po rnams skyed par mdzad pa ni rgyal ba skyed mdzad yin pas de la bod pa ste kye
analyzed: 'dir @222b lus kyi dbus su sna tshogs tshad ni mi shes te rgyal ba skyed mdzad ces pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' sh'akya thub pa sgrib pa med pa'i phung po rnams skyed par mdzad pa ni rgyal ba skyed mdzad yin pas de la bod pa ste kye
translated: The victor-producer is Vajrasattva Shakyamuni, who produces the unobstructed aggregates. Since he is the victor-producer, he is addressed: Hey, Victor-Producer!

original: rgyal ba skyed mdzad khyod kyis phyi rol du sna tshogs tshad ni gang dag bstan pa de dag lus la mi shes so //
analyzed: rgyal ba skyed mdzad khyod kyis phyi rol du sna tshogs tshad ni gang dag bstan pa de dag lus la mi shes so //
translated: The extent of the various [elements] that you have taught externally is not known in the body.

original: de'i phyir slar yang bdag ni nyan par 'tshal lo srid pa gsum po mtha' dag lus kyi dbus su ji ltar te rnam pa gang gis 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir slar yang bdag ni nyan par 'tshal lo srid pa gsum po mtha' dag lus kyi dbus su ji ltar te rnam pa gang gis 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, again, I wish to listen: How does the entire triple world come to be in the middle of the body?

original: de nas zla ba bzang po'i gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshig dag gsan nas bde bar gshegs pas zla ba bzang po la legs zhes bya ba byin nas rab tu gyur pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas zla ba bzang po'i gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshig dag gsan nas bde bar gshegs pas zla ba bzang po la legs zhes bya ba byin nas rab tu gyur pas gsungs pa /
translated: Then, having heard the words of supplication from Sucandra, the Sugata gave his approval to Sucandra, saying Excellent! and spoke thus:

original: sems can rnams ni thar pa'i slad du mchog gi thugs rjes sna tshogs tshad rnams dag kyang lus la'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni thar pa'i slad du mchog gi thugs rjes sna tshogs tshad rnams dag kyang lus la'o //
translated: For the sake of the liberation of sentient beings, the Supreme Compassionate One has taught the entire body.

original: kyang yig gis rgyud gzhan thams cad kyang lus la gsungs so //
analyzed: kyang yig gis rgyud gzhan thams cad kyang lus la gsungs so //
translated: The word “also” indicates that all the other tantras have been taught in the body.

original: le'u gnyis pa bstan pa'i slad du gsol ba 'debs pa po dang ston pa po bsdus pa'i mdor bsdus so //
analyzed: le'u gnyis pa bstan pa'i slad du gsol ba 'debs pa po dang ston pa po bsdus pa'i mdor bsdus so //
translated: In order to teach the second chapter, the supplicant and the teacher are summarized in brief.

original: bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The teaching is stated in the verse beginning with “having been requested” and so forth.

original: 'dir lus kyi nang du sa la sogs pa mtha' dag rang rang gi yi ges shes par bya ste so las byung ba'i yi ge rnams kyis sa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir lus kyi nang du sa la sogs pa mtha' dag rang rang gi yi ges shes par bya ste so las byung ba'i yi ge rnams kyis sa shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the entire earth and so forth should be understood in the body with their individual syllables. The earth should be understood with the syllables that arise from the teeth.

original: mchu las byung ba rnams kyis chu'o //🔽spyi bo las byung ba rnams kyis me'o //
analyzed: mchu las byung ba rnams kyis chu'o // spyi bo las byung ba rnams kyis me'o //
translated: Those that arise from the lips are water.🔽Those that arise from the crown of the head are fire.

original: rkan las byung ba rnams kyis rlung ste sa dang chu me rlung rnams so //
analyzed: rkan las byung ba rnams kyis rlung ste sa dang chu me rlung rnams so //
translated: Those that arise from the palate are wind.

original: rdo rje ste glog ni slar yang spyi bo las byung ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rdo rje ste glog ni slar yang spyi bo las byung ba rnams kyis so //
translated: The vajra, or lightning, is again with those that arise from the crown of the head.

original: lha'i gzhu ste 'ja' tshon ni so las byung ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: lha'i gzhu ste 'ja' tshon ni so las byung ba rnams kyis so //
translated: The rainbow, which is the bow of the gods, is produced by the vowels.

original: rlung bcu po rnams ni rkan las byung ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rlung bcu po rnams ni rkan las byung ba rnams kyis so //
translated: The ten winds are produced by the consonants.

original: khyim gyi 'khor lo ni aa la sogs pa dang ka la sogs pa mtha' dag gis so //
analyzed: khyim gyi 'khor lo ni aa la sogs pa dang ka la sogs pa mtha' dag gis so //
translated: The wheel of the houses is produced by the vowels and consonants together.

original: zla ba ni thig les so //
analyzed: zla ba ni thig les so //
translated: The moon is produced by the bindu.

original: nyi ma ni rnam par bcad pas so //
analyzed: nyi ma ni rnam par bcad pas so //
translated: The sun is produced by the visarga.

original: sgra gcan ni dbyangs med pa'i gsal byed kyis so //
analyzed: sgra gcan ni dbyangs med pa'i gsal byed kyis so //
translated: Rahu is produced by the consonants without vowels.

original: lhun po ni ming gi yi ges so //
analyzed: lhun po ni ming gi yi ges so //
translated: Meru is produced by the letters of the name.

original: gdengs can rnams kyi gnas ni aom yig gis so //
analyzed: gdengs can rnams kyi gnas ni aom yig gis so //
translated: The abode of the nagas is produced by the letter Om.

original: mi'i gnas te mi'i 'jig rten ni a'a: yig gis so //
analyzed: mi'i gnas te mi'i 'jig rten ni a'a: yig gis so //
translated: The abode of humans, the human world, is produced by the letter A.

original: lha yi gnas te mtho ris ni h'um yig gis so //
analyzed: lha yi gnas te mtho ris ni h'um yig gis so //
translated: The abode of the gods, the heavens, is produced by the letter Hum.

original: 'khyog po bkra shis la sogs pa'i gza' rnams ni g-yas dang g-yon gyi sa bon gyi yi ge sngar brjod pa rnams kyis so //🔽'pho ba ni sde pa bcu @223a * //
analyzed: 'khyog po bkra shis la sogs pa'i gza' rnams ni g-yas dang g-yon gyi sa bon gyi yi ge sngar brjod pa rnams kyis so // 'pho ba ni sde pa bcu @223a * //
translated: The crooked planets, such as Brihaspati, are produced by the right and left seed syllables mentioned above.

original: gnyis kyi dbye ba rnams kyis te zla ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis kyi dbye ba rnams kyis te zla ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: The transits are produced by the twelve houses. The moon is also like that.

original: phyogs ni sde pa drug phyed kyi dbye ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: phyogs ni sde pa drug phyed kyi dbye ba rnams kyis so //
translated: The directions are the divisions of the six and a half schools.

original: nyin dang mtshan mo tshes rnams ni ka la sogs pa dbyangs dang bcas ba sngar brjod pa rnams kyis te mtha' dag lus kyi dbus su rnal 'byor pas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan mo tshes rnams ni ka la sogs pa dbyangs dang bcas ba sngar brjod pa rnams kyis te mtha' dag lus kyi dbus su rnal 'byor pas shes par bya'o //
translated: The days and nights are the vowels a and so forth, along with the consonants, as previously mentioned. The yogi should know all of them in the middle of the body.

original: rnam gsum khyab bdag bgrod pa rnal 'byor pa yis stong pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: rnam gsum khyab bdag bgrod pa rnal 'byor pa yis stong pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: The three paths of the all-pervading lord are by the divisions of emptiness of the yogi.

original: sngar brjod pa'i rim pas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i rang bzhin rnam pa gsum gyi bgrod pa yang rnam pa gsum ste bde ba chen pos thams cad kyi bdag nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar brjod pa'i rim pas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i rang bzhin rnam pa gsum gyi bgrod pa yang rnam pa gsum ste bde ba chen pos thams cad kyi bdag nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the previously mentioned process, the three paths of Bhagavān Vajrasattva are also three types, by the nature of desire, form, and formlessness, because he abides in the nature of all things as great bliss.

original: de yang stong pa'i dbye bas so zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le bzhi'i dbye bas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang stong pa'i dbye bas so zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le bzhi'i dbye bas shes par bya'o //
translated: That is also by the divisions of emptiness, which should be understood by the divisions of the four bindus of bodhicitta.

original: lus la sna tshogs bsdus pa'i mdor bsdus kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: lus la sna tshogs bsdus pa'i mdor bsdus kyi nges pa'o //
translated: The summary of the body is the collection of varieties.

original: da ni mi'i lus skyed pa la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshogs pa bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa gsungs pa lus zhes pa la sogs pa ste lus 'di la ni khams kyi tshogs zhes pa ni spu dang pags pa dang khrag dang sha dang rus pa
analyzed: da ni mi'i lus skyed pa la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshogs pa bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa gsungs pa lus zhes pa la sogs pa ste lus 'di la ni khams kyi tshogs zhes pa ni spu dang pags pa dang khrag dang sha dang rus pa
translated: the collection of elements is the collection of hair, skin, blood, flesh, bones,

original: dang rkang la sogs pa'i khams kyi sogs su 'gyur te /🔽mtha' dag ro drug zos shing 'thungs pa dag las zhes pa ni lan tshva dang mngar ba dang tsha ba dang dang kha ba dang bska ba dang skyur ba ni ro drug ste 'di dag zos shing 'thungs pa'i dbang gis khams kyi tshogs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang rkang la sogs pa'i khams kyi sogs su 'gyur te / mtha' dag ro drug zos shing 'thungs pa dag las zhes pa ni lan tshva dang mngar ba dang tsha ba dang dang kha ba dang bska ba dang skyur ba ni ro drug ste 'di dag zos shing 'thungs pa'i dbang gis khams kyi tshogs su 'gyur ro //
translated: marrow, and so on.🔽The entire collection of elements arises from eating and drinking the six tastes.🔽The six tastes are salt, sweet, hot, sour, astringent, and bitter.🔽The six tastes arise from the elements.

original: ro drug rnams kyang 'byung ba las te zhes pa ni ro drug tu yang sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang ro rnams las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro drug rnams kyang 'byung ba las te zhes pa ni ro drug tu yang sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang ro rnams las 'gyur ro //
translated: The six tastes arise from the elements of earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: 'byung ba'i tshogs kyang nam mkha'i khams la'o zhes pa ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang ro'i tshogs ni nam mkha'i khams sngar brjod pa'i rdul phra rab kyi chos la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i tshogs kyang nam mkha'i khams la'o zhes pa ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang ro'i tshogs ni nam mkha'i khams sngar brjod pa'i rdul phra rab kyi chos la 'gyur ro //
translated: The collection of elements is in the space element. The collection of earth, water, fire, air, and taste is in the space element, in the previously mentioned subtle particles.

original: stong pa la ni ye shes rnam par bsres pa zhes pa ni 'dir lus la khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i 'brel pa kun rdzob kyis nges par gnas pa gang yin pa sems can thams cad kyi lus la rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa la ni ye shes rnam par bsres pa zhes pa ni 'dir lus la khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i 'brel pa kun rdzob kyis nges par gnas pa gang yin pa sems can thams cad kyi lus la rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: In emptiness, wisdom is mixed. Here, whatever is the relation of pervasion and pervaded by the body, which is established by convention, is consciousness in the bodies of all sentient beings.

original: de nyid ni stong pa ste stong pa nyid kyi gzugs la bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis 'dzin par byed pa'i sems gzung bar bya ba sems kyi snang ba la rnam par bsres pa ni ro mnyam 'gyur @223b med rtag par yang 'gyur te 'dir rtag pa'i sgra ni sgrib🔽pa med par brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid ni stong pa ste stong pa nyid kyi gzugs la bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis 'dzin par byed pa'i sems gzung bar bya ba sems kyi snang ba la rnam par bsres pa ni ro mnyam 'gyur @223b med rtag par yang 'gyur te 'dir rtag pa'i sgra ni sgrib🔽pa med par brjod do //
translated: That itself is emptiness. By the power of meditation on the form of emptiness, the mind that apprehends is mixed with the appearance of the mind that is to be apprehended. It becomes of equal taste, and it also becomes permanent. Here, the word “permanent” refers to the absence of obscuration.

original: de ltar 'byung ba la gnas zhi ba bde ba chen po rnam gsum srid pa la gnas rang gi lus la rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'byung ba la gnas zhi ba bde ba chen po rnam gsum srid pa la gnas rang gi lus la rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the yogis should know that the three abodes of the elements, peace, and great bliss are the abodes of existence in one's own body.

original: 'dir nang gi le'u la tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni mdor bsdus pas rnam par phye ste 'chad par 'gyur ba'i ye shes kyi le'ur mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes grub pa las rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir nang gi le'u la tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni mdor bsdus pas rnam par phye ste 'chad par 'gyur ba'i ye shes kyi le'ur mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes grub pa las rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here, this verse in the Inner chapter is explained in brief, and it should be stated extensively in the chapter on wisdom, which is to be explained in detail in the chapter on the accomplishment of supreme unchanging wisdom.

original: lus skyed pa la rgyu dang 'bras bu tshogs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: lus skyed pa la rgyu dang 'bras bu tshogs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The certainty of the collection of causes and effects in the generation of the body.

original: mngal 'dzin pa la sogs pa gsungs pa sa bon zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dbang po gnyis gyi sbyor ba las gsang ba'i padmar lhung ba'i khu ba dang bha ga'i khrag gang yin pa de ni sa bon zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mngal 'dzin pa la sogs pa gsungs pa sa bon zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dbang po gnyis gyi sbyor ba las gsang ba'i padmar lhung ba'i khu ba dang bha ga'i khrag gang yin pa de ni sa bon zhes brjod do //
translated: The holding of the womb, and so on, is stated by seed, and so on. Here, the essence that falls into the secret lotus from the union of the two organs is called the seed.

original: sa bon de ni 'dzin mas 'dzin te gsang ba'i padma la sa'i khams gang yod pa de yis so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sa bon de ni 'dzin mas 'dzin te gsang ba'i padma la sa'i khams gang yod pa de yis so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: That seed is held by the womb, by the earth element that exists in the secret lotus.

original: padmar gnas pa zhes pa ni gsang ba'i padmar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: padmar gnas pa zhes pa ni gsang ba'i padmar gnas pa'o //
translated: “Residing in the lotus” means residing in the secret lotus.

original: gsang ba'i padma de las chu yis sdud do //
analyzed: gsang ba'i padma de las chu yis sdud do //
