translated: “From that secret lotus, water draws it together.”

original: phyi nas ni me yis smin par byed cing zhes pa ni chu yis rab tu bsdus pa'i sa bon 'di me yis rab tu smin par byed do //
analyzed: phyi nas ni me yis smin par byed cing zhes pa ni chu yis rab tu bsdus pa'i sa bon 'di me yis rab tu smin par byed do //
translated: “Then fire ripens it” means that the seed, drawn together by water, is ripened by fire.

original: ro dang ro ni za bar byed de zhes pa ni ro drug po ma yis zos pa dang 'thungs pa gang yin pa'i ro dang ro de dag me yis za bar byed do //
analyzed: ro dang ro ni za bar byed de zhes pa ni ro drug po ma yis zos pa dang 'thungs pa gang yin pa'i ro dang ro de dag me yis za bar byed do //
translated: “Taste and taste eat each other” means that the tastes that are eaten and drunk by the six tastes are eaten by fire.

original: sa bon 'di yi 'phel ba rlung gis byed do //
analyzed: sa bon 'di yi 'phel ba rlung gis byed do //
translated: “Wind causes the seed to grow.”

original: nam mkha' stong pa dag kyang 'phel ba'i sngon du go skabs sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: nam mkha' stong pa dag kyang 'phel ba'i sngon du go skabs sbyin par byed do //
translated: “Space, being empty, gives room for growth.”

original: mi yi bdag po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: mi yi bdag po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: “The lord of men” means the father.

original: dus las de ltar 'grub pa ste de ltar rim pa de dag gis nya la sogs pa grub ste mngal rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus las de ltar 'grub pa ste de ltar rim pa de dag gis nya la sogs pa grub ste mngal rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: “In this way, it is accomplished in time” means that in this way, by these stages, fish and so on are accomplished, and the womb is completed.

original: lha yi gnas skabs rnams byed do zhes pa la du ba la sogs pa lha yi gnas skabs bcu po de dag byed pa ni mngal dang byis pa dang gzhon nu la sogs pa'i gnas skabs bcu po rnams te btsa' bar 'gyur ba'i dus dang byis pa la
analyzed: lha yi gnas skabs rnams byed do zhes pa la du ba la sogs pa lha yi gnas skabs bcu po de dag byed pa ni mngal dang byis pa dang gzhon nu la sogs pa'i gnas skabs bcu po rnams te btsa' bar 'gyur ba'i dus dang byis pa la
translated: “The states of the gods” are the ten states of the gods, such as smoke, etc. The ten states of the gods are the ten states of the womb, childhood, youth, and so forth.

original: sogs dus dag tu yang ngo zhes pa ni mngal 'dzin pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: sogs dus dag tu yang ngo zhes pa ni mngal 'dzin pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The time of birth, childhood, and so forth, are the states of the womb.

original: sa bon gyi rang gi khams kyi bya ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: sa bon gyi rang gi khams kyi bya ba gsungs pa /
translated: The function of the elements of the seed is stated:

original: sa bon dag gi zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir sa bon khu ba dang khrag gis gang yin pa des gsang ba'i padma la gnas pa'i ro drug po rnams zos nas @224a * //
analyzed: sa bon dag gi zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir sa bon khu ba dang khrag gis gang yin pa des gsang ba'i padma la gnas pa'i ro drug po rnams zos nas @224a * //
translated: “Of the seeds” and so forth. Here, the seed is filled with semen and blood. By that, the six tastes that are in the secret lotus are eaten.

original: lus skyed pa la gsal bar lci zhing sra ba nyid byed do //
analyzed: lus skyed pa la gsal bar lci zhing sra ba nyid byed do //
translated: The heavy and solid nature is made for the generation of the body.

original: chu ni de bzhin gsher ba nyid byed do //
analyzed: chu ni de bzhin gsher ba nyid byed do //
translated: Water makes it moist.

original: me ni zos pa'i ro rnams smin par byed do //
analyzed: me ni zos pa'i ro rnams smin par byed do //
translated: Fire ripens the eaten tastes.

original: rab mchog rnam pa bcu'i rlung srog la sogs pa dag ni sa bon 'di yi lus la 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: rab mchog rnam pa bcu'i rlung srog la sogs pa dag ni sa bon 'di yi lus la 'phel bar byed do //
translated: The ten supreme winds, such as life, increase the body of this seed.🔽And again, in the increase, space itself gives opportunity.

original: 'phel ba dag la slar yang nam mkha' nyid ni go skabs sbyin byed dus las de ltar sngar brjod pa'i cho gas skyed pa ste /
analyzed: 'phel ba dag la slar yang nam mkha' nyid ni go skabs sbyin byed dus las de ltar sngar brjod pa'i cho gas skyed pa ste /
translated: Thus, the generation by the rite previously described.

original: sna tshogs dngos po du ma dag gis lus bcas sgra dang yid dang zhes pa ni lus dang ngag dang sems so //
analyzed: sna tshogs dngos po du ma dag gis lus bcas sgra dang yid dang zhes pa ni lus dang ngag dang sems so //
translated: The body is endowed with many things, with sound, and with mind.

original: nus pa rnams ni du ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nus pa rnams ni du ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The potencies are smoke, and so on.🔽The dharmas of body, speech, and mind are emitted.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems kyi chos can rnams spro bar byed do zhes pa ni sa bon gyi khams kyi bya ba brjod pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems kyi chos can rnams spro bar byed do zhes pa ni sa bon gyi khams kyi bya ba brjod pa'o //
translated: This is the statement of the function of the seed element.

original: gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pas nang gi sems rdo rje 'dzin pa khyab 'jug gi gnas skabs bcu gsungs te /
analyzed: gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pas nang gi sems rdo rje 'dzin pa khyab 'jug gi gnas skabs bcu gsungs te /
translated: By secret, and so on, the inner mind-vajra-holder’s ten states of Viṣṇu are stated.

original: 'dir gsang ba'i padmar khrag gi nang du gang tshe lhung ba'i byang chub sa bon zhes pa ni khu ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir gsang ba'i padmar khrag gi nang du gang tshe lhung ba'i byang chub sa bon zhes pa ni khu ba ste /
translated: Here, when the seed of enlightenment falls into the blood in the secret lotus, that is semen.

original: srog dang bcas pa ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa dag gang gi tshe gsang ba'i padmar lhung ba de'i tshe gnas skabs bcu'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog dang bcas pa ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa dag gang gi tshe gsang ba'i padmar lhung ba de'i tshe gnas skabs bcu'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Endowed with life means endowed with the consciousness of the ground of all. When it falls into the secret lotus, it becomes the characteristics of the ten states.

original: de rnams las mngal gyi nang du nya dang rus sbal dang phag gi gnas skabs gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams las mngal gyi nang du nya dang rus sbal dang phag gi gnas skabs gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: From among those, it becomes the three states of fish, tortoise and pig within the womb.

original: de bzhin du btsa' ba'i dus su gcig ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du btsa' ba'i dus su gcig ste /
translated: Similarly, at the time of birth, there is one.

original: mi yi seng ge'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: mi yi seng ge'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The state of a human lion.

original: byis pa'i dus dag tu yang rnam pa gnyis te so skye ba'i bar ni mi'u thung gi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: byis pa'i dus dag tu yang rnam pa gnyis te so skye ba'i bar ni mi'u thung gi gnas skabs so //
translated: In childhood, there are two. Until the teeth are fully grown, it is the state of a dwarf.

original: so skyes nas so lhung ba'i bar ni dgra sta r'a ma'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: so skyes nas so lhung ba'i bar ni dgra sta r'a ma'i gnas skabs so //
translated: From the time the teeth are fully grown until they fall out, it is the state of a razor.

original: gzhon nu lang tsho dag la gzhan zhes pa ni so lhung ba nas lo bcu drug gi bar du rgyas pa dang po r'a ma'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: gzhon nu lang tsho dag la gzhan zhes pa ni so lhung ba nas lo bcu drug gi bar du rgyas pa dang po r'a ma'i gnas skabs so //
translated: In youth, the other is the first stage of growth from the time the teeth fall out until the age of sixteen.

original: de bzhin du lo bcu drug nas skra dkar skyes pa'i bar ni rgyas pa gzhan nag po'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du lo bcu drug nas skra dkar skyes pa'i bar ni rgyas pa gzhan nag po'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Similarly, from the age of sixteen until the appearance of white hair is the other black stage.

original: skra dkar skyes pa nas 'chi ba'i nyin zhag gi bar ni sangs rgyas kyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: skra dkar skyes pa nas 'chi ba'i nyin zhag gi bar ni sangs rgyas kyi gnas skabs so //
translated: From the appearance of white hair until the day of death is the Buddha stage.

original: 'chi ba'i nyin zhag la 'byung ba thams cad gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir lus la rigs ldan gyi gnas skabs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i nyin zhag la 'byung ba thams cad gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir lus la rigs ldan gyi gnas skabs su 'gyur te /
translated: On the day of death, all the elements merge into one, and so the body becomes the stage of the kṣatriya.

original: rgan po nyid la zhi ba gcig ste /
analyzed: rgan po nyid la zhi ba gcig ste /
translated: There is one peace in old age.

original: mngal skyes rnams kyi srid pa 'chi ba nyid ni mtha' ma'o zhes so //
analyzed: mngal skyes rnams kyi srid pa 'chi ba nyid ni mtha' ma'o zhes so //
translated: For those born from a womb, the end is death.

original: gnas @224b skabs bcu'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: gnas @224b skabs bcu'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the determination of the ten stages.

original: nya zhes pa la sogs pas nang la sems rdo rje 'dzin pa khyab 'jug gi bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: nya zhes pa la sogs pas nang la sems rdo rje 'dzin pa khyab 'jug gi bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The internal activities of the mind-vajra-holder Viṣṇu are stated by “fish,” and so on.

original: 'dir nya'i dngos po la byang chub kyi sems rdo rje 'dzin pa khyab 'jug ni nya yi rnam par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir nya'i dngos po la byang chub kyi sems rdo rje 'dzin pa khyab 'jug ni nya yi rnam par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the mind-vajra-holder Viṣṇu, the bodhicitta, becomes the form of a fish.

original: nyin zhag 'ga' ni dus kyi nyin zhag gi bar du'o //
analyzed: nyin zhag 'ga' ni dus kyi nyin zhag gi bar du'o //
translated: For a few days, up to the time of the day.

original: de nas rus sbal gyi dngos po la ni rus sbal gyi dngos por 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas rus sbal gyi dngos po la ni rus sbal gyi dngos por 'gyur te /
translated: Then, in the tortoise stage, the tortoise stage occurs.

original: yang yig gis dus gzhan gyi nyin zhag gi bar du'o //
analyzed: yang yig gis dus gzhan gyi nyin zhag gi bar du'o //
translated: The word “also” indicates that this lasts for a day and night.

original: phag pa'i dngos po la byang chub kyi sems khyab 'jug de yi skye mched nyi ma ste /
analyzed: phag pa'i dngos po la byang chub kyi sems khyab 'jug de yi skye mched nyi ma ste /
translated: In the pig stage, the bodhisattva Viṣṇu’s sense bases occur.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The twelve sense bases occur.

original: gsum pa'i dus kyi nyin zhag gi bar du'o //
analyzed: gsum pa'i dus kyi nyin zhag gi bar du'o //
translated: This lasts for a day and night of the third period.

original: de bzhin du zla ba bdun pa nas skye ba'i nyin zhag gi bar du mi yi seng ge'i dngos po la rab tu skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zla ba bdun pa nas skye ba'i nyin zhag gi bar du mi yi seng ge'i dngos po la rab tu skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, in the seventh month, the human lion stage occurs, lasting for a day and night.

original: lag pa dag gis skye gnas rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lag pa dag gis skye gnas rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the hands open the birth canal.

original: mi'u thung gi dngos po la ni sngar brjod pa'i byis pa'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi'u thung gi dngos po la ni sngar brjod pa'i byis pa'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
translated: In the dwarf stage, the previously mentioned child stage occurs.

original: dgra sta r'a ma la yang mi bdag gnyis te /
analyzed: dgra sta r'a ma la yang mi bdag gnyis te /
translated: In the axe stage, there are two human lords.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi so rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi so rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The thirty-two teeth occur.

original: r'a ma'i dngos po la ni ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: r'a ma'i dngos po la ni ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the axe stage, they fall out.

original: byang chub kyi sems khyab 'jug de nyid nag po'i dngos po la ni gsal bar sgyu dag byed ces pa sgyu ma byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems khyab 'jug de nyid nag po'i dngos po la ni gsal bar sgyu dag byed ces pa sgyu ma byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of the entity of Viṣṇu, the bodhicitta, it is clear that he is a magician, that is, he becomes a magician.

original: sangs rgyas kyi dngos po la yang zhi ba dang sems can rnams la brtul zhugs nges pa byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi dngos po la yang zhi ba dang sems can rnams la brtul zhugs nges pa byed do //
translated: In the case of the entity of the Buddha, he is peaceful and he definitely performs the yogic practice for the sake of sentient beings.

original: rigs ldan la ni 'chi bar 'gyur te rigs ldan gyi dngos po la sngar brjod pa'i cho gas 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni 'jug pa bcu'o //
analyzed: rigs ldan la ni 'chi bar 'gyur te rigs ldan gyi dngos po la sngar brjod pa'i cho gas 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni 'jug pa bcu'o //
translated: In the case of the entity of the kṣatriya, he dies. In the case of the entity of the kṣatriya, he dies by the previously mentioned process.

original: 'dir phyi rol du nya la sogs pa'i lo rgyus tshangs pa'i drang srong gdug pa rnams kyis byis pa rnams bslu ba'i slad du bkod pa gang yin pa de ni dmyal ba 'thob pa'i rgyu ste 'chad par 'gyur ba mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes grub pa
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol du nya la sogs pa'i lo rgyus tshangs pa'i drang srong gdug pa rnams kyis byis pa rnams bslu ba'i slad du bkod pa gang yin pa de ni dmyal ba 'thob pa'i rgyu ste 'chad par 'gyur ba mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes grub pa
translated: Here, the stories of the fish and so on, which are set forth by the evil ṛṣis of Brahmā for the sake of deceiving children, are the cause for attaining hell. This will be explained in the supreme, unchanging gnosis that will be described in the extensive

original: las rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: las rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: [version of this tantra].

original: khu ba zhes pa la sogs pas ma'i mngal na gnas pa'i khu ba dang rdul dag gi rnam par 'gyur ba mngal bzung ba nas brtsams te btsa' ba'i mthar thug pa gsungs so //
analyzed: khu ba zhes pa la sogs pas ma'i mngal na gnas pa'i khu ba dang rdul dag gi rnam par 'gyur ba mngal bzung ba nas brtsams te btsa' ba'i mthar thug pa gsungs so //
translated: The words “semen” and so on refer to the changes in the semen and blood of the one dwelling in the mother’s womb, beginning with the conception and ending with the birth.

original: 'dir skye ba'i lus la mdzod drug tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir skye ba'i lus la mdzod drug tu 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the body of the one being born has six constituents:

original: khu ba las rkang du 'gyur ba dang rus par 'gyur ba dang rgyus pa ste /🔽chu rgyus rnams su 'gyur @225a * //
analyzed: khu ba las rkang du 'gyur ba dang rus par 'gyur ba dang rgyus pa ste / chu rgyus rnams su 'gyur @225a * //
translated: from the semen, the legs, the bones, and the sinews are formed;

original: ba'o ; / rdul las pags pa dang khrag tu 'gyur ba dang shar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: ba'o ; / rdul las pags pa dang khrag tu 'gyur ba dang shar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: from the blood, the skin, the flesh, and the veins are formed.

original: gang gi phyir brjod pa'i sa bon gyis rab tu bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brjod pa'i sa bon gyis rab tu bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the seed of the one being born is formed from the seed of the father and mother.

original: 'dir mngal du zla ba gcig gi bar du khrag dang sa bon bdud rtsi lnga'i ror gyur pa rab tu skye'o //
analyzed: 'dir mngal du zla ba gcig gi bar du khrag dang sa bon bdud rtsi lnga'i ror gyur pa rab tu skye'o //
translated: Here, for one month in the womb, the blood and the seed become the essence of the five nectars.

original: phyi nas sa bon myu gu zhes pa ni de nas zla ba'i mjug tu byang chub kyi sems myu gur gyur pa'i snying kha'i go skabs su rnam pa bcu yi rtsa srog la sogs pa'i rlung rnams kyi rten du 'gyur te de dag kyang shin tu phra ba
analyzed: phyi nas sa bon myu gu zhes pa ni de nas zla ba'i mjug tu byang chub kyi sems myu gur gyur pa'i snying kha'i go skabs su rnam pa bcu yi rtsa srog la sogs pa'i rlung rnams kyi rten du 'gyur te de dag kyang shin tu phra ba
translated: Those are very subtle,

original: ste skra'i tshad do //
analyzed: ste skra'i tshad do //
translated: the measure of a hair.

original: lte ba la ste lte ba'i phyogs su brgyad pa brgyad dbyug gu drug cu rtsa bzhi rgyu bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lte ba la ste lte ba'i phyogs su brgyad pa brgyad dbyug gu drug cu rtsa bzhi rgyu bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The eight in the navel, that is, in the region of the navel, are the movement of the sixty-four finger lengths.🔽Although it is not mentioned, due to the twelve transits of the houses, there are twelve very subtle nāḍīs that are the supports of the sixty-four.

original: ma gsungs kyang khyim gyi 'pho ba bcu gnyis kyi dbang gis drug cu rtsa bzhi po rnams kyi rten du gyur pa'i rtsa shin tu phra ba bcu gnyis su 'gyur te de bzhin du lte ba'i rtsa sngar brjod pa de dag thams cad ni shin tu phra ba'o
analyzed: ma gsungs kyang khyim gyi 'pho ba bcu gnyis kyi dbang gis drug cu rtsa bzhi po rnams kyi rten du gyur pa'i rtsa shin tu phra ba bcu gnyis su 'gyur te de bzhin du lte ba'i rtsa sngar brjod pa de dag thams cad ni shin tu phra ba'o
translated: In the same way, all those nāḍīs of the navel mentioned previously are very subtle.

original: // rkang lag gdong gi gnas kyi rgyu'i slad du gyen du skyod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: // rkang lag gdong gi gnas kyi rgyu'i slad du gyen du skyod par byed pa ste /
translated: The upward-moving wind is the cause of the places of the hands, feet, and face.

original: rkang lag gdong gi gnas rnams su bskyod pa'i mthu de las zla ba gnyis pa rdzogs par gyur pa'i rjes la 'dir ni rkang lag gdong gi mtshon pa cung zad do //
analyzed: rkang lag gdong gi gnas rnams su bskyod pa'i mthu de las zla ba gnyis pa rdzogs par gyur pa'i rjes la 'dir ni rkang lag gdong gi mtshon pa cung zad do //
translated: The power of movement in the places of the hands, feet, and face, after the completion of the second month, is the slight movement of the hands, feet, and face here.

original: 'dir dang po nya'i gnas skabs kyi nyin zhag 'das par gyur pa rus sbal gyi gnas skabs la gdong dang rkang pa dang lag pa'i gnas rnams su 'bur po lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir dang po nya'i gnas skabs kyi nyin zhag 'das par gyur pa rus sbal gyi gnas skabs la gdong dang rkang pa dang lag pa'i gnas rnams su 'bur po lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the first day of the month of the tortoise, the five protuberances become the places of the face, hands, and feet.

original: lag pa rkang pa mgrin pa dag gi mgo bo mnyam par 'gyur te rus sbal lo //
analyzed: lag pa rkang pa mgrin pa dag gi mgo bo mnyam par 'gyur te rus sbal lo //
translated: The head of the hands, feet, and neck becomes equal, the tortoise.

original: phra mo'i rtsa gzhan rnams ni zla ba bzhi pa rdzogs par gyur pa na rkang lag gdong dang mgrin pa dag gi phyogs su rkang pa dang lag pa rnams kyi tshigs drug dang gdong gi mgrin pa la lhan cig skyes pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i rtsa shin🔽tu phra ba rnams su 'gyur te rus sbal gyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: phra mo'i rtsa gzhan rnams ni zla ba bzhi pa rdzogs par gyur pa na rkang lag gdong dang mgrin pa dag gi phyogs su rkang pa dang lag pa rnams kyi tshigs drug dang gdong gi mgrin pa la lhan cig skyes pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i rtsa shin🔽tu phra ba rnams su 'gyur te rus sbal gyi gnas skabs so //
translated: The other subtle channels, in the completion of the fourth month, become the six joints of the hands, feet, and face, and the very subtle channels of the place of the neck, the innate and enjoyment channels of the face, the tortoise stage.

original: zla ba lnga pa la ni phag gi dngos po la sha dang khrag dang rus pa mkha' ro bsreg za zhes pa ni rus pa sum brgya drug cu ste tshigs rnams kyang de snyed do //
analyzed: zla ba lnga pa la ni phag gi dngos po la sha dang khrag dang rus pa mkha' ro bsreg za zhes pa ni rus pa sum brgya drug cu ste tshigs rnams kyang de snyed do //
translated: In the fifth month, in the pig state, flesh, blood, and bones are consumed by the fire of space.

original: zla ba drug pa la yang ste /
analyzed: zla ba drug pa la yang ste /
translated: In the sixth month,

original: yang yig gis phag pa'i dngos po la sha dang khrag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang yig gis phag pa'i dngos po la sha dang khrag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: again, in the pig state, flesh and blood are consumed by the fire of space.

original: tshor bar 'gyur te bde ba dang sdug bsngal yang rig go //
analyzed: tshor bar 'gyur te bde ba dang sdug bsngal yang rig go //
translated: One experiences feelings, and one knows pleasure and pain.

original: mngon par shes pa'i stobs kyis sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran par @225b yang 'gyur te rang gi sems kyi chags pa dang bral bar byed do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i stobs kyis sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran par @225b yang 'gyur te rang gi sems kyi chags pa dang bral bar byed do //
translated: By the power of clairvoyance, one remembers one’s former lives, and one becomes free from attachment to one’s own mind.

original: srid pa'i sdug bsngal smod par byed do //
analyzed: srid pa'i sdug bsngal smod par byed do //
translated: One criticizes the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: sangs rgyas kyi lam la bsngags par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi lam la bsngags par byed do //
translated: One praises the path of the Buddha.

original: de nas smin ma skra dang spu dang bug pa mig la sogs pa rnams kyang phag gi dngos po la thub pa mchog la ste /
analyzed: de nas smin ma skra dang spu dang bug pa mig la sogs pa rnams kyang phag gi dngos po la thub pa mchog la ste /
translated: Then, in the eyebrows, hair, body hair, and orifices, such as the eyes, in the pig state, one should visualize the supreme sage.

original: zla ba bdun pa rdzogs par gyur pa na skye mched rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla ba bdun pa rdzogs par gyur pa na skye mched rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the seventh month is complete, the sense-spheres are fully developed.

original: 'dir mngal gyi zla ba'i mjug tu nyin zhag so so'i dus la stong pa stong pa mig gi grangs te nyis brgya'i grangs kyi rtsa rnams su nyin zhag so so la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir mngal gyi zla ba'i mjug tu nyin zhag so so'i dus la stong pa stong pa mig gi grangs te nyis brgya'i grangs kyi rtsa rnams su nyin zhag so so la 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, at the end of the months in the womb, on each day, in the empty channels, the number of eyes, that is, the number of two hundred, occurs on each day.

original: de nas sum brgya drug cu'i gnad rnams dang rus pa rnams te de'i nang du rkang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas sum brgya drug cu'i gnad rnams dang rus pa rnams te de'i nang du rkang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, in the three hundred and sixty vital points and bones, it becomes a foot.

original: ro 'dzin ni lce ste lce yi dbang po bskyed pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: ro 'dzin ni lce ste lce yi dbang po bskyed pa'i slad du'o //
translated: The tongue is the taste-taker, for the sake of generating the tongue sense-faculty.

original: sngar gyi mig la sogs pa rnams sra ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar gyi mig la sogs pa rnams sra ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The previously mentioned eyes and so forth become solid.

original: ro 'dzin skyes pa'i dus de nas 'dir gci ba bshang ba ni zla ba brgyad pa dag la yang phag gi dngos po la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro 'dzin skyes pa'i dus de nas 'dir gci ba bshang ba ni zla ba brgyad pa dag la yang phag gi dngos po la 'gyur ro //
translated: From the time the taste-taker is born, here, urine and feces occur in the eighth month in the state of the pig.

original: de nas bug pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de nas bug pa zhes pa ste /
translated: Then, the opening,

original: zla ba dgu pa rdzogs par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: zla ba dgu pa rdzogs par gyur pa'am /
translated: the ninth month is complete,

original: kha cig tu bcu pa dang / bcu gcig pa dang / bcu gnyis pa la phag gi dngos po'i mjug tu sdug bsngal drag por 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha cig tu bcu pa dang / bcu gcig pa dang / bcu gnyis pa la phag gi dngos po'i mjug tu sdug bsngal drag por 'gyur te /
translated: In some places, in the tenth, eleventh, and twelfth months, there is the suffering of the pig, at the end of the pig-like state.

original: btsa' ba'i dus su skye gnas kyis ni btsir ba dag gis te /
analyzed: btsa' ba'i dus su skye gnas kyis ni btsir ba dag gis te /
translated: At the time of birth, there is the suffering of being squeezed by the womb.

original: mi'i seng ge'i dngos po la mngal nas skye ba dag gi'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mi'i seng ge'i dngos po la mngal nas skye ba dag gi'o zhes pa ni /
translated: In the human lion-like state, there is the suffering of those born from a womb.

original: mngal nas skye ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: mngal nas skye ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the certainty of birth from a womb.🔽From among the four noble truths, the truth of suffering of transmigrators is stated.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi las 'khor ba pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa gsungs pa mngal zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dang por re zhig 'khor ba pa mngal na gnas pa rnams kyi mngal na gnas pa'i sdug bsngal bum par 'tshed pa dang mtshungs🔽par 'gyur ro //🔽btsa' ba'i dus su tho ba'i 'khrul 'khor gyis btsir ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi las 'khor ba pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa gsungs pa mngal zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dang por re zhig 'khor ba pa mngal na gnas pa rnams kyi mngal na gnas pa'i sdug bsngal bum par 'tshed pa dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro // btsa' ba'i dus su tho ba'i 'khrul 'khor gyis btsir ba bzhin no //
translated: Here, first, for transmigrators in the womb, the suffering of being in the womb is like being cooked in a pot.🔽At the time of birth, it is like being squeezed by a machine with a hammer.

original: byis pa'i dngos po la yang bshang ba za ba phag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: byis pa'i dngos po la yang bshang ba za ba phag pa bzhin no //
translated: In the state of a child, there is the suffering of eating feces, like a pig.

original: gzhon nu dang ni lang tsho dag la yang bud med dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang nor dang 'byor pa nyams pa'i sdug bsngal te de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhon nu dang ni lang tsho dag la yang bud med dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang nor dang 'byor pa nyams pa'i sdug bsngal te de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In youth and in the prime of life, there is the suffering of being separated from women and the suffering of the loss of wealth and property.

original: rgan po nyid la'ang rga shi'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: rgan po nyid la'ang rga shi'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: In old age, there is the suffering of old age and death.

original: slar yang shi ba'i mthar 'gro ba drug tu 'jigs ster du 'bod la sogs te /
analyzed: slar yang shi ba'i mthar 'gro ba drug tu 'jigs ster du 'bod la sogs te /
translated: Again, at the end of death, there is the fear of the six destinies, such as the hell of Saṃjīva.

original: sogs pas ni yi dags dang dud 'gro'i 'gro bar @226a * //
analyzed: sogs pas ni yi dags dang dud 'gro'i 'gro bar @226a * //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the destinies of hungry ghosts and animals.

original: sdug bsngal drag por 'gyur te dge ba bcu yongs su bor ba dang sdig pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal drag por 'gyur te dge ba bcu yongs su bor ba dang sdig pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: There is intense suffering there, due to the abandonment of the ten virtues and the power of evil.

original: de ltar sgyu mas rmongs par byas pa'i mtha' dag 'gro ba 'di ni sdug bsngal dag las sdug bsngal 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: de ltar sgyu mas rmongs par byas pa'i mtha' dag 'gro ba 'di ni sdug bsngal dag las sdug bsngal 'dzin par byed /
translated: Thus, this entire world, deluded by illusion, grasps suffering from suffering.

original: 'dir 'khor ba'i sgyu ma ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can gyis rmongs par byas pa dmyal ba dang yi dags dang dud 'gro'i sdug bsngal dag las sdug bsngal 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: 'dir 'khor ba'i sgyu ma ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can gyis rmongs par byas pa dmyal ba dang yi dags dang dud 'gro'i sdug bsngal dag las sdug bsngal 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Here, the illusion of saṃsāra, which is deluded by the nature of grasping “I” and grasping “mine,” is grasped as suffering from the sufferings of hell-beings, hungry ghosts, and animals.

original: lam gyi bden pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa gsungs pa /
translated: The truth of the path is stated:

original: 'khor ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'gro ba drug gi bdag nyid kyi 'khor ba 'dir mi nyid du ni 'gyur ba dag kyang 'ga' zhig tu ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'gro ba drug gi bdag nyid kyi 'khor ba 'dir mi nyid du ni 'gyur ba dag kyang 'ga' zhig tu ste /
translated: In this saṃsāra, which has the nature of the six realms, some people become human.

original: de bas mu stegs pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams la mi rnams kyis chos kyi blo ni res 'ga' na 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bas mu stegs pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams la mi rnams kyis chos kyi blo ni res 'ga' na 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the idea of dharma in humans sometimes arises toward the dharmas of generosity and so on of the tīrthikas.

original: de bas sangs rgyas la ni rjes chags brgya lam na dge ba'i dbang gis 'gyur zhing sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su chags pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de bas sangs rgyas la ni rjes chags brgya lam na dge ba'i dbang gis 'gyur zhing sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su chags pa yang ngo //
translated: Therefore, through the power of virtue, one sometimes becomes attached to the Buddha and also attached to generosity and so on.

original: de bas kyang dge ba'i dbang gis dang po'i theg pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bas kyang dge ba'i dbang gis dang po'i theg pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and by the power of virtue, one enters the first vehicle, the vehicle of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de bas dpal ldan rdo rje theg pa la 'jug pa ste rdo rje ni mi phyed pa dang mi chod pa chen po yin la de nyid theg pa yin pa ni rdo rje theg pa ste /
analyzed: de bas dpal ldan rdo rje theg pa la 'jug pa ste rdo rje ni mi phyed pa dang mi chod pa chen po yin la de nyid theg pa yin pa ni rdo rje theg pa ste /
translated: Then, one enters the glorious Vajra Vehicle. Vajra is indivisible and great, and that itself is the vehicle, the Vajra Vehicle.

original: sngags kyi tshul dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'bras bu dang rgyu'i bdag nyid gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi tshul dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'bras bu dang rgyu'i bdag nyid gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa'o //
translated: The way of mantra and the way of the perfections become one in the identity of result and cause.

original: de la 'jug pa ni rdo rje theg pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa ni rdo rje theg pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: To enter that is to enter the Vajra Vehicle.

original: de bas bsgom pa la ni blo gros ma lus brgya lam dag na 'jug ste /
analyzed: de bas bsgom pa la ni blo gros ma lus brgya lam dag na 'jug ste /
translated: Therefore, the mind enters meditation only once in a hundred tries.

original: gang zhig sems dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i stong pa nyid dang dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje'i bdag nyid la'o //
analyzed: gang zhig sems dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i stong pa nyid dang dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje'i bdag nyid la'o //
translated: It is in the identity of emptiness with reference to the mind and compassion without reference that one meditates.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi dbang gis bsgom pa de la sangs rgyas nyid 'dod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi dbang gis bsgom pa de la sangs rgyas nyid 'dod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By the power of merit and wisdom, one desires buddhahood in that meditation.

original: de ltar mchog gi bde ba'i go 'phang dag la 'jug pa ae ma shin tu dka' ste /
analyzed: de ltar mchog gi bde ba'i go 'phang dag la 'jug pa ae ma shin tu dka' ste /
translated: Thus, the entry into the state of supreme bliss is, alas, very difficult.

original: 'khor ba'i bde ba mngon par 'dod pa'i 'khor ba pa rnams la ring ba las kyang shin tu ring ngo //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i bde ba mngon par 'dod pa'i 'khor ba pa rnams la ring ba las kyang shin tu ring ngo //
translated: It is far, far away from those who are in cyclic existence, who desire the pleasures of cyclic existence.

original: mngal du zhes pa la sogs pas kun 'byung gi bden pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mngal du zhes pa la sogs pas kun 'byung gi bden pa gsungs te /
translated: The origin of suffering is stated by “in the womb” and so forth.

original: 'dir dang por 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis rnam par dag pa'i sku la sogs pa mngal nas skyes pa'i lus la yang dag par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir dang por 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis rnam par dag pa'i sku la sogs pa mngal nas skyes pa'i lus la yang dag par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Here, first, the yogī should view the body born from the womb as the pure body and so forth of the relative world.

original: phyi nas de nyid kyi chos kyis sangs @226b rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi shin tu rnam par dag pa'i sku la sogs pa rnams rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nas de nyid kyi chos kyis sangs @226b rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi shin tu rnam par dag pa'i sku la sogs pa rnams rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rig par bya'o //
translated: Later, by the reality of that, the yogīs should know the very pure body and so forth of the Buddha Bhagavān.

original: 'dir ma'i mngal du ji srid gnas pa de srid du mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa ni lus can rnams kyi yang dag par dag pa'i skur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir ma'i mngal du ji srid gnas pa de srid du mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa ni lus can rnams kyi yang dag par dag pa'i skur 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, for as long as one remains in the mother’s womb, one possesses the five superknowledges, and one becomes the pure body of embodied beings.

original: de nas btsa' ba'i dus nas brtsams te ji srid so skye ba de srid ni chos kyi skur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas btsa' ba'i dus nas brtsams te ji srid so skye ba de srid ni chos kyi skur 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, from the time of birth until the time of the appearance of the teeth, he is the Dharmakaya.

original: so skyes pa de nas ji srid so rab tu lhung bar 'gyur ba de srid ni rgyal ba byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste mi yi bdag po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: so skyes pa de nas ji srid so rab tu lhung bar 'gyur ba de srid ni rgyal ba byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste mi yi bdag po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: From the appearance of the teeth until the falling of the teeth, he is the Sambhogakaya of the Bodhisattva Vajrasattva.

original: so lhung ba de nas sprul pa'i sku ni rab tu gsal zhing nges par 'chi ba'i mtshams ta mi rnams dag gi ni mngal nas skyes pa rnams kyi'o //🔽mngal dang phyi rol dag tu slar yang sku'i tshogs 'di ni rnam pa bzhi ru 'gyur te /
analyzed: so lhung ba de nas sprul pa'i sku ni rab tu gsal zhing nges par 'chi ba'i mtshams ta mi rnams dag gi ni mngal nas skyes pa rnams kyi'o // mngal dang phyi rol dag tu slar yang sku'i tshogs 'di ni rnam pa bzhi ru 'gyur te /
translated: From the falling of the teeth until the time of death, he is the Nirmanakaya, who is clearly manifest to human beings.🔽This is the fourfold division of the body of the Buddha, which is born from the womb of human beings.

original: 'dir ye shes kyi dbye bas mngal dang rnam par shes pa drug gi dbye bas phyi rol du ste ye shes rnam shes dbye bas zhes so //
analyzed: 'dir ye shes kyi dbye bas mngal dang rnam par shes pa drug gi dbye bas phyi rol du ste ye shes rnam shes dbye bas zhes so //
translated: The division of the body into four is made in terms of the division of the womb into two, the womb and the external, and the division of the womb into two, the division of the womb into the six consciousnesses and the division of the external into the six consciousnesses.

original: 'dir re zhig mngal du rnam shes ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ste bde ba dam pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: 'dir re zhig mngal du rnam shes ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ste bde ba dam pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Here, the consciousness in the womb is the consciousness of the ground of all, which is the pristine wisdom of sublime bliss.

original: zla ba nyi ma dag ni khu ba dang rdul lo //
analyzed: zla ba nyi ma dag ni khu ba dang rdul lo //
translated: The moon and sun are the semen and blood.

original: kyang padmar gnas pa ni mngal rdzogs par bya ba'i don du gsum po gcig tu gyur pa ma'i padma la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: kyang padmar gnas pa ni mngal rdzogs par bya ba'i don du gsum po gcig tu gyur pa ma'i padma la gnas pa'o //
translated: The “lotus” is the womb, and the “abiding” is the three together in the mother’s lotus for the sake of completing the womb.

original: de ni mngal du dag pa'i skur bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni mngal du dag pa'i skur bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: The Bhagavān has said that the pure body in the womb is

original: ma dang pha dang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i bde ba'i gnas skabs gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma dang pha dang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i bde ba'i gnas skabs gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the one state of bliss of the mother, father, and consciousness of the ground of all.

original: khams dang phung po rnams rab tu 'byung ba rnam pa bcu po gang yin pa de ni rgyal ba byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'i chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: khams dang phung po rnams rab tu 'byung ba rnam pa bcu po gang yin pa de ni rgyal ba byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'i chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The ten kinds of arising of the constituents and the aggregates are the dharmakāya of the victor, the mind of enlightenment, the vajra.

original: de nas yon tan dbang gis te nyin zhag gi dbang gis nang gi rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul rnams skyes par gyur pa na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas yon tan dbang gis te nyin zhag gi dbang gis nang gi rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul rnams skyes par gyur pa na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, by the power of the qualities, by the power of the day and night, the internal sense organs such as the ear are born, and the objects such as sound are born. Then, the enjoyment body arises.

original: de nas sgra la sogs pa skyes te sogs pas ba spu dang bshang ba dang gci ba grub cing rab tu btsa' ba'i dus su skye gnas nas 'byung ba ni mngal du sprul pa'i skur gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas sgra la sogs pa skyes te sogs pas ba spu dang bshang ba dang gci ba grub cing rab tu btsa' ba'i dus su skye gnas nas 'byung ba ni mngal du sprul pa'i skur gsungs so //
translated: Then, sound and so on are born, and by the word “and so on,” the pores, feces, and urine are established. At the time of birth from the womb, the body that emerges is said to be the emanation body in the womb.

original: de nas phyi rol gyi sku bzhi ni skyes par gyur pa na dbugs kyi dang po gang zhig dbu ma'i rtsa la rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba yon tan med pa de ni gsung rdo rje'i yul la yang dag par dag pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de nas phyi rol gyi sku bzhi ni skyes par gyur pa na dbugs kyi dang po gang zhig dbu ma'i rtsa la rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba yon tan med pa de ni gsung rdo rje'i yul la yang dag par dag pa'i sku'o //
translated: Then, when the four external bodies are born, the first breath that arises in the central nāḍī is devoid of qualities. That is the body that is totally pure in the field of Vajra Speech.

original: dag pa'i sku de nyid ni rkang pa dang bcas pa'i dbugs lnga bcu rtsa drug gi cho gas ji srid @227a * //
analyzed: dag pa'i sku de nyid ni rkang pa dang bcas pa'i dbugs lnga bcu rtsa drug gi cho gas ji srid @227a * //
translated: That pure body, by the process of fifty-six breaths with the legs,

original: pa de srid de dbu ma las rab tu 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa de srid de dbu ma las rab tu 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, the middle is the best, because it is the best of the middle.

original: de nas srog yang dag par rgyu ba'i dbang gis so ni rab 'byung gang zhig tshig ni gsal min dag kyang gang de 'du shes pa'i mtshan nyid de ni gsung rdo rje'i yul la chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de nas srog yang dag par rgyu ba'i dbang gis so ni rab 'byung gang zhig tshig ni gsal min dag kyang gang de 'du shes pa'i mtshan nyid de ni gsung rdo rje'i yul la chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Then, by the power of the correct movement of the life-force, the teeth that are not clear and the words that are not clear are the nature of perception, which is the Dharma Body in the field of Vak-Vajra.

original: de nas gnyis skyes rnams ni ltung ba ste so rnams lhung bar 'gyur ba'i bar lo brgyad kyi mthar thug pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste tshig yongs su gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas gnyis skyes rnams ni ltung ba ste so rnams lhung bar 'gyur ba'i bar lo brgyad kyi mthar thug pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste tshig yongs su gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Then, the falling of the teeth of the two-sexed ones, which lasts until the age of eight, is the Enjoyment Body, because the words are clear.

original: so rnams dag las te lhung ba las 'chi ba'i mthar thug pa ni phyi rol du sprul pa'i skur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so rnams dag las te lhung ba las 'chi ba'i mthar thug pa ni phyi rol du sprul pa'i skur 'gyur ro //
translated: From the teeth, which have fallen, until death, the external is the Emanation Body.

original: 'dir mngal du lus kyi dbye bas sku'i dbye ba rnam pa bzhi ste phyi rol du srog rgyu ba'i dbye bas sku'i dbye ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dir mngal du lus kyi dbye bas sku'i dbye ba rnam pa bzhi ste phyi rol du srog rgyu ba'i dbye bas sku'i dbye ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Here, the division of the bodies is fourfold by the division of the body in the womb, and the division of the bodies is fourfold by the division of the movement of the life-force externally.

original: ye shes dang rnam par shes pa ni nang dang phyi rol du yang lus dang srog dag gi grogs so //
analyzed: ye shes dang rnam par shes pa ni nang dang phyi rol du yang lus dang srog dag gi grogs so //
translated: Wisdom and consciousness are also the companions of the body and life force, both internally and externally.

original: 'dir lus kyi dbye ba ni sa bon dang 'brel ba can te ngag gi dbye ba ni khrag dang 'brel ba can no //
analyzed: 'dir lus kyi dbye ba ni sa bon dang 'brel ba can te ngag gi dbye ba ni khrag dang 'brel ba can no //
translated: Here, the division of the body is related to the seed, and the division of speech is related to blood.

original: de bzhin du khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i 'brel ba'i sems kyi dbye bas sku'i dbye ba rnam pa bzhi dang sad pa la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi dbye bas sku'i dbye ba rnam pa bzhi ste dga' ba la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi'i rang🔽bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i 'brel ba'i sems kyi dbye bas sku'i dbye ba rnam pa bzhi dang sad pa la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi dbye bas sku'i dbye ba rnam pa bzhi ste dga' ba la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: Similarly, the division of the body is fourfold by the division of the mind that is the relationship of the pervaded and the pervader, and the division of the body is fourfold by the division of the wisdom of the four joys, and so on.

original: lus dang phyi rol la lhan cig skyes pa la sogs pa'i sku 'byung ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang phyi rol la lhan cig skyes pa la sogs pa'i sku 'byung ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: The certainty of the arising of the body of the simultaneously born, and so on, is in the body and externally.

original: mngal du zhes pa la sogs pas sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes 'byung ba gsungs te 'dir ma'i mngal du ye shes ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mngal du zhes pa la sogs pas sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes 'byung ba gsungs te 'dir ma'i mngal du ye shes ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: The arising of the body, speech, mind, and wisdom is stated by “in the womb,” and so on. Here, in the mother’s womb, wisdom is the simultaneously born joy.

original: rnam shes bsres pa ni kun gzhi'i rnam shes bsres pa'o //
analyzed: rnam shes bsres pa ni kun gzhi'i rnam shes bsres pa'o //
translated: The mixing of consciousness is the mixing of the consciousness of the ground of all.

original: nyi ma ri bong can dang bcas pa ni rdul dang khu ba dag dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma ri bong can dang bcas pa ni rdul dang khu ba dag dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The sun and the moon together are the semen and blood together.

original: ye shes rdo rje la sogs kun ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ye shes rdo rje la sogs kun ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The vajra of wisdom and so forth are the coemergent joy and so forth.

original: mngal na gnas pa dag ni sku'i rdo rje la sogs rim pa yis kyang stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa dag ni sku'i rdo rje la sogs rim pa yis kyang stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The beings in the womb are the vajra body and so forth, and they become powerful in stages.

original: 'dir dang por mngal du skye ba'i mtshams kyi bar du dpal ldan sku yi rdo rjer 'gyur te lus kyi cha shas yongs su rdzogs pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir dang por mngal du skye ba'i mtshams kyi bar du dpal ldan sku yi rdo rjer 'gyur te lus kyi cha shas yongs su rdzogs pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Here, first, up to the time of birth in the womb, one is the glorious vajra body, which means the body is fully formed.

original: de nas skyes pa na gsung rdo rje srog yang dag par rgyu ba ste srog 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de nas skyes pa na gsung rdo rje srog yang dag par rgyu ba ste srog 'byung ba'o //
translated: Then, after birth, one is the vajra speech, the life force moving correctly, the life force arising.

original: de nas so sum cu rtsa gnyis rab tu skyes par gyur pa na thugs 'du shes 'dzin pa por 'gyur te nyid ces pa ni mtha' gcig tu @227b nges pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nas so sum cu rtsa gnyis rab tu skyes par gyur pa na thugs 'du shes 'dzin pa por 'gyur te nyid ces pa ni mtha' gcig tu @227b nges pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Then, when the thirty-two teeth are fully formed, one is the vajra mind, the holder of concepts, and the word “only” means it is certain.

original: slar yang so lhung nas so sum cu rtsa gnyis rab tu skyes par gyur pa na khu ba 'pho ba'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i mtshan nyid de bud med rnams kyi lo bcu gnyis kyi mtshams dang skyes pa rnams kyi lo bcu
analyzed: slar yang so lhung nas so sum cu rtsa gnyis rab tu skyes par gyur pa na khu ba 'pho ba'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i mtshan nyid de bud med rnams kyi lo bcu gnyis kyi mtshams dang skyes pa rnams kyi lo bcu
translated: Again, when the teeth fall out and the thirty-two teeth are fully grown, the characteristic of the stage of emission of the seminal essence is the characteristic of innate joy, which should be known to be at the age of twelve for women and at the age of sixteen for men.🔽The reason for the statement that the four great elements are the cause of the four joys is that the four joys are produced from the four great elements.🔽The reason for the statement that the four great elements are the cause of the four joys is that the four joys are produced from the four great elements.

original: drug gi mtshams su rig par bya'o //🔽sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes rdzogs pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //🔽rten dang rten pa'i 'brel ba gsungs pas zhes pa la sogs pa ste sa'i snying po dag ni bsreg za mer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: drug gi mtshams su rig par bya'o // sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes rdzogs pa brjod pa'i phyir ro // rten dang rten pa'i 'brel ba gsungs pas zhes pa la sogs pa ste sa'i snying po dag ni bsreg za mer 'gyur ro //
translated: The reason for the statement that the four great elements are the cause of the four joys is that the four joys are produced from the four great elements.🔽The reason for the statement that the four great elements are the cause of the four joys is that the four joys are produced from the four great elements.🔽The reason for the statement that the four great elements are the cause of the four joys is that the four joys are produced from the four great elements.

original: de'i rigs can ni ma yin te sa'i yon tan gyi rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dzin ma dang rlung dag ni nam mkha'i snying po stong pa'i dbus na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rigs can ni ma yin te sa'i yon tan gyi rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro // 'dzin ma dang rlung dag ni nam mkha'i snying po stong pa'i dbus na gnas pa'o //
translated: The reason for the statement that the four great elements are the cause of the four joys is that the four joys are produced from the four great elements.

original: de'i rigs las skyes pa ni ma yin te nam mkha'i yon tan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rigs las skyes pa ni ma yin te nam mkha'i yon tan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason for the statement that the four great elements are the cause of the four joys is that the four joys are produced from the four great elements.🔽The reason for the statement that the four great elements are the cause of the four joys is that the four joys are produced from the four great elements.🔽The reason for the statement that the four great elements are the cause of the four joys is that the four joys are produced from the four great elements.🔽The reason for the statement that the four great elements are the cause of the four joys is that the four joys are produced from the four great elements.

original: de bzhin du rlung gi snying po dang sa'i snying po dag ni chu yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung gi snying po dang sa'i snying po dag ni chu yin no //
translated: Likewise, the essence of wind and the essence of earth are water.

original: rlung gi snying po de nyid ni rang bzhin med pa rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs kyis gnas pa ste gang dang gang du rlung yang dag par rgyu ba de dang der de dang lhan cig 'gro'o //
analyzed: rlung gi snying po de nyid ni rang bzhin med pa rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs kyis gnas pa ste gang dang gang du rlung yang dag par rgyu ba de dang der de dang lhan cig 'gro'o //
translated: The essence of wind is the absence of intrinsic nature, which is present in the form of a concordant state, for it moves along with the wind wherever it moves.

original: sa'i nang na gnas pa gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin te sa la rko bar byed pa na gsher ba'i ngo bor mthong ngo //🔽'dir slar yang nam mkha' ni sa la sogs pa thams cad kyi rten te sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba rnams ni rten pa'o //
analyzed: sa'i nang na gnas pa gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin te sa la rko bar byed pa na gsher ba'i ngo bor mthong ngo // 'dir slar yang nam mkha' ni sa la sogs pa thams cad kyi rten te sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba rnams ni rten pa'o //
translated: That which is present within the earth is the intrinsic nature, for when one digs into the earth, one sees the essence of water.🔽Here, space is the support of earth and so on, and the elements of earth and so on are supported.

original: 'dir rten dang rten pa ni rim pa bzhin du 'gyur te sa yi rten ni chu ste phyi rol du sa yi dkyil 'khor gyi rten chu yi dkyil 'khor yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du lus la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dir rten dang rten pa ni rim pa bzhin du 'gyur te sa yi rten ni chu ste phyi rol du sa yi dkyil 'khor gyi rten chu yi dkyil 'khor yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du lus la yang ngo //
translated: Here, the support and the supported are in a sequential order: the support of earth is water, just as the support of the earth mandala is the water mandala, and so on.

original: 'bar byed dag kyang ste me'i dkyil 'khor ni chu yi zhes pa chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi rten no //
analyzed: 'bar byed dag kyang ste me'i dkyil 'khor ni chu yi zhes pa chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi rten no //
translated: The fuel is also the support of the circle of fire, the circle of water is the support of the circle of fire.

original: rlung zhes pa rlung gi dkyil 'khor ni dag par byed pa me'i dkyil 'khor dag gi'o //
analyzed: rlung zhes pa rlung gi dkyil 'khor ni dag par byed pa me'i dkyil 'khor dag gi'o //
translated: The circle of wind is the support of the circle of fire, which purifies.

original: rlung gi zhes pa rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi rten ni stong pa ste nam mkha'o //
analyzed: rlung gi zhes pa rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi rten ni stong pa ste nam mkha'o //
translated: The support of the circle of wind is empty space.

original: de ltar stong pa ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba thams cad kyi rten du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar stong pa ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba thams cad kyi rten du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, space is the support of all the elements, earth, etc.

original: tshogs pa'i rten dang rten pa gsungs pa phung po zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir lus la phung po lnga po rnams kyi rten ni 'byung ba rnams te sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba'i tshogs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i rten dang rten pa gsungs pa phung po zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir lus la phung po lnga po rnams kyi rten ni 'byung ba rnams te sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba'i tshogs su 'gyur ro //
translated: The support of the collection and the supported collection are stated in the verse beginning with “aggregate.” Here, the support of the five aggregates in the body is the elements, which are the collection of earth, etc.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dir sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin med na ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rkyen med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin med na ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rkyen med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, if there were no earth, etc., there would be no conditions for ignorance, etc.

original: ma rig pa dang 'du byed dang @228a * //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'du byed dang @228a * //
translated: Ignorance, formations,

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen med na gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po med de gang gi phyir 'byung ba bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi gzugs dang khams drug gi bdag nyid kyi skyes bu chen po'i gang zag yod pa de'i phyir phung po'i rten ni 'byung ba rnams su 'gyur
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen med na gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po med de gang gi phyir 'byung ba bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi gzugs dang khams drug gi bdag nyid kyi skyes bu chen po'i gang zag yod pa de'i phyir phung po'i rten ni 'byung ba rnams su 'gyur
translated: If there were no conditions for consciousness, there would be no aggregates of form and so on. Because there is a person with the nature of the four elements and the nature of the six elements, therefore the support of the aggregates would be the elements.

original: ro // lus mchog ngag la 'byung ba'i tshogs kyi rten ni rtsa stod phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro // lus mchog ngag la 'byung ba'i tshogs kyi rten ni rtsa stod phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: The support of the collection of elements in the supreme body and speech would be the seventy-two thousand channels.

original: rtsa de dag rnams kyi yang rten ni srog gi rlung ste 'du byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa de dag rnams kyi yang rten ni srog gi rlung ste 'du byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the support of those channels is the life-force wind, because it is the cause of formation.

original: de yang rnam pa bcu ste 'chad par 'gyur ba las brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bcu ste 'chad par 'gyur ba las brjod par bya'o //
translated: That is of ten types, to be described later.

original: srog gi rlung rnams dag gi rten ni sems yin no //
analyzed: srog gi rlung rnams dag gi rten ni sems yin no //
translated: The support of the life-force winds is the mind.

original: sems de ni ste de nyid gnyis kyi rang bzhin gyi sems su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems de ni ste de nyid gnyis kyi rang bzhin gyi sems su 'gyur ro //
translated: That mind is the support of the two, becoming the mind with the nature of the two.

original: yon tan dbang gis zhes pa la snying stobs dang rdul gyi dbang gis ni rang bzhin can sad pa dang rmi lam gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yon tan dbang gis zhes pa la snying stobs dang rdul gyi dbang gis ni rang bzhin can sad pa dang rmi lam gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: “By the power of the qualities” means that the state of dreaming is characterized by the power of rajas and sattva, and the state of deep sleep is characterized by the absence of rajas and sattva, and is the state of tamas.

original: mun pa'i yon tan gyi dbang gis rang bzhin med pa shin tu gnyid log pa'i mtshan nyid dbang po med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mun pa'i yon tan gyi dbang gis rang bzhin med pa shin tu gnyid log pa'i mtshan nyid dbang po med par 'gyur ro //
translated: “By the power of the qualities of tamas” means that the state of deep sleep is characterized by the absence of rajas and sattva, and is the state of tamas, and is the state of the absence of the senses.

original: rang bzhin can dang rang bzhin med pa de dag gi yang rten ni gtso bo ste 'khor ba pa rnams kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin can dang rang bzhin med pa de dag gi yang rten ni gtso bo ste 'khor ba pa rnams kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The support of the state of dreaming and the state of deep sleep is the primal substance, which is the support of the states of pleasure and pain of transmigrating beings.

original: de yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang bral ba ni srid pa gsum gyis btud cing gzhom med kun tu 'gro ba gang yin pa de yin te /
analyzed: de yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang bral ba ni srid pa gsum gyis btud cing gzhom med kun tu 'gro ba gang yin pa de yin te /
translated: And that is the state of the absence of pleasure and pain, which is bowed to by the three worlds, which is imperishable, and which is all-pervading.

original: bde sdug sil ba mthar gyur pa zhes so //
analyzed: bde sdug sil ba mthar gyur pa zhes so //
translated: It is the end of the scattering of pleasure and pain.

original: dri zhes pa la sogs pa khams rnams kyi bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i 'brel ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dri zhes pa la sogs pa khams rnams kyi bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i 'brel ba gsungs te /
translated: The connection between the elements, such as smell, and the objects to be produced is stated.

original: 'dir phyi rol lam nang du dri ni 'dzin ma dag las 'byung bar 'gyur te gtso bos so //
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol lam nang du dri ni 'dzin ma dag las 'byung bar 'gyur te gtso bos so //
translated: Here, smell arises from earth and water, because they are the principal elements.

original: phal pas ni ro la sogs pa rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: phal pas ni ro la sogs pa rnams kyang ngo //
translated: The others, taste, etc., also arise from the other elements, fire, etc.

original: ro rnam pa drug ni yang zhes pa srid pa'i don te rtse mo can me'i khams las te gang gi phyir yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa de'i phyir me las ro 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro rnam pa drug ni yang zhes pa srid pa'i don te rtse mo can me'i khams las te gang gi phyir yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa de'i phyir me las ro 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Taste has six varieties, sweet, sour, salty, pungent, bitter, and astringent. It arises from the fire element, because it is the cause of maturation.

original: gzugs kyi khams ni chu las so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ni chu las so //
translated: The form element arises from water.

original: 'dir myu gu la sogs pa rnams skye ba la sogs pa ni kha dog sna tshogs dang dbyibs sna tshogs su chu las 'gyur te gtso bos so //
analyzed: 'dir myu gu la sogs pa rnams skye ba la sogs pa ni kha dog sna tshogs dang dbyibs sna tshogs su chu las 'gyur te gtso bos so //
translated: Here, the arising of sprouts, etc., is due to water, because of its various colors and shapes.

original: phal pas ni ro la sogs pa rnams kyang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phal pas ni ro la sogs pa rnams kyang 'byung ngo //
translated: The others, taste, etc., also arise from the other elements, fire, etc.

original: de bzhin du rlung ste rlung gi khams las reg pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung ste rlung gi khams las reg pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, touch arises from the wind element.

original: zhi ba ste ye shes kyi khams las sgra dang zhes pa sgra 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhi ba ste ye shes kyi khams las sgra dang zhes pa sgra 'byung ngo //
translated: Sound arises from the peace element, i.e., from the consciousness element.

original: chos kyi khams te byang chub kyi sems kyi khams ni nam mkha' ste lnga'i bdag nyid kyi ro'i khams gsal bar byed @228b pa las 'byung bar 'gyur te bde ba'i gnas skabs las so //
analyzed: chos kyi khams te byang chub kyi sems kyi khams ni nam mkha' ste lnga'i bdag nyid kyi ro'i khams gsal bar byed @228b pa las 'byung bar 'gyur te bde ba'i gnas skabs las so //
translated: The element of phenomena, the element of the mind of enlightenment, is space. The element of taste, which has the nature of the five, arises from the state of bliss.

original: da ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i 'brel ba gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i 'brel ba gsungs te /
translated: Now he speaks of the connection between the grasped and the grasper.

original: 'dir gzhan gyi rigs la 'khyud pas bya ba 'grub par 'gyur te rang gi rigs la 'khyud pa ni bdag nyid la rang gi bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyi rigs la 'khyud pas bya ba 'grub par 'gyur te rang gi rigs la 'khyud pa ni bdag nyid la rang gi bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the accomplishment of the action is by embracing another type, because embracing one's own type is contradictory to one's own action.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi rigs la 'khyud pa ni lus skyed pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi rigs la 'khyud pa ni lus skyed pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, embracing another type becomes the cause of generating the body.

original: des na stong pa zhes pa stong pa'i rigs las byung ba'i rna ba'i dbang pos ni ye shes kyi khams las byung ba'i sgra 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: des na stong pa zhes pa stong pa'i rigs las byung ba'i rna ba'i dbang pos ni ye shes kyi khams las byung ba'i sgra 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Thus, the ear faculty, which arises from the empty type, called empty, apprehends sound, which arises from the element of gnosis.

original: nges par rgyal ba skyed mdzad ces pa ni gdon mi za bar ye shes kyi khams las byung ba'i yid kyi dbang pos nam mkha'i khams las byung ba'i yul chos kyi khams 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: nges par rgyal ba skyed mdzad ces pa ni gdon mi za bar ye shes kyi khams las byung ba'i yid kyi dbang pos nam mkha'i khams las byung ba'i yul chos kyi khams 'dzin par byed do //
translated: “The generating of the Victor” means that the mental faculty, which arises from the element of consciousness, certainly apprehends the object element, which arises from the element of space.

original: rlung dag ni zhes pa bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa dbyer med pa nyid kyis te rlung las byung ba'i sna'i dbang pos sa'i khams las byung ba'i yul dri 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: rlung dag ni zhes pa bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa dbyer med pa nyid kyis te rlung las byung ba'i sna'i dbang pos sa'i khams las byung ba'i yul dri 'dzin par byed do //
translated: “The winds” means that the nose faculty, which arises from the wind element, apprehends the object smell, which arises from the earth element, by the inseparability of the generated and the generator.

original: me yang zhes pa ni me'i khams las byung ba mig gi dbang pos chu'i khams las skyes pa'i yul gzugs 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: me yang zhes pa ni me'i khams las byung ba mig gi dbang pos chu'i khams las skyes pa'i yul gzugs 'dzin par byed do //
translated: “Fire” means that the eye faculty, which arises from the fire element, apprehends the object form, which arises from the water element.

original: chu'i khams las byung ba lce'i dbang pos me'i khams las skyes pa'i yul ro 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: chu'i khams las byung ba lce'i dbang pos me'i khams las skyes pa'i yul ro 'dzin par byed do //
translated: “The water element” means that the tongue faculty, which arises from the water element, apprehends the object taste, which arises from the fire element.

original: 'dzin ma zhes pa sa'i khams las byung ba lus kyi dbang pos rlung gi khams las byung ba'i yul reg bya 'dzin par byed de yul dang yul can rnams kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin ma zhes pa sa'i khams las byung ba lus kyi dbang pos rlung gi khams las byung ba'i yul reg bya 'dzin par byed de yul dang yul can rnams kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
translated: The so-called earth element is the sense-faculty of the body, which is derived from the earth element, and it apprehends the object of touch, which is derived from the wind element. This is the ascertainment of the characteristics of the object and subject in the case of all objects and subjects.

original: 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams khams so so la grub par gsungs pa grub pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir khams dang phung po rnams gcig nyid du grub par gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams khams so so la grub par gsungs pa grub pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir khams dang phung po rnams gcig nyid du grub par gsungs so //
translated: The aggregates of form, etc., are said to be established in the individual elements by the conventional truth of the world. This is what is referred to by the words “established, etc.” Here, the elements and the aggregates are said to be established as identical.

original: 'dir gzugs ni 'dzin ma la gtso bos grub pa ste 'du shes la sogs pa rnams ni phal pas grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzugs ni 'dzin ma la gtso bos grub pa ste 'du shes la sogs pa rnams ni phal pas grub pa'o //
translated: Here, form is established by the primary principle in the earth element, while feeling, etc., are established by the secondary principles in the water element, etc.

original: srid pa gsum gyi gnas su ste khams gsum gyi yul du yin gyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: srid pa gsum gyi gnas su ste khams gsum gyi yul du yin gyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos la ni ma yin no //
translated: In the three realms of existence, i.e., in the objects of the three realms, and not in the dharmas of nirvana.

original: yang yig las chu la ni 'du shes zhes grub par 'gyur te 'dir 'du shes bya ba ni dbyangs kyi chos zla ba dang khu ba dang chu'i rang bzhin te chu'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir chu la 'du shes grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni nges pa'o
analyzed: yang yig las chu la ni 'du shes zhes grub par 'gyur te 'dir 'du shes bya ba ni dbyangs kyi chos zla ba dang khu ba dang chu'i rang bzhin te chu'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir chu la 'du shes grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni nges pa'o
translated: Again, in the commentary, it says that consciousness is established in water. Here, consciousness is the attribute of sound, the nature of the moon, semen, and water. Since it is the nature of water, consciousness is established in water. This is certain.

original: // me la nges pa nyid du 'tshor ba zhes pa la 'dir me'i rang bzhin ni nyi ma dang rdul dad k'a li ste nyi ma dang rdul dang k'a li'i rang bzhin ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: // me la nges pa nyid du 'tshor ba zhes pa la 'dir me'i rang bzhin ni nyi ma dang rdul dad k'a li ste nyi ma dang rdul dang k'a li'i rang bzhin ni tshor ba'o //
translated: In fire, feeling is established. Here, the nature of fire is the sun, the particle, and the ka-li. Feeling has the nature of the sun, the particle, and the ka-li.

original: de'i phyir @229a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir @229a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: me la tshor ba gtso bos grub par 'gyur te lhag ma rnams ni phal pas rab tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me la tshor ba gtso bos grub par 'gyur te lhag ma rnams ni phal pas rab tu 'gyur ro //
translated: feeling is established in fire, with the principal element. The remaining elements are secondary.

original: rlung la 'du byed kyi phung po grub ste de bzhin du 'dir rlung ni lus dang ngag dang sems yang dag par g-yo bar byed pa 'du byed skyed par byed pa ste des na rlung gi rang bzhin ni 'du byed du grub bo //
analyzed: rlung la 'du byed kyi phung po grub ste de bzhin du 'dir rlung ni lus dang ngag dang sems yang dag par g-yo bar byed pa 'du byed skyed par byed pa ste des na rlung gi rang bzhin ni 'du byed du grub bo //
translated: In wind, the aggregate of formation is established. Here, wind is the correct mover of body, speech, and mind, the producer of formation. Therefore, the nature of wind is established as formation.

original: de bzhin du rnam shes ye shes bsres pa ste ye shes dang bcas pa ni rim pa bzhin du nam mkha' dang bcas rdo rje dag la ste nam mkha' la rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par shes par grub bo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam shes ye shes bsres pa ste ye shes dang bcas pa ni rim pa bzhin du nam mkha' dang bcas rdo rje dag la ste nam mkha' la rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par shes par grub bo //
translated: Likewise, consciousness mixed with intuition, i.e., endowed with intuition, is established in the space-endowed vajra, i.e., in space, as the consciousness characterized by the ear-consciousness, etc.

original: rdo rje ste ye shes kyi khams la byang chub kyi sems 'pho ba'i mthar bde ba'i skad cig gi bdag nyid kyi ye shes grub bo //
analyzed: rdo rje ste ye shes kyi khams la byang chub kyi sems 'pho ba'i mthar bde ba'i skad cig gi bdag nyid kyi ye shes grub bo //
translated: And in the vajra, i.e., the element of intuition, the intuition having the nature of the moment of bliss at the end of the emission of the spirit of enlightenment is established.

original: 'dir khams drug gi bdag nyid can skyes bu chen po'i gang zag gi lus la ci'i phyir khams dang phung po la sogs pa thams cad du 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir khams drug gi bdag nyid can skyes bu chen po'i gang zag gi lus la ci'i phyir khams dang phung po la sogs pa thams cad du 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Here, one may ask, “Why are all the elements, aggregates, etc. of the person, who is the nature of the six elements, the Great Being?” It is said:

original: rdul dang byang chub sems sogs sbyor bas so //
analyzed: rdul dang byang chub sems sogs sbyor bas so //
translated: By the union of the atom and the spirit of enlightenment, etc.

original: 'dir lus la khams dang phung po la sogs pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni rdul dang khu ba dang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i bde ba'i skad cig gi gnas skabs sbyor ba las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir lus la khams dang phung po la sogs pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni rdul dang khu ba dang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i bde ba'i skad cig gi gnas skabs sbyor ba las 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, all of that which is the elements and aggregates, etc. in the body is transformed from the state of the bliss-moment of the semen, ovum, and ālaya consciousness.

original: rna ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa rnams sgra la sogs pa'i yul 'dzin par byed pa nyid kyis de'i rang bzhin nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa rnams sgra la sogs pa'i yul 'dzin par byed pa nyid kyis de'i rang bzhin nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: The apprehending ear, etc. are said to be of the nature of sound, etc. by virtue of their apprehending the objects of sound, etc.

original: rna ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir lus kyi chos la rna ba ni stong pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin par byed pa nyid kyis gzung ba'i yul 'dzin pas rdo rje'i rang bzhin te sgra'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rna ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir lus kyi chos la rna ba ni stong pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin par byed pa nyid kyis gzung ba'i yul 'dzin pas rdo rje'i rang bzhin te sgra'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The ear, etc. are of the nature of vajra, i.e., of sound, by virtue of apprehending the object to be apprehended by virtue of apprehending the characteristic of emptiness.

original: 'dir 'dzin pa'i chos ni lus kyi dbye bas gsungs te gzung ba'i chos de bsam pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: 'dir 'dzin pa'i chos ni lus kyi dbye bas gsungs te gzung ba'i chos de bsam pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: Here, the apprehending phenomena are taught by way of the divisions of the body, and the apprehended phenomena are by way of the divisions of the mind.

original: de'i phyir gzung bar bya ba'i rang bzhin gyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin rnam par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzung bar bya ba'i rang bzhin gyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin rnam par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the nature of the object is to be produced, and the nature of the subject is to be the producer.

original: mi yi bdag po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: mi yi bdag po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: The lord of men is the perceiver.

original: sems te yid ni nam mkha' dag gi rang bzhin zhes pa chos kyi khams kyi rang bzhin te yul chos kyi khams 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems te yid ni nam mkha' dag gi rang bzhin zhes pa chos kyi khams kyi rang bzhin te yul chos kyi khams 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The mind, the intellect, is of the nature of space, i.e., of the element of mental objects, because it apprehends the object, the element of mental objects.

original: sna ni sa yi rang bzhin zhes pa dri'i rang bzhin te dri 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sna ni sa yi rang bzhin zhes pa dri'i rang bzhin te dri 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nose is of the nature of earth, i.e., of odor, because it apprehends odor.

original: de bzhin kho na lce ni me'i rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur snga ma bzhin du me las skyes pa ro'i rang bzhin te ro 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin kho na lce ni me'i rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur snga ma bzhin du me las skyes pa ro'i rang bzhin te ro 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, the tongue is of the nature of fire, i.e., born of fire, and of the nature of taste, because it apprehends taste.

original: mig ni chu yi rang bzhin dag ste chu las skyes pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig ni chu yi rang bzhin dag ste chu las skyes pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eye is of the nature of water, because it apprehends form born of water.

original: srid pa gsum gyi gnas su ste mya ngan las 'das pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: srid pa gsum gyi gnas su ste mya ngan las 'das pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: In the three worlds, not in nirvana.

original: lus kyang rlung gi rang bzhin no @229b zhes pa ni lus kyi dbang pos yul reg bya rlung las skyes pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyang rlung gi rang bzhin no @229b zhes pa ni lus kyi dbang pos yul reg bya rlung las skyes pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The body also has the nature of wind, because the body faculty apprehends the object of touch that arises from wind.

original: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas rna ba la sogs pa thams cad 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis zhes pa ni sgra dang chos kyi khams dang dri dang ro dang gzugs dang reg bya'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas rna ba la sogs pa thams cad 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis zhes pa ni sgra dang chos kyi khams dang dri dang ro dang gzugs dang reg bya'i dbang gis so //
translated: In this way, all faculties such as the ear and so on are transformed by the order of expression.

original: rna ba dang yid dang sna dang lce dang mig dang lus te dbang po drug gi khams 'di dag ni ye shes rnam shes sbyor ba las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rna ba dang yid dang sna dang lce dang mig dang lus te dbang po drug gi khams 'di dag ni ye shes rnam shes sbyor ba las shes par bya'o //
translated: The faculties of the ear, mind, nose, tongue, eye, and body are to be understood from the union of wisdom and consciousness.🔽The six transformations of the mind such as miserliness and so on are stated due to the power of the six elements.

original: khams drug gi dbang gis ser sna la sogs pa sems kyi rnam par 'gyur ba drug gsungs pa ser sna zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir lus la sems kyi ser sna ni ye shes khams la zhes pa lnga pa'i don la bdun pa ste ;
analyzed: khams drug gi dbang gis ser sna la sogs pa sems kyi rnam par 'gyur ba drug gsungs pa ser sna zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir lus la sems kyi ser sna ni ye shes khams la zhes pa lnga pa'i don la bdun pa ste ;
translated: The miserliness of the body is the miserliness of the wisdom element.

original: ye shes kyi khams kyi dbang gis sems can rnams kyi ser sna'i sems so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ye shes kyi khams kyi dbang gis sems can rnams kyi ser sna'i sems so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that by the power of the element of consciousness, the minds of sentient beings are miserly.

original: nam mkha' la ni zhe sdang rdo rje'o zhes pa ni nam mkha'i khams kyi dbang gis sems can rnams kyi zhe sdang gi sems so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni zhe sdang rdo rje'o zhes pa ni nam mkha'i khams kyi dbang gis sems can rnams kyi zhe sdang gi sems so //
translated: In space, there is the mind of hatred, meaning that by the power of the element of space, the minds of sentient beings are hateful.

original: de bzhin du rlung gi khams kyi dbang gis phrag dog gi sems so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung gi khams kyi dbang gis phrag dog gi sems so //
translated: Similarly, by the power of the element of wind, the minds of sentient beings are jealous.

original: me'i khams kyi dbang gis chags pa'i sems te de nyid thub pas rab tu gsal bar mdzad do //
analyzed: me'i khams kyi dbang gis chags pa'i sems te de nyid thub pas rab tu gsal bar mdzad do //
translated: By the power of the element of fire, the minds of sentient beings are lustful. The Sage has clearly stated this.

original: de bzhin nyid du chu'i khams kyi dbang gis nga rgyal gyi sems so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du chu'i khams kyi dbang gis nga rgyal gyi sems so //
translated: Similarly, by the power of the element of water, the minds of sentient beings are proud.
