original: sa yi khams kyi dbang gis gti mug gi sems te rang bzhin ni ye shes la sogs pa'i khams kyi chos so //
analyzed: sa yi khams kyi dbang gis gti mug gi sems te rang bzhin ni ye shes la sogs pa'i khams kyi chos so //
translated: By the power of the element of earth, the minds of sentient beings are deluded. The nature is the phenomena of the elements of consciousness and so on.

original: de'i yon tan ni rang bzhin rnams te de'i rang bzhin gyi dbang gis 'khor ba pa rnams kyi sems la ser sna la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i yon tan ni rang bzhin rnams te de'i rang bzhin gyi dbang gis 'khor ba pa rnams kyi sems la ser sna la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The qualities of that are the natures. By the power of those natures, the minds of samsaric beings become miserly and so on.

original: khams kyi dbang gis las kyi dbang po rnams gsungs pa /
analyzed: khams kyi dbang gis las kyi dbang po rnams gsungs pa /
translated: The faculties of action are taught in terms of the elements.

original: ngag ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir ngag gi dbang po ni rlung gi khams las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngag ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir ngag gi dbang po ni rlung gi khams las 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the faculty of speech is formed from the wind element.

original: lag pa'i dbang po ni me'i khams las so //🔽rkang pa'i dbang po ni chu'i khams las so //
analyzed: lag pa'i dbang po ni me'i khams las so // rkang pa'i dbang po ni chu'i khams las so //
translated: The faculty of the arms is formed from the fire element.🔽The faculty of the legs is formed from the water element.

original: bshang lam gyi dbang po ni sa'i khams las so //
analyzed: bshang lam gyi dbang po ni sa'i khams las so //
translated: The faculty of the anus is formed from the earth element.

original: ma brjod pa nyid las gsang ba'i dbang po ni nam mkha'i khams las so //
analyzed: ma brjod pa nyid las gsang ba'i dbang po ni nam mkha'i khams las so //
translated: The faculty of the genitals is formed from the space element, since it is not mentioned.

original: lo bcu drug gi mthar mchog gi dbang po ni ye shes kyi khams las 'gyur ro zhes pa ni las kyi dbang po drug gi nges pa'o //
analyzed: lo bcu drug gi mthar mchog gi dbang po ni ye shes kyi khams las 'gyur ro zhes pa ni las kyi dbang po drug gi nges pa'o //
translated: At the end of the sixteenth year, the supreme faculty is formed from the element of gnosis. This is the definition of the six faculties of action.

original: thur sel zhes pa la sogs pas khams drug las thur sel la sogs pa'i rlung rnams gsungs te /
analyzed: thur sel zhes pa la sogs pas khams drug las thur sel la sogs pa'i rlung rnams gsungs te /
translated: The six elements are taught by the winds of exhalation and so on.

original: 'dir lus la thur sel gyi rlung ni ye shes kyi khams la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir lus la thur sel gyi rlung ni ye shes kyi khams la 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the downward-voiding wind in the body is formed from the element of gnosis.

original: 'dir yang lnga pa'i don la bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang lnga pa'i don la bdun pa'o //
translated: Here also, the meaning of the fifth is the seventh.

original: de yang bshang ba dang gci ba dang khu ba 'dren par byed pa las rnam gsum zhes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang bshang ba dang gci ba dang khu ba 'dren par byed pa las rnam gsum zhes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Further, it is said to be threefold, from the drawing up of feces, urine, and semen.

original: srog @230a * //
analyzed: srog @230a * //
translated: The life-force

original: gi rlung ni stong pa la ste nam mkha'i khams las so //
analyzed: gi rlung ni stong pa la ste nam mkha'i khams las so //
translated: is in the void, from the space element.

original: yang yig gis de yang rnam pa gsum ste g-yon dang g-yas dang dbu ma'i rtsar rab tu 'bab pa las so //
analyzed: yang yig gis de yang rnam pa gsum ste g-yon dang g-yas dang dbu ma'i rtsar rab tu 'bab pa las so //
translated: The word “also” indicates that it is threefold, from the flow in the left, right, and central channels.

original: rlung gi dbus su ste rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin las mnyam gnas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung gi dbus su ste rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin las mnyam gnas su 'gyur ro //
translated: In the middle of the wind, from the nature of the wind element, it is the “abiding.”

original: rtse mo can te me'i khams la slar yang gyen rgyu'o //
analyzed: rtse mo can te me'i khams la slar yang gyen rgyu'o //
translated: In the tip, from the fire element, it is the “upward-moving.”

original: chu la ste chu'i khams la khyab byed do //
analyzed: chu la ste chu'i khams la khyab byed do //
translated: In the water, from the water element, it is the “pervading.”

original: sa la zhes pa sa'i khams la klu'o //
analyzed: sa la zhes pa sa'i khams la klu'o //
translated: In the earth, from the earth element, it is the “snake.”

original: de nas de ma thag tu rus sbal la sogs pa bzhi po rnams te rlung gi khams las rus sbal du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas de ma thag tu rus sbal la sogs pa bzhi po rnams te rlung gi khams las rus sbal du 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, immediately after that, the four, the tortoise and so on, are from the wind element, the tortoise;

original: me'i khams las rtsangs pa'o //
analyzed: me'i khams las rtsangs pa'o //
translated: from the fire element, the lizard;

original: chu'i khams las lha sbyin no //
analyzed: chu'i khams las lha sbyin no //
translated: from the water element, the god-given;

original: sa'i khams las nor las rgyal ba'o ;
analyzed: sa'i khams las nor las rgyal ba'o ;
translated: and from the earth element, the conqueror of wealth.

original: / lo bcu drug gi mthar nam mkha'i khams las dga' ba'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: / lo bcu drug gi mthar nam mkha'i khams las dga' ba'i rlung ngo //
translated: At the end of sixteen years, the wind of joy from the space element.

original: ye shes kyi khams las lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: ye shes kyi khams las lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rlung ngo //
translated: The wind of innate joy from the wisdom element.

original: gtsug tor zhes pa la sogs pas khams kyi dbang gis lus kyi lag pa la sogs pa'i tshigs la 'khor lo la sogs pa rnams gsungs te /
analyzed: gtsug tor zhes pa la sogs pas khams kyi dbang gis lus kyi lag pa la sogs pa'i tshigs la 'khor lo la sogs pa rnams gsungs te /
translated: The cakras and so forth in the body's joints, such as the hands, are taught by the words “the uṣṇīṣa” and so forth, in terms of the elements.

original: 'dir nam mkha'i khams las gtsug tor gyi padma 'am 'khor lor 'gyur te 'dab ma'i grangs ni 'chad par 'gyur ba las brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir nam mkha'i khams las gtsug tor gyi padma 'am 'khor lor 'gyur te 'dab ma'i grangs ni 'chad par 'gyur ba las brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here, the uṣṇīṣa lotus or cakra is from the space element. The number of petals will be explained later.

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ni ye shes kyi khams las kyang gsang bar 'gyur te gsang ba'i padma'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ni ye shes kyi khams las kyang gsang bar 'gyur te gsang ba'i padma'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The secret is from the wisdom element of gods and humans. The meaning of “secret” is the secret lotus.

original: snying gi padma rlung gi khams las 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: snying gi padma rlung gi khams las 'gyur ro ;
translated: The heart lotus is from the wind element.

original: / rab gsal rtse mo can las mgrin pa'i 'khor lor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / rab gsal rtse mo can las mgrin pa'i 'khor lor 'gyur ro //
translated: The throat cakra is from the clear-tipped element.

original: gsal bar ni nges par ro //
analyzed: gsal bar ni nges par ro //
translated: “Clearly” means definitely.

original: chu'i khams las smin ma'i nang gi padma'o //
analyzed: chu'i khams las smin ma'i nang gi padma'o //
translated: The forehead lotus is from the water element.

original: nor ni nor te drug cu rtsa bzhi'i 'dab ldan lte ba'i padma ni sa'i khams las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nor ni nor te drug cu rtsa bzhi'i 'dab ldan lte ba'i padma ni sa'i khams las 'gyur ro //
translated: The wealth is the wealth, the lotus of the navel with sixty-four petals, which is formed from the earth element.

original: tshigs drug ces pa ni mang ba'i tshig la gcig gi tshig go //
analyzed: tshigs drug ces pa ni mang ba'i tshig la gcig gi tshig go //
translated: The six spokes are the six fingers, the six fingers being one finger.

original: rkang pa lag pa dag gi ste rkang pa g-yon pa'i gsum ni sa'i khams kyi snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i yon tan rnams kyi dbye ba las 'gyur te ma hi zhes pa thung ngu ni sa'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: rkang pa lag pa dag gi ste rkang pa g-yon pa'i gsum ni sa'i khams kyi snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i yon tan rnams kyi dbye ba las 'gyur te ma hi zhes pa thung ngu ni sa'i rnam grangs so //
translated: The three of the left foot are formed from the division of the qualities sattva, rajas, and tamas of the earth element.

original: rkang pa g-yas pa'i gsum ni chu'i khams kyi yon tan gsum gyi dbye ba las so //🔽lag pa g-yon pa'i gsum ni me'i yon tan gsum gyi dbye ba las so //
analyzed: rkang pa g-yas pa'i gsum ni chu'i khams kyi yon tan gsum gyi dbye ba las so // lag pa g-yon pa'i gsum ni me'i yon tan gsum gyi dbye ba las so //
translated: The three of the right foot are from the division of the three qualities of the water element.🔽The three of the left hand are from the division of the three qualities of the fire element.

original: lag pa g-yas pa'i gsum ni rlung gi yon tan gsum gyi dbye ba las te rlung rnams dag la gsum gyi grangs zhes so //
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa'i gsum ni rlung gi yon tan gsum gyi dbye ba las te rlung rnams dag la gsum gyi grangs zhes so //
translated: The three of the right hand are from the division of the three qualities of the wind element.

original: 'khor lo bcu gnyis ni 'chad par 'gyur ba las brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo bcu gnyis ni 'chad par 'gyur ba las brjod par bya'o //
translated: The twelve wheels will be described in the chapter to come.

original: 'khor lo bcva brgyad kyi nges @230b pa'o ;
analyzed: 'khor lo bcva brgyad kyi nges @230b pa'o ;
translated: This is the certainty of the eighteen wheels.

original: / da ni sa zhes pa la sogs pas khams kyi dbang gis sor mo 'byung ba gsungs te /
analyzed: / da ni sa zhes pa la sogs pas khams kyi dbang gis sor mo 'byung ba gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with “The fingers and toes,” he teaches the arising of the fingers and toes by the power of the elements.

original: 'dir lag pa dang rkang pa dag gi mthe bo la sogs pa mthe chung gi mthar thug pa rnams g-yon pa dang g-yas pa la yang khams lnga yon tan gsum gyi rang bzhin gyis tshigs gsum gyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: 'dir lag pa dang rkang pa dag gi mthe bo la sogs pa mthe chung gi mthar thug pa rnams g-yon pa dang g-yas pa la yang khams lnga yon tan gsum gyi rang bzhin gyis tshigs gsum gyi bdag nyid de /
translated: Here, the thumbs and so forth, up to the little fingers of the hands and feet, on the left and right, are of the nature of the five elements and three qualities, with three joints each.

original: de la sa'i khams kyi dbang gis mthe bong du 'gyur te sa'i khams kyi yon tan gsum gyi dbang gis mthe bo'i tshigs gsum mo //
analyzed: de la sa'i khams kyi dbang gis mthe bong du 'gyur te sa'i khams kyi yon tan gsum gyi dbang gis mthe bo'i tshigs gsum mo //
translated: Therein, by the power of the earth element, there is the thumb, with three joints of the three qualities of the earth element.

original: de bzhin du chu'i khams kyi rang bzhin gyis mdzub mo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chu'i khams kyi rang bzhin gyis mdzub mo'o //
translated: Similarly, by the nature of the water element, there is the index finger.

original: de bzhin du me'i khams kyi rang bzhin gyis gung mo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du me'i khams kyi rang bzhin gyis gung mo'o //
translated: Similarly, by the nature of the fire element, there is the middle finger.

original: de bzhin du rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin gyis ming med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin gyis ming med do //
translated: Similarly, by the nature of the wind element, there is the ring finger.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi rang bzhin gyis mthe'u chung ngo //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi rang bzhin gyis mthe'u chung ngo //
translated: By the nature of the space element, there is the little finger.

original: lag pa g-yon pa la ji lta ba de bzhin du g-yas pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa la ji lta ba de bzhin du g-yas pa la yang ngo //
translated: The right hand is like the left.

original: de bzhin du rkang pa dag la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rkang pa dag la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: The feet are to be understood in the same way.

original: lag pa gnyis dang rkang pa gnyis la bcu ni gsum gyis bsgyur ba ste sum cu'i tshigs kyi gzugs dang ldan pa mtha' dag ste de dag thams cad sen mo'i mthar thug yang dag gzung bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis dang rkang pa gnyis la bcu ni gsum gyis bsgyur ba ste sum cu'i tshigs kyi gzugs dang ldan pa mtha' dag ste de dag thams cad sen mo'i mthar thug yang dag gzung bya'o //
translated: The two hands and two feet have ten joints, each of which is threefold, thus there are thirty joints in all.

original: so rnams gsungs te 'dir gal te dang por byis pa la steng du so gnyis su gyur na de'i so g-yas pa sa'i rang bzhin te g-yon pa chu'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: so rnams gsungs te 'dir gal te dang por byis pa la steng du so gnyis su gyur na de'i so g-yas pa sa'i rang bzhin te g-yon pa chu'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The teeth are mentioned. If, in the beginning, the child has two teeth above, the right one is of the nature of earth, the left one of the nature of water.

original: de nas 'og tu gyur pa na de'i tshi g-yas pa me'i rang bzhin dang g-yon pa rlung gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas 'og tu gyur pa na de'i tshi g-yas pa me'i rang bzhin dang g-yon pa rlung gi rang bzhin no //
translated: Then, if two teeth appear below, the right one is of the nature of fire, the left one of the nature of wind.

original: de bzhin du slar yang steng du me dang rlung gi rang bzhin dag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du slar yang steng du me dang rlung gi rang bzhin dag go //
translated: Again, two teeth appear above, of the nature of fire and wind.

original: 'og tu sa dang chu'i rang bzhin dag go //
analyzed: 'og tu sa dang chu'i rang bzhin dag go //
translated: Two appear below, of the nature of earth and water.

original: slar yang 'og tu rlung dang me'i rang bzhin dag go //
analyzed: slar yang 'og tu rlung dang me'i rang bzhin dag go //
translated: Again, below, the natures of wind and fire.

original: slar yang steng du sa dang chu'i rang bzhin dag ste de ltar lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs las bzlog pas steng dang 'og tu khams bzhi'i rang bzhin gyis so sum cu rtsa gnyis po dag rig par bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang steng du sa dang chu'i rang bzhin dag ste de ltar lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs las bzlog pas steng dang 'og tu khams bzhi'i rang bzhin gyis so sum cu rtsa gnyis po dag rig par bya'o //
translated: Again, above, the natures of earth and water. Thus, in forward and reverse order, the thirty-two natures of the four elements should be known above and below.

original: gang gi tshe 'khyog po'i mche ba yin pa de'i tshe nam mkha'i khams so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'khyog po'i mche ba yin pa de'i tshe nam mkha'i khams so //
translated: When the teeth are crooked, then the space element.

original: de bzhin du spu dang skra rnams khams kyi dbye bas shes par bya ba dag ni gzhan gang spu yi mthar ni lus mchog la 'gyur de dang de ni de bzhin du yang khams lnga las rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du spu dang skra rnams khams kyi dbye bas shes par bya ba dag ni gzhan gang spu yi mthar ni lus mchog la 'gyur de dang de ni de bzhin du yang khams lnga las rig par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, the hairs of the body and the head should be understood as divisions of the elements. The supreme body is at the end of the hairs. That is also to be known as the five elements.

original: lus kyi dben pa bye ba phrag phyed dang bcas pa'i gsum gyi dbye ba ji snyed pa khams kyi rnam par 'gyur ba ste rdul dang khu ba'i dbang gis khams kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dben pa bye ba phrag phyed dang bcas pa'i gsum gyi dbye ba ji snyed pa khams kyi rnam par 'gyur ba ste rdul dang khu ba'i dbang gis khams kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The transformations of the elements, by the power of the semen and blood, are as many as the divisions of the three and a half times ten million pores of the body.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa ni @231a * //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa ni @231a * //
translated: The truth of origination is

original: lus kyi dben pas so zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: lus kyi dben pas so zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: by the isolation of the body, so the Lord has said.

original: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las lus dang ngag dang sems 'byung ba dang sdug bsngal dang lam dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa'i bden pa
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las lus dang ngag dang sems 'byung ba dang sdug bsngal dang lam dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa'i bden pa
translated: In the Stainless Light, a commentary on the root tantra, the Compendium of Reality Tantra, the king of all tantras, in twelve thousand chapters, the origin of body, speech, and mind, the truths of suffering, path, origination, and cessation,

original: nges pa'i mdor bsdus chen po ste dang po'o /
analyzed: nges pa'i mdor bsdus chen po ste dang po'o /
translated: is the first great summary.

original: // / da ni gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pas rten dang brten pa'i tshogs pa gsungs te 'dir lus la 'khor lo drug ni rten du gyur pa ste sku bzhi ni brten pa'o //
analyzed: // / da ni gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pas rten dang brten pa'i tshogs pa gsungs te 'dir lus la 'khor lo drug ni rten du gyur pa ste sku bzhi ni brten pa'o //
translated: Now, beginning with “secret,” the assembly of the support and the supported is taught. Here, the six cakras in the body are the support, and the four bodies are the supported.

original: de dag las lhan cig skyes pa'i sku ni padma gsum la rang bzhin dang rang bzhin med pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: de dag las lhan cig skyes pa'i sku ni padma gsum la rang bzhin dang rang bzhin med pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: Among them, the innate body is in the three lotuses, divided into nature and absence of nature.

original: de'i phyir gsang ba'i padma dang gtsug tor gyi padma dang lte ba'i padma la rnam par dag pa'i sku lhag pa'i lha ste rang bzhin med pa ma brtags pa dang rang bzhin pra phab pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsang ba'i padma dang gtsug tor gyi padma dang lte ba'i padma la rnam par dag pa'i sku lhag pa'i lha ste rang bzhin med pa ma brtags pa dang rang bzhin pra phab pa lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, the pure body, the superior deity, is in the secret lotus, the crown lotus, and the navel lotus. It is without intrinsic nature, like a reflection in a mirror or a crystal.

original: snying khar ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: snying khar ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The dharma body is in the heart.

original: mgrin pa'i chu skyes la yang sku'i dbye bas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku lhag pa'i lha'o //
analyzed: mgrin pa'i chu skyes la yang sku'i dbye bas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku lhag pa'i lha'o //
translated: The enjoyment body, the superior deity, is in the throat lotus, divided into bodies.

original: thig le la zhes pa spyi bo'i chu skyes dag pa'i 'khor lo la sprul pa'i sku lhag pa'i lha'o //
analyzed: thig le la zhes pa spyi bo'i chu skyes dag pa'i 'khor lo la sprul pa'i sku lhag pa'i lha'o //
translated: The emanation body, the superior deity, is in the bindu, in the crown lotus, the pure chakra.

original: sku'i dbye bas lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lor sprul pa'i sku lhag pa'i lha'o zhes pa ni sku'i dbye ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: sku'i dbye bas lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lor sprul pa'i sku lhag pa'i lha'o zhes pa ni sku'i dbye ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: The emanation body, the superior deity, is in the navel emanation chakra, divided into bodies. This is the section on the divisions of the bodies.

original: yon tan dbang gis zhes pa ni 'khor lo rnams kyi yon tan te lhan cig skyes pa'i sku'i rten gyi yon tan ye shes dang nam mkha' dang sa'o //
analyzed: yon tan dbang gis zhes pa ni 'khor lo rnams kyi yon tan te lhan cig skyes pa'i sku'i rten gyi yon tan ye shes dang nam mkha' dang sa'o //
translated: The qualities are the qualities of the chakras. The qualities of the support of the connate body are the space, the earth, and the wisdoms.

original: chos kyi sku'i rten gyi yon tan rlung ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i rten gyi yon tan rlung ngo //
translated: The qualities of the support of the dharmakāya are the vāyus.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rten gyi yon tan me'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rten gyi yon tan me'o //
translated: The qualities of the support of the Enjoyment Body are fire.

original: sprul pa'i sku'i rten gyi yon tan chu ste rten dang brten pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku'i rten gyi yon tan chu ste rten dang brten pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: The qualities of the support of the Emanation Body are water. Thus, there is the relationship of support and supported.

original: brjod pa'i rim pas snying kha'i 'khor lo mgrin pa'i 'khor lo spyi bo'i padma chos dang longs spyod rdzogs dang dag pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: brjod pa'i rim pas snying kha'i 'khor lo mgrin pa'i 'khor lo spyi bo'i padma chos dang longs spyod rdzogs dang dag pa'o zhes so //
translated: In the order of expression, the wheel at the heart, the wheel at the throat, and the lotus at the head are the pure states of Dharma, Enjoyment, and Emanation.

original: lte ba zhes pa la sogs pas lus kyi rten gyi dbye bas rigs drug gsungs te 'dir lus kyi 'khor lo drug la khams drug gi dbang gis rigs drug tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: lte ba zhes pa la sogs pas lus kyi rten gyi dbye bas rigs drug gsungs te 'dir lus kyi 'khor lo drug la khams drug gi dbang gis rigs drug tu 'gyur te /
translated: The navel and so forth indicate the six clans by the division of the support of the body. Here, the six clans are due to the power of the six elements in the six wheels of the body.

original: grangs bzhin du yum gyi rigs gsum ste gtso bo zhes pa yab kyi rigs kyang ngo //
analyzed: grangs bzhin du yum gyi rigs gsum ste gtso bo zhes pa yab kyi rigs kyang ngo //
translated: In order, there are the three clans of the mother, and the principal is also the clan of the father.

original: lte bar sa'i 'khor lo la 'khor lo'i rigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lte bar sa'i 'khor lo la 'khor lo'i rigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: At the navel, in the wheel of earth, there is the clan of the wheel.

original: mgrin par me'i padma la rin chen gyi rigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mgrin par me'i padma la rin chen gyi rigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: At the throat, in the lotus of fire, there is the clan of the jewel.

original: gsang bar ye shes kyi padma la gri gug gi rigs su 'gyur te grangs bzhin du yum gyi sku dang gsung dang @231b thugs so //
analyzed: gsang bar ye shes kyi padma la gri gug gi rigs su 'gyur te grangs bzhin du yum gyi sku dang gsung dang @231b thugs so //
translated: In the secret, on the lotus of intuition, there is the family of the flaying knife, which is the body, speech, and mind of the mother, respectively.

original: de bzhin du spyi bor chu'i padma la padma'i rigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du spyi bor chu'i padma la padma'i rigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, on the water lotus of the crown, there is the family of the lotus.

original: snying khar rlung gi padma la ral gri'i rigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying khar rlung gi padma la ral gri'i rigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: On the wind lotus of the heart, there is the family of the sword.

original: de bzhin du gtsug tor dbus su nam mkha'i khams kyi padma la rdo rje'i rigs su 'gyur te gtso bo'i sku dang gsung dang thugs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gtsug tor dbus su nam mkha'i khams kyi padma la rdo rje'i rigs su 'gyur te gtso bo'i sku dang gsung dang thugs so //
translated: Similarly, in the center of the top of the head, on the space element lotus, there is the family of the vajra, which is the body, speech, and mind of the principal deity.

original: rim pa bzhin rdul dang khu ba dag gi rigs su 'gyur te sa la sogs pa'i khams las skyes pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba rnams kyi go rims ji lta bas so //
analyzed: rim pa bzhin rdul dang khu ba dag gi rigs su 'gyur te sa la sogs pa'i khams las skyes pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba rnams kyi go rims ji lta bas so //
translated: In order, there are the families of semen and ovum, which arise from the elements of earth and so forth, in accordance with their order.

original: de dag ces pa la sogs pas de dag nyid rlung dang rtsa ba'i dbye bas gsungs te 'dir srog dang thur sel gyi rtsa gsum gyi dbye bas rtsa gsum gyi ming gi mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ces pa la sogs pas de dag nyid rlung dang rtsa ba'i dbye bas gsungs te 'dir srog dang thur sel gyi rtsa gsum gyi dbye bas rtsa gsum gyi ming gi mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The and so forth indicates that they are also classified by the channels and winds. Here, the three channels are named according to the classification of the life-force and evacuative winds.

original: thur sel gyi bshang  ba'i rtsa ni 'khor lo'i rigs so //
analyzed: thur sel gyi bshang  ba'i rtsa ni 'khor lo'i rigs so //
translated: The downward-voiding feces channel is the family of Cakrin.

original: srog gi nyi ma'i rtsa ni rin chen gyi rigs so //
analyzed: srog gi nyi ma'i rtsa ni rin chen gyi rigs so //
translated: The life-force sun channel is the family of Ratnin.🔽The downward-voiding semen channel is the family of Khadgin.

original: thur sel gyi khu ba'i rtsa ni gri gug gi rigs so zhes pa ni yum gyi rigs gsum ste sku dang gsung dang thugs so //
analyzed: thur sel gyi khu ba'i rtsa ni gri gug gi rigs so zhes pa ni yum gyi rigs gsum ste sku dang gsung dang thugs so //
translated: These are the three families of the mother, which are body, speech, and mind.

original: de bzhin du srog gi zla ba'i rtsa ni padma'i rigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du srog gi zla ba'i rtsa ni padma'i rigs so //
translated: Similarly, the life-force moon channel is the family of Padmin.

original: thur sel gyi gci ba'i rtsa ni ral gri'i rigs so //
analyzed: thur sel gyi gci ba'i rtsa ni ral gri'i rigs so //
translated: The downward-voiding urine channel is the family of Khadgin.🔽The life-force central channel Rāhu channel is the family of Vajrin.🔽These are the six families of the principal body, speech, and mind.🔽The body and so on are the body, the mind is the mind, and the elements are the speech.🔽The body and so on are the body, the mind is the mind, and the elements are the speech.

original: srog gi dbu ma'i sgra gcan gyi rtsa ni rdo rje'i rigs te gtso bo'i sku dang gsung dang thugs so zhes pa ni rigs drug gi nges pa'o //
analyzed: srog gi dbu ma'i sgra gcan gyi rtsa ni rdo rje'i rigs te gtso bo'i sku dang gsung dang thugs so zhes pa ni rigs drug gi nges pa'o //
translated: The body and so on are the body, the mind is the mind, and the elements are the speech.🔽The body and so on are the body, the mind is the mind, and the elements are the speech.🔽The body and so on are the body, the mind is the mind, and the elements are the speech.🔽The body and so on are the body, the mind is the mind, and the elements are the speech.🔽The body and so on are the body, the mind is the mind, and the elements are the speech.🔽The body and so on are the body, the mind is the mind, and the elements are the speech.🔽The body and so on are the body, the mind is the mind, and the elements are the speech.🔽The body and so on are the body, the mind is the mind, and the elements are the speech.🔽The body and so on are the body, the mind is the mind, and the elements are the speech.🔽The body and so on are the body, the mind is the mind, and the elements are the speech.🔽The body and so on are the body, the mind is the mind, and the elements are the speech.🔽The body and so on are the body, the mind is the mind, and the elements are the speech.🔽The body and so on are the body, the mind is the mind, and the elements are the speech.

original: lus zhes pa la sogs pas lus dang bsam pa rab tu 'jug pa dang khams kyi kha dog gsungs te 'dir lus la khams rnams phan tshun du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dbye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus zhes pa la sogs pas lus dang bsam pa rab tu 'jug pa dang khams kyi kha dog gsungs te 'dir lus la khams rnams phan tshun du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dbye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The body and so on are the body, the mind is the mind, and the elements are the speech.🔽The body and so on are the body, the mind is the mind

original: de la tshogs pa'i dbang gis 'dzin pa'i khams gang yin pa de ni lus kyi ming du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la tshogs pa'i dbang gis 'dzin pa'i khams gang yin pa de ni lus kyi ming du 'gyur ro //
translated: The element that is grasped by the power of the assembly becomes the name of the body.

original: tshogs pa'i dbang gis gzung pa gang yin pa de ni bsam pa'i ming du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i dbang gis gzung pa gang yin pa de ni bsam pa'i ming du 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is grasped by the power of the assembly becomes the name of the mind.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag gcig pa nyid ni phan tshun ro mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag gcig pa nyid ni phan tshun ro mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The sameness of the grasped and grasper is the sameness of taste.

original: de'i phyir lus la bsam pa rab tu zhugs pa nam mkha' bzhin du ro mnyam bsam pa'i dbus su lus ngag kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus la bsam pa rab tu zhugs pa nam mkha' bzhin du ro mnyam bsam pa'i dbus su lus ngag kyang /
translated: Therefore, the body is immersed in the mind, and like space, the body and speech are of the same taste in the middle of the mind.

original: rnal 'byor ldan pas shes bya rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis khams kyi kha dog la sogs dbye bas te zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ldan pas shes bya rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis khams kyi kha dog la sogs dbye bas te zhes pa'o //
translated: The possessor of yoga should know that by the power of the qualities of the nature of the objects of knowledge, the colors of the elements are differentiated.

original: 'dir lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa rnams dang dri la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyi rang bzhin ni sa la sogs pa khams rnams te kha dog bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa rnams dang dri la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyi rang bzhin ni sa la sogs pa khams rnams te kha dog bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the nature of the body faculty and so on and the objects of smell and so on are the elements of earth and so on, which become four colors.

original: 'dir lus kyi dbye bas lus kyi dbang po dang yul dri dang bshang lam gyi dbang po dang / brjod pa rnams sa'i lus kyi rang bzhin gyis kha dog ser po dang bsam @232a * //
analyzed: 'dir lus kyi dbye bas lus kyi dbang po dang yul dri dang bshang lam gyi dbang po dang / brjod pa rnams sa'i lus kyi rang bzhin gyis kha dog ser po dang bsam @232a * //
translated: Here, the body faculty and the object of smell, which are divisions of the body, are the earth element, and their color is yellow by nature of the body.

original: pa'i dbang gis rlung gi rang bzhin las kha dog nag po'o //
analyzed: pa'i dbang gis rlung gi rang bzhin las kha dog nag po'o //
translated: By the power of thought, they are the wind element, and their color is black.

original: de bzhin du sna'i dbang po dang reg dang ngag gi dbang po dang bshang ba 'dzag pa rnams lus kyi dbye bas rlung gi rang bzhin kha dog nag po dang sa'i bsam pa'i dbye bas ser po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sna'i dbang po dang reg dang ngag gi dbang po dang bshang ba 'dzag pa rnams lus kyi dbye bas rlung gi rang bzhin kha dog nag po dang sa'i bsam pa'i dbye bas ser po'o //
translated: Similarly, the nose faculty, touch, the speech faculty, and the emission of excrement, which are divisions of the body, are the wind element, and their color is black. By the power of the earth element in thought, they are yellow.

original: mig gi dbang po dang ro dang lag pa'i dbang po dang 'gro ba rnams lus kyi dbang gis me'i rang bzhin kha dog dmar por 'gyur zhing bsam pa'i dbang gis chu'i rang bzhin dkar por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po dang ro dang lag pa'i dbang po dang 'gro ba rnams lus kyi dbang gis me'i rang bzhin kha dog dmar por 'gyur zhing bsam pa'i dbang gis chu'i rang bzhin dkar por 'gyur ro //
translated: The eye faculty, taste, the hand faculty, and movement are the fire element by the power of the body, and their color is red. By the power of thought, they are the water element, and their color is white.

original: de bzhin du lce'i dbang po dang kha dog gi gzugs dang rkang pa'i dbang po dang len pa rnams lus kyi dbye bas chu'i rang bzhin kha dog dkar por 'gyur zhing bsam pa'i dbang gis me'i rang bzhin kha dog dmar por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du lce'i dbang po dang kha dog gi gzugs dang rkang pa'i dbang po dang len pa rnams lus kyi dbye bas chu'i rang bzhin kha dog dkar por 'gyur zhing bsam pa'i dbang gis me'i rang bzhin kha dog dmar por 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, the tongue faculty and the form of color, the foot faculty and the grasping, by the division of the body, become the nature of water, the color white, and by the power of thought, the nature of fire, the color red.

original: sa rlung me dang chu la'o zhes pa ste sa'i rang bzhin dang rlung gi rang bzhin dang me'i rang bzhin dang chu'i rang bzhin la kha dog rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sa rlung me dang chu la'o zhes pa ste sa'i rang bzhin dang rlung gi rang bzhin dang me'i rang bzhin dang chu'i rang bzhin la kha dog rig par bya'o //
translated: Earth, wind, fire, and water. The color should be known as the nature of earth, the nature of wind, the nature of fire, and the nature of water.

original: de bzhin du rna ba'i dbang po dang yul chos kyi dbyings dang bha ga'i dbang po dang khru ba 'pho ba ste 'di dag ni lus kyi dbye bas nam mkha'i rang bzhin kha dog ljang khu dang bsam pa'i dbye bas ye shes kyi rang bzhin sngon po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba'i dbang po dang yul chos kyi dbyings dang bha ga'i dbang po dang khru ba 'pho ba ste 'di dag ni lus kyi dbye bas nam mkha'i rang bzhin kha dog ljang khu dang bsam pa'i dbye bas ye shes kyi rang bzhin sngon po'o //
translated: Likewise, the ear faculty and the object, the realm of reality, the bhaga faculty and the movement of the penis, by the division of the body, become the nature of space, the color green, and by the division of thought, the nature of gnosis, the color blue.

original: de bzhin du yid kyi dbang po dang sgra dang mchog gi dbang po dang gci ba 'dzag pa ste 'di dag ni lus kyi dbye bas ye shes kyi khams kyi rang bzhin kha dog sngon po dang bsam pa'i dbye bas nam mkha'i rang bzhin ljang khu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi dbang po dang sgra dang mchog gi dbang po dang gci ba 'dzag pa ste 'di dag ni lus kyi dbye bas ye shes kyi khams kyi rang bzhin kha dog sngon po dang bsam pa'i dbye bas nam mkha'i rang bzhin ljang khu'o //
translated: Likewise, the mental faculty, sound, the supreme faculty, and the emission of urine are the nature of the element of gnosis, which is blue, and the element of space, which is green, by the division of intention.

original: de'i phyir ye shes nam mkha' la yang sngon po ljang khur 'gyur te lus dang bsam pa'i rab tu dbye bas so zhes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ye shes nam mkha' la yang sngon po ljang khur 'gyur te lus dang bsam pa'i rab tu dbye bas so zhes so //
translated: Therefore, gnosis and space are also blue and green, by the division of body and intention.

original: lus dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin nges pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin nges pa'o //
translated: This is the ascertainment of the nature of body and intention.

original: rus pa dang sha la sogs pa'i khams rnams shes rab dang thabs kyis 'khyud pa gsungs pa shes rab ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir lus la rus pa'i khams ni shes rab ste sha'i khams ni thabs so //
analyzed: rus pa dang sha la sogs pa'i khams rnams shes rab dang thabs kyis 'khyud pa gsungs pa shes rab ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir lus la rus pa'i khams ni shes rab ste sha'i khams ni thabs so //
translated: The embracing of the elements of bone, flesh, and so on by wisdom and method is stated in “wisdom” and so on. Here, the element of bone in the body is wisdom, and the element of flesh is method.

original: sa dang 'du byed de dag ni phan tshun yang dag par ldan pa ste sra ba nyid gang yin pa de ni sa'i khams so zhes pa'i shes par byed pa las rus pa dang sha ni shes rab dang thabs so //
analyzed: sa dang 'du byed de dag ni phan tshun yang dag par ldan pa ste sra ba nyid gang yin pa de ni sa'i khams so zhes pa'i shes par byed pa las rus pa dang sha ni shes rab dang thabs so //
translated: Those elements and formative factors are mutually combined. Whatever is solidity is the earth element.

original: de bzhin du shes rab dang thabs ni chu dang bcas pa'i khrag ste chu'i khams dang lhan cig tu tshor ba'i phung po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab dang thabs ni chu dang bcas pa'i khrag ste chu'i khams dang lhan cig tu tshor ba'i phung po'o //
translated: Thus, wisdom and method are blood together with water, which is the aggregate of feeling together with the water element.

original: de bzhin du me dag dang zhes pa tsha ba nyid dang gci ba zhes pa ni 'du shes te 'di dag ni shes rab dang thabs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du me dag dang zhes pa tsha ba nyid dang gci ba zhes pa ni 'du shes te 'di dag ni shes rab dang thabs so //
translated: Similarly, the fires and urine are heat and urine, which are perception. These are wisdom and method.

original: khu ba'i khams 'du shes kyi phung po ma yin nam ji ltar @232b gci ba zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: khu ba'i khams 'du shes kyi phung po ma yin nam ji ltar @232b gci ba zhes brjod ce na /
translated: Isn’t the element of semen the aggregate of perception? How is it called urine?

original: 'dir lus la 'du shes gang yin pa de ni byis pa skyes pa tsam gyis te gci ba 'dzag pa las so //
analyzed: 'dir lus la 'du shes gang yin pa de ni byis pa skyes pa tsam gyis te gci ba 'dzag pa las so //
translated: Here, whatever perception there is in the body is due to the mere birth of a child, from the emission of urine.

original: bde ba chen po'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni lo bcu drug gi mtshams su 'gyur te sa bon 'pho ba'i chos las so //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni lo bcu drug gi mtshams su 'gyur te sa bon 'pho ba'i chos las so //
translated: That which is the pristine consciousness of great bliss is at the age of sixteen, due to the nature of the transference of the seed.

original: de'i phyir gci ba ni 'du shes kyi chos dang khu ba ni ye shes kyi chos so zhes pa'i khyad par las gci ba ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gci ba ni 'du shes kyi chos dang khu ba ni ye shes kyi chos so zhes pa'i khyad par las gci ba ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
translated: Therefore, since there is a distinction between feces, which is the phenomenon of discrimination, and semen, which is the phenomenon of pristine consciousness, feces is the aggregate of discrimination.

original: de bzhin du rlung dang bshang ba shes rab dang thabs te rlung gi khams dang gzugs kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung dang bshang ba shes rab dang thabs te rlung gi khams dang gzugs kyi phung po'o //
translated: Similarly, wind and feces are wisdom and method; the wind element and the form aggregate.

original: stong pa zhes pa rdul gyi khams dang khu ba zhes pa rnam par shes pa'i khams ni shes rab dang thabs te mchog gi lus la dpal ldan rdul dang byang chub kyi sems nyid dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa zhes pa rdul gyi khams dang khu ba zhes pa rnam par shes pa'i khams ni shes rab dang thabs te mchog gi lus la dpal ldan rdul dang byang chub kyi sems nyid dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Emptiness is the element of particles, and semen is the element of consciousness, which is wisdom and method. In the supreme body, the glorious particle and bodhicitta itself are pure.

original: de bzhin du rna ba sgra sogs gzhan rnams zhes pa ni sgra ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba sgra sogs gzhan rnams zhes pa ni sgra ni shes rab bo //
translated: Similarly, the others, such as the ear and sound, are as follows: Sound is wisdom.

original: rna ba ni thabs so //
analyzed: rna ba ni thabs so //
translated: The ear is method.

original: dri ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: dri ni shes rab bo //
translated: Smell is wisdom.

original: sna ni thabs so //
analyzed: sna ni thabs so //
translated: The nose is method.

original: gzugs ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: gzugs ni shes rab bo //
translated: Form is wisdom.

original: mig ni thabs so //
analyzed: mig ni thabs so //
translated: The eyes are method.

original: ro ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: ro ni shes rab bo //
translated: Taste is wisdom.

original: lce ni thabs so //
analyzed: lce ni thabs so //
translated: The tongue is method.

original: reg bya ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: reg bya ni shes rab bo //
translated: Touch is wisdom.

original: lus ni thabs so //
analyzed: lus ni thabs so //
translated: The body is method.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni shes rab bo //
translated: The realm of phenomena is wisdom.

original: yid ni thabs so //
analyzed: yid ni thabs so //
translated: The mind is method.

original: bshang ba 'dzag pa ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: bshang ba 'dzag pa ni shes rab bo //
translated: The emission of feces is wisdom.

original: bshang lam ni thabs so //
analyzed: bshang lam ni thabs so //
translated: The anus is method.

original: 'gro ba ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni shes rab bo //
translated: Going is wisdom.

original: rkang pa ni thabs so //
analyzed: rkang pa ni thabs so //
translated: The legs are method.

original: len pa ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: len pa ni shes rab bo //
translated: Taking is wisdom.

original: lag pa ni thabs so //
analyzed: lag pa ni thabs so //
translated: The hands are method.

original: brjod pa ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: brjod pa ni shes rab bo //
translated: Speech is wisdom.

original: ngag gi dbang po ni thabs so //
analyzed: ngag gi dbang po ni thabs so //
translated: The sense organ of speech is method.

original: gci ba'i bya ba ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: gci ba'i bya ba ni shes rab bo //
translated: The action of urinating is wisdom.

original: bha ga'am rtags ni thabs so //
analyzed: bha ga'am rtags ni thabs so //
translated: The bhaga or sex organ is method.

original: khu ba 'dzag pa ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: khu ba 'dzag pa ni shes rab bo //
translated: The emission of semen is wisdom.

original: dung can ma'i dbang po ni thabs so //
analyzed: dung can ma'i dbang po ni thabs so //
translated: The sense organ of the conch-shell channel is method.

original: rang gi rgyal ba'i rigs kyi dbang gis ngag gi rang bzhin la sogs kyang zhes pa ni las kyi dbang po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rgyal ba'i rigs kyi dbang gis ngag gi rang bzhin la sogs kyang zhes pa ni las kyi dbang po la sogs pa'o //
translated: By the power of one’s own family of victors, the nature of speech and so on, which are the sense organs of action and so on, are method.

original: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas lha mo sa la sogs pa rnams sangs rgyas dang bcas te rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa'i yul dang yul can rnams ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dkyil 'khor dag la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas lha mo sa la sogs pa rnams sangs rgyas dang bcas te rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa'i yul dang yul can rnams ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dkyil 'khor dag la brjod par bya'o //
translated: In this way, the goddesses Earth and so forth, together with the Buddhas, together with Vairochana and so forth, the objects and subjects, should be described in the maṇḍala that will be explained.

original: phan tshun shes rab dang thabs kyis 'khyud pa'i cho ga'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun shes rab dang thabs kyis 'khyud pa'i cho ga'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definition of the procedure of mutual embrace by means of wisdom and means.

original: da ni rtsa rnams zhes pa la sogs pas zla ba dang nyi ma khu ba dang rdul gyi bya ba gsungs te 'dir lus la mngal gyi zla ba gcig gi rjes la nyin zhag so sor rtsa brgya phrag gnyis su 'gyur te zla ba'i nang du nyin zhag
analyzed: da ni rtsa rnams zhes pa la sogs pas zla ba dang nyi ma khu ba dang rdul gyi bya ba gsungs te 'dir lus la mngal gyi zla ba gcig gi rjes la nyin zhag so sor rtsa brgya phrag gnyis su 'gyur te zla ba'i nang du nyin zhag
translated: Now, beginning with “the channels,” he explains the function of the moon and sun, semen and blood. Here, in the body, after one month in the womb, there are two hundred channels each day.

original: sum cus stong phrag drug gi grangs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sum cus stong phrag drug gi grangs su 'gyur ro //
translated: In the month, there are thirty days, so there are six thousand.

original: zla ba bcu gnyis kyi mtshams su @233a * //
analyzed: zla ba bcu gnyis kyi mtshams su @233a * //
translated: At the end of twelve months,

original: nyin zhag sum brgya drug cu rnams kyis stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyin zhag sum brgya drug cu rnams kyis stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs su 'gyur te /
translated: there are three hundred and sixty days, so there are seventy-two thousand.

original: rtsa rnams stong phrag drug ni nyin mor byed pas bsgyur ba ste bcu gnyis kyis bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa rnams stong phrag drug ni nyin mor byed pas bsgyur ba ste bcu gnyis kyis bsgyur ba'o //
translated: The channels are transformed by the sun, that is, multiplied by twelve.

original: mngal gyi dbus dag tu yang 'phel ba ni /
analyzed: mngal gyi dbus dag tu yang 'phel ba ni /
translated: Also, there is increase in the middle of the womb.

original: byas nas yang yig gis phyi rol du yang ste zla ba bcu gnyis kyi mtha'i bar du'o //
analyzed: byas nas yang yig gis phyi rol du yang ste zla ba bcu gnyis kyi mtha'i bar du'o //
translated: The suffix ya indicates that there is increase externally until the end of the twelve months.

original: mngal bzung ba'i zla ba gcig por nas lo rdzogs par gyur pa na 'phel ba gtong ste /🔽ri bong 'dzin pa ni yang yig gis zla ba bcu gsum na ste nyi ma dag kyang 'phel bar byed do zhes pa ni de nas zla ba dang khu ba'i rtsa'i khams kyi grangs yongs su chad par gyur pa na lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du rdul gyi
analyzed: mngal bzung ba'i zla ba gcig por nas lo rdzogs par gyur pa na 'phel ba gtong ste / ri bong 'dzin pa ni yang yig gis zla ba bcu gsum na ste nyi ma dag kyang 'phel bar byed do zhes pa ni de nas zla ba dang khu ba'i rtsa'i khams kyi grangs yongs su chad par gyur pa na lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du rdul gyi
translated: After the first month of conception, when the year is complete, increase is relinquished.🔽The rabbit holder is the thirteenth month, and the sun also increases.

original: khams 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: khams 'phel bar byed do //
translated: Then, when the number of the elements of the menstrual and semen channels is complete, for twelve years the element of blood increases.

original: kyang yig gis khu ba'i khams kyang 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: kyang yig gis khu ba'i khams kyang 'phel bar byed do //
translated: The suffix ya indicates that the element of semen also increases.

original: lo ni bcu gnyis dag na nyin phyed khams ni 'phel ba gtong ste rang gi lus po dag la'o zhes pa bud med rnams kyi rdul 'byung ba'i bar du nyi ma 'phel ba ste kyang yig gis bsdus pa las skyes pa rnams kyi lo bcu drug gi mtshams🔽su khu ba 'byung ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: lo ni bcu gnyis dag na nyin phyed khams ni 'phel ba gtong ste rang gi lus po dag la'o zhes pa bud med rnams kyi rdul 'byung ba'i bar du nyi ma 'phel ba ste kyang yig gis bsdus pa las skyes pa rnams kyi lo bcu drug gi mtshams su khu ba 'byung ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The word “also” includes the increase of the male element up to the age of sixteen.🔽Similarly, the channels that have been severed are also generated.🔽From that, the number of pairs increases by one every day.

original: de bzhin du rtsa ni 'chad pa dag kyang rab tu skyes par gyur pa nas nyin zhag so sor rim pas zung gi grangs su 'gyur zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba las rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsa ni 'chad pa dag kyang rab tu skyes par gyur pa nas nyin zhag so sor rim pas zung gi grangs su 'gyur zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba las rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained extensively in the future.

original: rtsa dang khams 'phel ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa dang khams 'phel ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the certainty of the increase of the channels and elements.🔽Now, the nature of space and so on is explained by “the glorious five elements” and so on.

original: da ni dpal ldan 'byung ba zhes pa la sogs pas nam mkha' la sogs pa'i de nyid rnams gsungs te 'dir byis pa'i lus la dpal ldan 'byung ba lnga dang dbang po lnga ni nam mkha' la sogs pa dang rna ba la sogs pa ste gcig tu bcur
analyzed: da ni dpal ldan 'byung ba zhes pa la sogs pas nam mkha' la sogs pa'i de nyid rnams gsungs te 'dir byis pa'i lus la dpal ldan 'byung ba lnga dang dbang po lnga ni nam mkha' la sogs pa dang rna ba la sogs pa ste gcig tu bcur
translated: Here, the glorious five elements and five sense organs in the body of a child are space and so on and the ears and so on, which are one in ten.

original: 'gyur ro // de bzhin du las kyi dbang po lnga po rnams dang de tsam zhes pa ni sgra de tsam la sogs pa ste de tsam lnga ru brjod pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de bzhin du las kyi dbang po lnga po rnams dang de tsam zhes pa ni sgra de tsam la sogs pa ste de tsam lnga ru brjod pa rnams so //
translated: Likewise, the five faculties of action and the five objects such as sound are called the five objects.

original: yon tan bcas pa dag kyang yid dang zhes pa ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa dang bcas pa'i yid de /
analyzed: yon tan bcas pa dag kyang yid dang zhes pa ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa dang bcas pa'i yid de /
translated: And the mind along with the qualities means the mind along with sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: de bzhin du blo dang dar 'dzin dang mchog gi rang bzhin yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du blo dang dar 'dzin dang mchog gi rang bzhin yang ngo //
translated: Likewise, the intellect, the apprehender of the object, and the supreme nature.

original: 'di dag ni de nyid rnams te nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni de nyid rnams te nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: These are the twenty-four principles.

original: lus dang phyi rol srid pa gsum gyi gnas su 'di ni longs spyod de gtso bo dag gi'o //
analyzed: lus dang phyi rol srid pa gsum gyi gnas su 'di ni longs spyod de gtso bo dag gi'o //
translated: The enjoyments of the lords are in the three abodes of the body, external existence, and the three worlds.

original: ji ltar gyur pa'i zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gyur pa'i zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: phung po lnga yi bdag nyid dang 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyis rnam gsum srid pa la gnas bdag gi las ni bsags pa dag gi @233b longs spyod du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po lnga yi bdag nyid dang 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyis rnam gsum srid pa la gnas bdag gi las ni bsags pa dag gi @233b longs spyod du 'gyur ro //
translated: The enjoyments of the accumulated actions of those abiding in the three worlds, the nature of the five aggregates, and the relative reality of the world.

original: rang bzhin nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid ni 'dzin par byed pa'i chos can skyes bu'i gzung bar bya ba'i chos can gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid ni 'dzin par byed pa'i chos can skyes bu'i gzung bar bya ba'i chos can gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the twenty-four is the nature of the subject that apprehends, the subject that is grasped by the person.

original: rang gi ngo bo can yang gzung bya'i chos dang bral ba'i rang bzhin gzhan te rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar yod pa'o zhes pa ni rang bzhin dang skyes bu'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo can yang gzung bya'i chos dang bral ba'i rang bzhin gzhan te rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar yod pa'o zhes pa ni rang bzhin dang skyes bu'i nges pa'o //
translated: The nature that is free from the grasped object is another nature, which is the existence of natural luminosity. This is the definition of nature and person.

original: da ni sa zhes pa la sogs pas lus las la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid gsungs te 'dir lus las ni sra ba'o //
analyzed: da ni sa zhes pa la sogs pas lus las la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid gsungs te 'dir lus las ni sra ba'o //
translated: Now, beginning with “earth,” he states the characteristics of the body, etc. Here, the body is solidity.

original: chu ni gsher ba'o //
analyzed: chu ni gsher ba'o //
translated: Water is fluidity.

original: me yang tsha ba nyid do //
analyzed: me yang tsha ba nyid do //
translated: Fire is heat.

original: gang gi phyir bskum pa rkyong bar byed pa'i rlung ni yang ba nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bskum pa rkyong bar byed pa'i rlung ni yang ba nyid do //
translated: The wind that causes contraction and expansion is lightness.

original: bug pa ni stong pa'o ;
analyzed: bug pa ni stong pa'o ;
translated: The cavities are emptiness.

original: / brtan pa'i rus pa ste rgyab kyi tshigs pa'i rus pa dpyi nas brtsams nas phrag pa'i mthar thug pa ni 'chi med ri bo mchog ces pa lhun po'o //
analyzed: / brtan pa'i rus pa ste rgyab kyi tshigs pa'i rus pa dpyi nas brtsams nas phrag pa'i mthar thug pa ni 'chi med ri bo mchog ces pa lhun po'o //
translated: The firm bones, the vertebrae from the hips to the shoulders, are the supreme mountain of immortality, which is Mount Meru.

original: phyi rol tu char pa gang yin pa de lus la 'dir ni bdud rtsi ste lce dang lce chung dag las st'u ka 'dzag pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol tu char pa gang yin pa de lus la 'dir ni bdud rtsi ste lce dang lce chung dag las st'u ka 'dzag pa'o //
translated: What is rain externally is nectar here in the body, the dripping of saliva from the tongue and uvula.

original: rdo rje ni snying la sgra ste rgyu ma rnams 'khrol ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni snying la sgra ste rgyu ma rnams 'khrol ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: What is a vajra externally is sound here in the body, the sound of the intestines.

original: gzhu ste 'ja' tshon ni bshang ba dag go //
analyzed: gzhu ste 'ja' tshon ni bshang ba dag go //
translated: What is a rainbow externally is feces here in the body.

original: phyi rol du chu srang drug cu'i bdag nyid kyi chu tshod gang yin pa de ni lus la dbugs dang dbugs 'byung zung dag go zhes pa ste srog gi rlung 'byung ba dang 'jug pa zung ni chu tshod do //
analyzed: phyi rol du chu srang drug cu'i bdag nyid kyi chu tshod gang yin pa de ni lus la dbugs dang dbugs 'byung zung dag go zhes pa ste srog gi rlung 'byung ba dang 'jug pa zung ni chu tshod do //
translated: What is a water clock externally, with a capacity of sixty kṣaṇas, is a breath and out-breath here in the body.

original: zung 'di rnams dgu brgya nyis 'gyur zhes pa brgya phrag bco brgyad rnams kyis 'pho ba gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zung 'di rnams dgu brgya nyis 'gyur zhes pa brgya phrag bco brgyad rnams kyis 'pho ba gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: These pairs of breaths, multiplied by nine hundred, are eighteen hundred, which is one period.

original: phyi rol du 'pho ba ni nyin zhag sum cu'i zla bas te nang du ni dkyil 'khor lnga 'bab pa'i rtsa lnga rnams so //
analyzed: phyi rol du 'pho ba ni nyin zhag sum cu'i zla bas te nang du ni dkyil 'khor lnga 'bab pa'i rtsa lnga rnams so //
translated: Externally, a period is thirty days, a month; internally, it is the five channels of the five maṇḍalas.

original: skar rtsis pa ni nyi ma la sogs pa'i gza' rnams so //
analyzed: skar rtsis pa ni nyi ma la sogs pa'i gza' rnams so //
translated: The astrologers are the planets such as the sun.

original: de dag bug pa'i dbye ba bcur 'gyur te 'dir bshang lam gyi bug pa ni zla ba'o //
analyzed: de dag bug pa'i dbye ba bcur 'gyur te 'dir bshang lam gyi bug pa ni zla ba'o //
translated: They are divided into ten orifices. Here, the orifice of the anus is the moon.

original: gci ba'i bug pa ni nyi ma'o //
analyzed: gci ba'i bug pa ni nyi ma'o //
translated: The orifice of the urethra is the sun.

original: khu ba'i bug pa ni dus kyi me'o //
analyzed: khu ba'i bug pa ni dus kyi me'o //
translated: The orifice of the semen is the fire of time.

original: kha'i bug pa ni sgra gcan no //
analyzed: kha'i bug pa ni sgra gcan no //
translated: The orifice of the mouth is Rāhu.

original: mig g-yas pa'i bug pa ni bkra shis so //🔽mig g-yon pa'i bug pa ni gza' lag go //
analyzed: mig g-yas pa'i bug pa ni bkra shis so // mig g-yon pa'i bug pa ni gza' lag go //
translated: The orifice of the right eye is Bṛhaspati.🔽The orifice of the left eye is Aṅgāraka.

original: sna g-yas pa'i bug pa ni phur bu'o //🔽sna g-yon pa'i bug pa ni bsangs so //
analyzed: sna g-yas pa'i bug pa ni phur bu'o // sna g-yon pa'i bug pa ni bsangs so //
translated: The orifice of the right nostril is Śukra.🔽The orifice of the left nostril is Śanaiścara.

original: rna ba g-yas pa'i bug pa ni spen pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba g-yas pa'i bug pa ni spen pa'o //
translated: The orifice of the right ear is Śravaṇa.

original: rna ba g-yon pa'i bug pa ni mjug rings so //
analyzed: rna ba g-yon pa'i bug pa ni mjug rings so //
translated: The orifice of the left ear is Ketu.

original: slar yang bkra shis la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi dbang po drug gi dbye ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i le'u lnga pa las brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang bkra shis la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi dbang po drug gi dbye ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i le'u lnga pa las brjod par bya'o //
translated: Again, the division of these Bṛhaspati and so forth into the six sense faculties will be explained in the fifth chapter.

original: sa la sogs pa'i nges pa'o //🔽da ni rgyu skar zhes @234a * //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i nges pa'o // da ni rgyu skar zhes @234a * //
translated: The Determination of Earth and so forth.

original: pa la sogs pas rgyu skar la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: pa la sogs pas rgyu skar la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning from “the lunar mansions” and so forth, the lunar mansions and so forth are mentioned.

original: thur ma bdun pa'i 'khor lo'i dbye bas byi bzhin dang bcas pa'i rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa brgyad do //
analyzed: thur ma bdun pa'i 'khor lo'i dbye bas byi bzhin dang bcas pa'i rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa brgyad do //
translated: The twenty-eight lunar mansions are the seven-turnabout wheel, together with the rat.

original: thur ma'i rgyu skar rnams kyi zur bzhir dbyug gu'i rgyu skar bzhi ste de ltar na sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: thur ma'i rgyu skar rnams kyi zur bzhir dbyug gu'i rgyu skar bzhi ste de ltar na sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: The four-stick lunar mansions are the four corners of the turnabout lunar mansions. Thus, there are thirty-two.

original: rim pa dang rim pa ma yin par rgyu ba'i dbye bas rgyu skar bcu bzhi ni so rnams kyi steng gi 'khor lo la ste /
analyzed: rim pa dang rim pa ma yin par rgyu ba'i dbye bas rgyu skar bcu bzhi ni so rnams kyi steng gi 'khor lo la ste /
translated: The fourteen lunar mansions that move in order and out of order are on the upper wheel of the teeth.

original: bcu bzhi ni 'og gi 'khor lo la gnas so //
analyzed: bcu bzhi ni 'og gi 'khor lo la gnas so //
translated: Fourteen are on the lower wheel.

original: 'khor lo phyed kyi dbye bas so rnams kyi dbye ba steng dang 'og tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'khor lo phyed kyi dbye bas so rnams kyi dbye ba steng dang 'og tu 'gyur te /
translated: The division of the teeth is by the half-wheel, above and below.

original: rgyu skar dag ni so yi phreng ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu skar dag ni so yi phreng ba'o //
translated: The lunar mansions are the garland of teeth.

original: rjes su nyin zhag chu tshod rnams ni tshigs kyi dbye bar 'gyur zhes pa ni nyin zhag so sor chu tshod drug cu'i lo'i rjes su nyin zhag gi dbugs kyi grangs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su nyin zhag chu tshod rnams ni tshigs kyi dbye bar 'gyur zhes pa ni nyin zhag so sor chu tshod drug cu'i lo'i rjes su nyin zhag gi dbugs kyi grangs su 'gyur ro //
translated: The days and hours are the divisions of the joints.

original: chu tshod de ni nyin zhag sum brgya drug cur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu tshod de ni nyin zhag sum brgya drug cur 'gyur ro //
translated: The hours are the three hundred and sixty days.

original: de dag kyang tshigs sum brgya drug cur 'gyur ro zhes pa tshigs kyi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang tshigs sum brgya drug cur 'gyur ro zhes pa tshigs kyi dbye ba'o //
translated: These are the three hundred and sixty joints.

original: rtsa rnams chu bo zhes pa ni 'dir phyi rol du 'jig rten gyi khams la rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i chu bo stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis te nang du ni ro 'bab pa'i rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur ro //🔽rgyu ma sprin te rgyu ma zhes pa ni rnam dbye med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: rtsa rnams chu bo zhes pa ni 'dir phyi rol du 'jig rten gyi khams la rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i chu bo stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis te nang du ni ro 'bab pa'i rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur ro // rgyu ma sprin te rgyu ma zhes pa ni rnam dbye med pa'i tshig go //
translated: The channels are the rivers. Here, externally, in the world system, there are seventy-two thousand rivers that flow to the ocean. Internally, there are seventy-two thousand channels that carry the rasa.

original: rgyu ma ni sprin du 'gyur te ro 'bab pa'i phyir dang sgra sgrogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma ni sprin du 'gyur te ro 'bab pa'i phyir dang sgra sgrogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The intestines are the clouds. The intestines are the clouds because they carry the rasa and have the characteristic of making sounds.

original: ri bong can gyi cha gzhan khams rnams gnyis kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ri bong can gyi cha gzhan khams rnams gnyis kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The other part of the rabbit is the nature of the two dhatus.

original: 'dir cha rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir cha rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, there are two parts:

original: spu la sogs pa'i khams kyi rnam par 'gyur bas gcig dang khu ba 'pho ba'i chos kyis gzhan no //
analyzed: spu la sogs pa'i khams kyi rnam par 'gyur bas gcig dang khu ba 'pho ba'i chos kyis gzhan no //
translated: one is the transformation of the dhatus of the hair and so on, and the other is the quality of the emission of semen.

original: 'di dag las slar yang sprul sogs pa'i khams kyi rnam par 'gyur bas gnas pa gang yin pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te ri bong can gyi cha gzhan zhes so //
analyzed: 'di dag las slar yang sprul sogs pa'i khams kyi rnam par 'gyur bas gnas pa gang yin pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te ri bong can gyi cha gzhan zhes so //
translated: And again, from these, the transformation of the elements such as emanation, that which remains is also twofold, the other part of the hare.

original: 'dir spu phra mo dang spu sbom po ni tshes gcig dang gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir spu phra mo dang spu sbom po ni tshes gcig dang gnyis pa'o //
translated: Here, fine hair and coarse hair are the first and second lunar days.

original: de bzhin du pags pa ni gsum pa dang bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du pags pa ni gsum pa dang bzhi pa'o //
translated: Similarly, skin is the third and fourth.

original: de bzhin du khrag ni lnga pa dang drug pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khrag ni lnga pa dang drug pa'o //
translated: Similarly, blood is the fifth and sixth.

original: de bzhin du sha ni bdun pa dang brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sha ni bdun pa dang brgyad pa'o //
translated: Similarly, flesh is the seventh and eighth.

original: de bzhin du rtsa ni dgu pa dang bcu pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsa ni dgu pa dang bcu pa'o //
translated: Similarly, veins are the ninth and tenth.

original: de bzhin du rus pa ni bcu gcig pa dang bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rus pa ni bcu gcig pa dang bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: Similarly, bones are the eleventh and twelfth.

original: de bzhin du rkang ni bcu gsum pa dang bcu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rkang ni bcu gsum pa dang bcu bzhi pa'o //
translated: Similarly, marrow is the thirteenth and fourteenth.

original: de bzhin du khu ba ni bco lnga pa dang bcu drug pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du khu ba ni bco lnga pa dang bcu drug pa ste /
translated: Similarly, semen is the fifteenth and sixteenth.

original: cha ni khams rnams @234b gnyis kyi rang bzhin no zhes pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: cha ni khams rnams @234b gnyis kyi rang bzhin no zhes pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The rule is that the parts have the nature of the two elements.

original: da ni spu dang zhes pa la sogs pas 'byung po'i skye gnas gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni spu dang zhes pa la sogs pas 'byung po'i skye gnas gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with hair, etc., he states the place of birth of the spirits.

original: 'dir 'jig rten gyi khams su 'byung po'i skye gnas rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten gyi khams su 'byung po'i skye gnas rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Here, the four modes of birth of living beings occur in the world.

original: 'dir phyi rol du sa'i skye gnas brtan pa ni nang du spu rnams so //
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol du sa'i skye gnas brtan pa ni nang du spu rnams so //
translated: Here, the firm external place of birth, the earth, is the hairs on the body internally.

original: phyi rol du rlung gi skye gnas sgong skyes ni nang du shig rnams so //
analyzed: phyi rol du rlung gi skye gnas sgong skyes ni nang du shig rnams so //
translated: The external place of birth of wind, the egg, is the lice internally.

original: phyi rol du chu'i skye gnas srin bu'i rigs la sogs pa drod gsher las skyes pa ni lus la yang srin bu'i rigs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du chu'i skye gnas srin bu'i rigs la sogs pa drod gsher las skyes pa ni lus la yang srin bu'i rigs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The external place of birth of water, the worm family and so on, born from heat and moisture, is the worm family and so on in the body.

original: phyi rol du ma'i gnas mngal nas skyes pa khu ba nas byung ba ni nang du khu ba nyid do //
analyzed: phyi rol du ma'i gnas mngal nas skyes pa khu ba nas byung ba ni nang du khu ba nyid do //
translated: The external place of birth of the womb, born from the mother's womb, born from semen, is semen internally.

original: ma brjod pa nyid las phyi rol du nam mkha'i khams ro'i ngo bo gzugs rdzus te skyes pa rnams ni nang du phra mo'i gzugs srog chags phra mo rnams te /
analyzed: ma brjod pa nyid las phyi rol du nam mkha'i khams ro'i ngo bo gzugs rdzus te skyes pa rnams ni nang du phra mo'i gzugs srog chags phra mo rnams te /
translated: From the unexpressed, the external element of space, the essence of taste, the form of apparitional birth, is the subtle form of living beings internally.

original: 'byung po'i skye gnas rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'byung po'i skye gnas rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: These are the four modes of birth of living beings.

original: dga' ba la sogs mthe bong tshigs rnams zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs mthe bong tshigs rnams zhes pa ni /
translated: The joints of the thumb are joy and so on.

original: 'dir phyi rol du tshes gcig la sogs pa tshes lnga lnga ni dga' ba la sogs par brjod de /
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol du tshes gcig la sogs pa tshes lnga lnga ni dga' ba la sogs par brjod de /
translated: Here, the first, fifth, etc., days of the lunar fortnight, are called joy, etc.

original: de dag kyang dkar po dang nag po'i phyogs kyi dbye bas mthe'u chung dang mthe bo la sogs pa tshigs gsum gsum gyi rang bzhin gyis so //🔽nam mkha' la sogs pa'i khams kyi dbye bas lag pa g-yon pa'i sor mo'i tshigs rnams dga' ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang dkar po dang nag po'i phyogs kyi dbye bas mthe'u chung dang mthe bo la sogs pa tshigs gsum gsum gyi rang bzhin gyis so // nam mkha' la sogs pa'i khams kyi dbye bas lag pa g-yon pa'i sor mo'i tshigs rnams dga' ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are of the nature of the three joints of the little finger, thumb, etc., by the division of the bright and dark fortnights.🔽By the division of the elements, such as space, etc., the joints of the fingers of the left hand are joy, etc.

original: lag pa g-yas pa'i sor mo'i tshigs rnams sa la sogs pa'i dbye bas te /
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa'i sor mo'i tshigs rnams sa la sogs pa'i dbye bas te /
translated: The joints of the fingers of the right hand are earth, etc.

original: rgan po'i mthe bo'i tshigs la sogs pa'i dbye bas bco lnga'o //
analyzed: rgan po'i mthe bo'i tshigs la sogs pa'i dbye bas bco lnga'o //
translated: By the division of the joints of the right thumb, etc., there are fifteen.

original: de bzhin du rkang pa'i sor mo'i tshigs rnams zla ba gnyis pa'i tshes kyi dbye bas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rkang pa'i sor mo'i tshigs rnams zla ba gnyis pa'i tshes kyi dbye bas shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the joints of the toes should be known by the division of the days of the second month.

original: de ltar na dus so so'i dbye bas lo la yongs su 'khor ba drug tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na dus so so'i dbye bas lo la yongs su 'khor ba drug tu 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, by the division of the individual times, there are six revolutions in a year.

original: dus drug gis so zhes pa ni dga' ba la sogs mthe bong tshigs rnams zhes pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: dus drug gis so zhes pa ni dga' ba la sogs mthe bong tshigs rnams zhes pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The six times is the rule of the joy, etc., and the joints of the thumb, etc.

original: spyi bo'i padma lte ba'i padma dag kyang nus pa'o zhes pa ni sngar brjod pa'i cho gas lhan cig skyes pa'i skur 'gyur ro zhes pa ste /
analyzed: spyi bo'i padma lte ba'i padma dag kyang nus pa'o zhes pa ni sngar brjod pa'i cho gas lhan cig skyes pa'i skur 'gyur ro zhes pa ste /
translated: The navel lotus and the head lotus are the powers, and by the previously described method, there is the co-emergent body.

original: nus pa'i nges pa'o /
analyzed: nus pa'i nges pa'o /
translated: This is the rule of the powers.

original: da ni tshangs pa'i yul sa zhes pa la sogs pas mtho ris la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽'dir lus la tshangs pa'i yul sa gtsug tor nas @235a * //
analyzed: da ni tshangs pa'i yul sa zhes pa la sogs pas mtho ris la sogs pa gsungs te / 'dir lus la tshangs pa'i yul sa gtsug tor nas @235a * //
translated: Now, beginning with the line, “The realm of Brahma, etc.,” he speaks of the heavens, etc.

original: mgrin pa'i mthar thug pa ni mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du 'gyur te /
analyzed: mgrin pa'i mthar thug pa ni mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the realm of Brahma is the head, and the throat is the end of the heaven world.

original: lag mchog dag ni mi yul gyi 'jig rten du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lag mchog dag ni mi yul gyi 'jig rten du 'gyur ro //
translated: The supreme arms are the human world.

original: rkang pa dag ni sa 'og gi 'jig rten du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkang pa dag ni sa 'og gi 'jig rten du 'gyur ro //
translated: The feet are the underworld.

original: chu gter rnams dang gling rnams ni chu gter gling ste /
analyzed: chu gter rnams dang gling rnams ni chu gter gling ste /
translated: The oceans and continents are the oceans and continents.

original: ri bo rnams kyang bdun rnams grangs bzhin du lus la rgya mtsho bdun po ni gsher ba'i khams rnams te /
analyzed: ri bo rnams kyang bdun rnams grangs bzhin du lus la rgya mtsho bdun po ni gsher ba'i khams rnams te /
translated: The seven mountains are the seven oceans, which are the water element, in the body, in order.

original: de dag las lan tshva'i rgya mtsho ni gci ba'o //
analyzed: de dag las lan tshva'i rgya mtsho ni gci ba'o //
translated: The salt ocean is urine.

original: chang gi rgya mtsho ni rdul lo //
analyzed: chang gi rgya mtsho ni rdul lo //
translated: The wine ocean is dust.

original: chu'i rgya mtsho ni st'u ka'o //
analyzed: chu'i rgya mtsho ni st'u ka'o //
translated: The water ocean is semen.

original: 'o ma'i rgya mtsho ni bud med rnams kyi 'o ma dang skyes pa rnams kyi bad kan gyi khams so //
analyzed: 'o ma'i rgya mtsho ni bud med rnams kyi 'o ma dang skyes pa rnams kyi bad kan gyi khams so //
translated: The milk ocean is the milk of women and the phlegm of men.

original: zho'i rgya mtsho ni mgo'i glang pa'o //🔽mar gyi rgya mtsho ni zhag go //
analyzed: zho'i rgya mtsho ni mgo'i glang pa'o // mar gyi rgya mtsho ni zhag go //
translated: The curd ocean is the brain.🔽The clarified butter ocean is the marrow.

original: sbrang gi rgya mtsho ni khu ba'o //
analyzed: sbrang gi rgya mtsho ni khu ba'o //
translated: The honey ocean is the fluid.

original: de bzhin du gling rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gling rnams te /
translated: Similarly, the continents:

original: 'dzam bu'i gling rtsibs bcu gnyis pa ni lag pa dang rkang pa'i dum bu bcu gnyis la'o //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling rtsibs bcu gnyis pa ni lag pa dang rkang pa'i dum bu bcu gnyis la'o //
translated: The Jambudvīpa with twelve spokes is on the twelve sections of the hands and feet.

original: drag po ni sha'o //🔽khrung khrung ni mchin pa'o //
analyzed: drag po ni sha'o // khrung khrung ni mchin pa'o //
translated: Rudra is flesh.🔽Crane is liver.

original: mi'am ci'i ni snying po //
analyzed: mi'am ci'i ni snying po //
translated: Kinnara is heart.

original: gu sha ni tshil bu'o //
analyzed: gu sha ni tshil bu'o //
translated: Guśman is fat.

original: 'od dkar ni rgyu ma'o //
analyzed: 'od dkar ni rgyu ma'o //
translated: White light is intestines.

original: zla ba ni rtsa ste /
analyzed: zla ba ni rtsa ste /
translated: Moon is the channels.

original: 'jam pa'i khams rnams so //
analyzed: 'jam pa'i khams rnams so //
translated: They are the soft elements.

original: ri bo zhes pa la rdo rje'i ri ni rkang pa dang lag pa'i sen mo rnams so //
analyzed: ri bo zhes pa la rdo rje'i ri ni rkang pa dang lag pa'i sen mo rnams so //
translated: The mountain is the vajra mountain, which is the nails of the hands and feet.

original: bsil ba'i ri ni lag pa'i rus pa'o //
analyzed: bsil ba'i ri ni lag pa'i rus pa'o //
translated: The Cool Mountain is the bone of the arm.

original: dro na ni nye ba'i dpung pa'i rus pa'o //
analyzed: dro na ni nye ba'i dpung pa'i rus pa'o //
translated: The Warm is the bone of the shoulder.

original: nor bu'i 'od ni dpung pa'i rus pa'o //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od ni dpung pa'i rus pa'o //
translated: The Light of the Jewel is the bone of the shoulder.

original: ni sha ta ni rkang pa'i rus pa'o //
analyzed: ni sha ta ni rkang pa'i rus pa'o //
translated: The Niṣadha is the bone of the leg.

original: man da ra'i ri ni byin pa'i rus pa'o //
analyzed: man da ra'i ri ni byin pa'i rus pa'o //
translated: The Mandara Mountain is the bone of the thigh.

original: 'od sngon ni brla'i rus pa'o zhes pa ni ri bdun po sra ba'i khams rnams te /
analyzed: 'od sngon ni brla'i rus pa'o zhes pa ni ri bdun po sra ba'i khams rnams te /
translated: The seven mountains are the hard elements.

original: brgyad pa lhun po ni lus kyi sgal tshigs dpyi nas brtsams nas phrag pa'i mthar thug par nges pa ste /
analyzed: brgyad pa lhun po ni lus kyi sgal tshigs dpyi nas brtsams nas phrag pa'i mthar thug par nges pa ste /
translated: The eighth, Mount Meru, is the spine of the body, from the hips to the shoulders.

original: gsher 'jam sra ba gsum gyi rang bzhin khams rnams so //
analyzed: gsher 'jam sra ba gsum gyi rang bzhin khams rnams so //
translated: The elements are of the nature of the three: wet, soft, and hard.

original: me rlung dkyil 'khor zhes pa la me'i dkyil 'khor ni khrag go //
analyzed: me rlung dkyil 'khor zhes pa la me'i dkyil 'khor ni khrag go //
translated: The fire and wind maṇḍalas: the fire maṇḍala is blood.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor ni pags pa'o //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor ni pags pa'o //
translated: The wind maṇḍala is the skin.

original: rgyal po zhes pa ni bod pa'o ;
analyzed: rgyal po zhes pa ni bod pa'o ;
translated: The king is the anus.

original: / skra rnams grub pa mtha' dag srid pa gsum gyi gnas su du ma'i dbye ba dag gis grub pa'o zhes pa ni 'dir phyi rol du 'jig rten gyi khams la grub pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: / skra rnams grub pa mtha' dag srid pa gsum gyi gnas su du ma'i dbye ba dag gis grub pa'o zhes pa ni 'dir phyi rol du 'jig rten gyi khams la grub pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Here, externally, in the world systems, there are three kinds of accomplishments:

original: mkha' la spyod pa dang sa la spyod pa dang sa 'og na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mkha' la spyod pa dang sa la spyod pa dang sa 'og na gnas pa'o //
translated: those who move in the sky, those who move on the earth, and those who dwell underground.

original: de dag las @235b mkha' la spyod pa ni mgo la skyes pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag las @235b mkha' la spyod pa ni mgo la skyes pa rnams so //
translated: Among them, those who move in the sky are those born on the head.

original: sa la spyod pa ni mchan khung du skyes pa rnams so //
analyzed: sa la spyod pa ni mchan khung du skyes pa rnams so //
translated: Those who move on the earth are those born in the armpits.

original: sa 'og na gnas pa ni bha ga dang rtags las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: sa 'og na gnas pa ni bha ga dang rtags las skyes pa'o //
translated: Those who dwell underground are those born from the bhaga and the lingam.

original: ma brjod pa nyid las spu rnams ni 'byung po'i rigs bye ba phrag phyed dang bcas pa'i gsum gyi mtshan nyid do zhes pa ni mtho ris la sogs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: ma brjod pa nyid las spu rnams ni 'byung po'i rigs bye ba phrag phyed dang bcas pa'i gsum gyi mtshan nyid do zhes pa ni mtho ris la sogs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: From the unexpressed, the pores are the characteristics of three and a half million types of bhūtas.

original: da ni snying zhes pa la sogs pas me gsum gsungs te 'dir lus la lho'i me dang khyim bdag gi me dang bsreg bya za ba'i me'o zhes pa ni nges pa ste gsum po grangs bzhin du snying kha'i padma gzhu'i rnam pa la rdo rje ste glog gi
analyzed: da ni snying zhes pa la sogs pas me gsum gsungs te 'dir lus la lho'i me dang khyim bdag gi me dang bsreg bya za ba'i me'o zhes pa ni nges pa ste gsum po grangs bzhin du snying kha'i padma gzhu'i rnam pa la rdo rje ste glog gi
translated: The fire of the heart lotus in the shape of a bow is the vajra fire, the lightning fire.

original: me'o // mgrin pa'i padma zlum po la khyim bdag gi nyi ma'i me'o //
analyzed: me'o // mgrin pa'i padma zlum po la khyim bdag gi nyi ma'i me'o //
translated: The fire of the householder, the sun fire, is in the round lotus of the throat.

original: lte ba'i thab khung gru bzhi pa la bsreg bya za ba'i sha za'i me'o zhes pa ni rab 'phro rim pa yis /
