analyzed: lte ba'i thab khung gru bzhi pa la bsreg bya za ba'i sha za'i me'o zhes pa ni rab 'phro rim pa yis /
translated: The fire of the flesh-eating fire that consumes the burnt offerings is in the square hearth of the navel.

original: nyin bzhin sreg byed chu gter zur gyi thab khung dag la yang zhes pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: nyin bzhin sreg byed chu gter zur gyi thab khung dag la yang zhes pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The definite statement is “in the hearths of the corners of the ocean, which burn daily with the stages of the flames.”

original: de dag gong na me gzhan dri med 'od zer 'phro ba ye shes gzugs ni mun pa dag gi mthar /
analyzed: de dag gong na me gzhan dri med 'od zer 'phro ba ye shes gzugs ni mun pa dag gi mthar /
translated: Above them is another fire, the stainless light-ray, the form of wisdom, at the end of the darkness.

original: gsang ba'i padma dang dpral ba'i padma la mi chod pa ste /
analyzed: gsang ba'i padma dang dpral ba'i padma la mi chod pa ste /
translated: It is in the secret lotus and the forehead lotus, the indestructible.

original: gnas gang zhig nyi ma glog gis mi gdung ri bong 'dzin pa gza' dang skar ma la sogs med pa na ste /
analyzed: gnas gang zhig nyi ma glog gis mi gdung ri bong 'dzin pa gza' dang skar ma la sogs med pa na ste /
translated: In a place that is not struck by the sun, the moon, Rāhu, the planets, the stars, and so on.

original: sogs pas ni sha za'i me ste /
analyzed: sogs pas ni sha za'i me ste /
translated: The “and so on” includes the fire of the piśāca.

original: bzhi pa bden pa'i me ye shes kyi gzugs so zhes pa ni me gsum gyi nges pa'o //🔽da ni gza' zhes pa la sogs pas /
analyzed: bzhi pa bden pa'i me ye shes kyi gzugs so zhes pa ni me gsum gyi nges pa'o // da ni gza' zhes pa la sogs pas /
translated: The fourth fire is the form of gnosis, which is the fire of truth.

original: gza'i chu tshod la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gza'i chu tshod la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, the planets, and so on, are explained.

original: 'dir phyi rol du gza' bdun te /
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol du gza' bdun te /
translated: Here, the seven external planets

original: brgyad pa ni rigs ldan gyi longs spyod do //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni rigs ldan gyi longs spyod do //
translated: are the eight bhagas of the moon.

original: brgyad po de dag ni lus kyi snying kha'i padma'i 'dab ma brgyad po rnams la 'gyur te /🔽shar gyi 'dab ma la nyi ma'o //🔽mer zla ba'o //
analyzed: brgyad po de dag ni lus kyi snying kha'i padma'i 'dab ma brgyad po rnams la 'gyur te / shar gyi 'dab ma la nyi ma'o // mer zla ba'o //
translated: Those eight are the eight petals of the lotus of the heart cakra.🔽The sun is on the eastern petal.

original: lhor bkra shis so //🔽bden bral du gza' lag go //
analyzed: lhor bkra shis so // bden bral du gza' lag go //
translated: The moon is in the south.🔽Bṛhaspati is in the west.

original: chur phur bu'o //🔽rlung du pa sangs so //
analyzed: chur phur bu'o // rlung du pa sangs so //
translated: Śukra is in the north.🔽Śani is in the northeast.

original: lus ngan du spen pa'o //🔽dbang ldan du rigs ldan gyi longs spyod la mjug rings te /
analyzed: lus ngan du spen pa'o // dbang ldan du rigs ldan gyi longs spyod la mjug rings te /
translated: Rāhu is in the southeast.🔽Ketu is in the southwest.

original: longs spyod phyed gzhan la ni sgra gcan no //
analyzed: longs spyod phyed gzhan la ni sgra gcan no //
translated: The other half of the bhaga is Rāhu.

original: rab tu gsal byas chu tshod drug cu lte ba'i padma la ste chu tshod stong pa'i 'dab ma bzhi'o //
analyzed: rab tu gsal byas chu tshod drug cu lte ba'i padma la ste chu tshod stong pa'i 'dab ma bzhi'o //
translated: The very clear ones are the sixty hours in the center lotus, which has four petals of a thousand hours.

original: lhag ma 'dab ma drug cu ni dkyil 'khor drug cu 'bab pa'i chu tshod rnams te gza' so so la drug cu'i grangs so //
analyzed: lhag ma 'dab ma drug cu ni dkyil 'khor drug cu 'bab pa'i chu tshod rnams te gza' so so la drug cu'i grangs so //
translated: The remaining sixty petals are the hours of the sixty maṇḍalas, the sixty numbers for each planet.

original: smin ma'i dbus su 'dab ma bcu drug rnams la @236a * //
analyzed: smin ma'i dbus su 'dab ma bcu drug rnams la @236a * //
translated: In the center of the eyebrows, there are sixteen petals.

original: 'dab ma gnyis ni stong pa 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma gnyis ni stong pa 'bab pa'o //
translated: Two petals are empty.

original: 'dab ma bcu bzhi la 'byung dang 'byung ba mda' zhes pa la sogs pas zla ba'i rkang pa bcu bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: 'dab ma bcu bzhi la 'byung dang 'byung ba mda' zhes pa la sogs pas zla ba'i rkang pa bcu bzhi rnams so //
translated: On the fourteen petals, the fourteen lunar mansions are mentioned beginning with “the elements and the elements are arrows.”

original: de la dang po'i 'dab ma la 'byung ba zhes pa chu tshod lnga'i bdag nyid kyi rkang pa ste de bzhin du gnyis pa dang gsum pa la'o //
analyzed: de la dang po'i 'dab ma la 'byung ba zhes pa chu tshod lnga'i bdag nyid kyi rkang pa ste de bzhin du gnyis pa dang gsum pa la'o //
translated: There, on the first petal, “the elements” are the first lunar mansion, which is five hours long. Similarly, the second and third [petals].

original: 'dab ma bzhi pa la rig byed ces pa chu tshod bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'dab ma bzhi pa la rig byed ces pa chu tshod bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
translated: On the fourth petal, “Vedic” is the fourth lunar mansion, which is four hours long.

original: lnga pa la rtse mo can te rkang pa chu tshod gsum mo //
analyzed: lnga pa la rtse mo can te rkang pa chu tshod gsum mo //
translated: On the fifth petal, “crested” is the fifth lunar mansion, which is three hours long.

original: 'dab ma drug pa la lag pa zhes pa chu tshod gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi rkang pa'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma drug pa la lag pa zhes pa chu tshod gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi rkang pa'o //
translated: On the sixth petal, “hand” is the foot of two nāḍīs.🔽On the seventh petal, “the moon” is the seventh foot of one nāḍi.

original: 'dab ma bdun pa la ri bong can zhes pa chu tshod gcig gi bdag nyid kyi rkang pa bdun pa'o de bzhin du lugs las bzlog pas brgyad pa la chu tshod gcig gi rkang pa'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma bdun pa la ri bong can zhes pa chu tshod gcig gi bdag nyid kyi rkang pa bdun pa'o de bzhin du lugs las bzlog pas brgyad pa la chu tshod gcig gi rkang pa'o //
translated: In the reverse order, on the eighth petal, there is one nāḍi.

original: dgu pa la chu tshod gnyis kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: dgu pa la chu tshod gnyis kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: On the ninth petal, there are two nāḍīs.

original: bcu pa la chu tshod gsum gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bcu pa la chu tshod gsum gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: On the tenth petal, there are three nāḍīs.

original: bcu gcig pa la chu tshod bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bcu gcig pa la chu tshod bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
translated: On the eleventh petal, there are four nāḍīs.

original: bcu gnyis pa la chu tshod lnga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa la chu tshod lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: On the twelfth petal, there are five nāḍīs.

original: bcu gsum pa dang bcu bzhi pa la yang de ltar shes par bya ste zla ba'i rkang pa ma nu'i grangs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcu gsum pa dang bcu bzhi pa la yang de ltar shes par bya ste zla ba'i rkang pa ma nu'i grangs su 'gyur ro //
translated: On the thirteenth and fourteenth petals, there are six and seven nāḍīs, respectively.

original: mi bdag ces pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: mi bdag ces pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: “The lord” is the master.

original: longs spyod 'khor lo ste mgrin pa'i 'khor lor 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis la 'dab ma bzhi ni stong pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod 'khor lo ste mgrin pa'i 'khor lor 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis la 'dab ma bzhi ni stong pa'o //
translated: The enjoyment cakra is the throat cakra with thirty-two petals.

original: gzhan 'dab ma nyi shu rtsa brgyad po rnams la byi bzhin dang bcas pa'i rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa brgyad po rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan 'dab ma nyi shu rtsa brgyad po rnams la byi bzhin dang bcas pa'i rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa brgyad po rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: The other twenty-eight petals are the twenty-eight lunar mansions.

original: de dag ni shar gyi thur ma bdun gyi dbu ma la dbu ma gang yin pa nam gru'i mthar g-yon skor gyis te /
analyzed: de dag ni shar gyi thur ma bdun gyi dbu ma la dbu ma gang yin pa nam gru'i mthar g-yon skor gyis te /
translated: Among them, the one in the middle of the seven southern petals is the middle lunar mansion, ending with Āśleṣā, in a counterclockwise direction.

original: gnyis pa la tha skar ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa la tha skar ro //
translated: In the second, it is Maghā.

original: gsum pa la bra nye'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la bra nye'o //
translated: In the third, it is Pūrvāṣāḍhā.

original: bzhi pa la smin drug go //
analyzed: bzhi pa la smin drug go //
translated: In the fourth, it is Śravaṇa.

original: de nas dbyug gu'i rgyu skar te thur ma ni 'dab ma bdun pa'i ming can gyi rtsa'o //
analyzed: de nas dbyug gu'i rgyu skar te thur ma ni 'dab ma bdun pa'i ming can gyi rtsa'o //
translated: Then, the Dhaniṣṭhā lunar mansion is the channel called the seven southern petals.

original: de nas byang gi thur ma bdun po rnams la g-yon skor gyis te thur ma dang po la snar ma'o //
analyzed: de nas byang gi thur ma bdun po rnams la g-yon skor gyis te thur ma dang po la snar ma'o //
translated: Then, in the seven northern petals, in a counterclockwise direction, in the first petal, it is Śatabhiṣā.

original: gnyis pa la mgo 'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa la mgo 'o //
translated: In the second, it is Proṣṭhapadā.

original: gsum pa la lag go //
analyzed: gsum pa la lag go //
translated: In the third, it is Revatī.

original: bzhi pa la nab so'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa la nab so'o //
translated: In the fourth, it is Aśvinī.

original: lnga pa la rgyal lo //
analyzed: lnga pa la rgyal lo //
translated: In the fifth, it is Bharaṇī.

original: drug pa la skag go //
analyzed: drug pa la skag go //
translated: In the sixth, it is Ārdrā.

original: bdun pa la mchu'o //
analyzed: bdun pa la mchu'o //
translated: In the seventh, it is Punarvasu.

original: de nas gzhan la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gzhan la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood in the same way for the others.

original: slar yang lte ba'i padmar rgyu skar rnams kyi chu tshod drug cu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang lte ba'i padmar rgyu skar rnams kyi chu tshod drug cu rig par bya'o //
translated: Again, in the navel lotus, the sixty hours of the lunar mansions should be known.

original: chu tshod kyi chu srang ni drug cu ste drug cu rnams brgya phrag sum cu rtsa drug ni gsal bar mtha' dag lus la lag pa rkang pa la sogs dag gi tshigs la'o zhes pa ni 'chad @236b par 'gyur ba las rgyas par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: chu tshod kyi chu srang ni drug cu ste drug cu rnams brgya phrag sum cu rtsa drug ni gsal bar mtha' dag lus la lag pa rkang pa la sogs dag gi tshigs la'o zhes pa ni 'chad @236b par 'gyur ba las rgyas par brjod par bya ste /
translated: The sixty-minute hours are sixty, and the sixty times thirty-six hundred are the joints of the hands, feet, and so on in the entire body. This will be explained extensively in the future.

original: gza' la sogs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: gza' la sogs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The certainty of the planets and so on.

original: da ni lte ba zhes pa la sogs pas srog gi nus pa lte ba la sogs pa'i 'khor lor 'khor ba gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni lte ba zhes pa la sogs pas srog gi nus pa lte ba la sogs pa'i 'khor lor 'khor ba gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with “navel,” the circulation of the power of life in the navel cakra and so on is explained.

original: 'dir phyi rol tu nyi ma khyim bcu gnyis po rnams la lo'i 'pho ba'i dbye bas 'khor ba ji lta ba de bzhin du nang du srog gi nus pa yang khyim bcu gnyis po rnams la nyin zhag so sor 'pho ba bcu gnyis kyi dbye bas 'khor ro
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol tu nyi ma khyim bcu gnyis po rnams la lo'i 'pho ba'i dbye bas 'khor ba ji lta ba de bzhin du nang du srog gi nus pa yang khyim bcu gnyis po rnams la nyin zhag so sor 'pho ba bcu gnyis kyi dbye bas 'khor ro
translated: Here, just as externally the sun moves through the twelve houses by the division of the transits of the year, so internally the power of life moves through the twelve houses by the division of the twelve transits in each day.

original: // lte ba'i chu skyes nyi ma'i 'dab ma dag la 'khor te mchog gi cha srog gi nus pa ni 'pho ba'i rim pas khyim bcu gnyis kyi 'dab ma rnams la srog zung dgu brgya nyis 'gyur dag gis 'pho bar 'gyur te zhes pa ni /
analyzed: // lte ba'i chu skyes nyi ma'i 'dab ma dag la 'khor te mchog gi cha srog gi nus pa ni 'pho ba'i rim pas khyim bcu gnyis kyi 'dab ma rnams la srog zung dgu brgya nyis 'gyur dag gis 'pho bar 'gyur te zhes pa ni /
translated: The power of life moves in the supreme part, in the petals of the twelve houses, by the movement of the breath, with nine hundred and ninety-two pairs of breaths.

original: 'dir ji ltar phyi rol du dbyug gu brgya phrag bcva brgyad kyis nyi ma'i 'pho ba gcig tu 'gyur ba de bzhin du dbugs brgya phrag bcva brgyad kyis srog gi nus pa 'dab ma re rer 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar phyi rol du dbyug gu brgya phrag bcva brgyad kyis nyi ma'i 'pho ba gcig tu 'gyur ba de bzhin du dbugs brgya phrag bcva brgyad kyis srog gi nus pa 'dab ma re rer 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, just as one solar revolution occurs with one hundred and eight hundredths of a staff, so the power of life moves in each petal with one hundred and eight hundredths of a breath.

original: de yang dus sbyor ka rka ta nas mi yi dbang 'dir phyi rol du nyi ma'i skye ba'i khyim ni ka rka ta'o //
analyzed: de yang dus sbyor ka rka ta nas mi yi dbang 'dir phyi rol du nyi ma'i skye ba'i khyim ni ka rka ta'o //
translated: In this external world, the house of the sun's birth is Cancer.

original: de bzhin du skyes pa thams cad dus sbyor gang du skyes par gyur pa'i khyim de ni ka rka ta'i ming can du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du skyes pa thams cad dus sbyor gang du skyes par gyur pa'i khyim de ni ka rka ta'i ming can du rig par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, in all births, the house in which one is born is to be known as having the name Cancer.

original: srog gi skye ba gnas par bya zhes pa'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: srog gi skye ba gnas par bya zhes pa'i rigs pas so //
translated: This is the reasoning of the statement, The birth of life is to be placed.

original: dus sbyor ka rka ta nas mi'i dbang zhes pa ni bod pa'o //🔽phyi rol du dus sbyor gang la nyi ma gnas pas 'char ba'i dus nas nyin dang mtshan mor 'khor ba de la de ni rig par bya ste thur ma bdun gyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: dus sbyor ka rka ta nas mi'i dbang zhes pa ni bod pa'o // phyi rol du dus sbyor gang la nyi ma gnas pas 'char ba'i dus nas nyin dang mtshan mor 'khor ba de la de ni rig par bya ste thur ma bdun gyi dbye bas so //
translated: The period of the moon's increase from the lunar mansion Pushya to the lunar mansion Bharaṇī is called the period of men.🔽Externally, the period of the moon's increase is the period of the moon's movement from the lunar mansion in which the sun is situated to the lunar mansion in which the moon rises, from the time of rising to the time of setting, because of the division of seven fingerbreadths.

original: dus sbyor tshad ni shes par bya ste phyi rol du nyi ma'i 'pho ba chad pa dang lhag pa nyin zhag rnams kyis rig par bya ba ji lta ba de bzhin du nang du chad pa dang lhag pa ni dbugs rnams kyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dus sbyor tshad ni shes par bya ste phyi rol du nyi ma'i 'pho ba chad pa dang lhag pa nyin zhag rnams kyis rig par bya ba ji lta ba de bzhin du nang du chad pa dang lhag pa ni dbugs rnams kyis rig par bya'o //
translated: The period of the moon's increase should be understood by the division of the external movement of the sun, the remainder and the excess of the days and nights.

original: nyi ma'i chu tshod kyi dbye bas lus la dbugs kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i chu tshod kyi dbye bas lus la dbugs kyi nges pa'o //
translated: The determination of the breaths in the body is by the division of the sun's hours.

original: srog gi nor dang bu lon mnyam pa ste ka rka ta la sogs pa la nyi ma'i rkang pas bu lon dang chu srin la sogs pa la nor ro //
analyzed: srog gi nor dang bu lon mnyam pa ste ka rka ta la sogs pa la nyi ma'i rkang pas bu lon dang chu srin la sogs pa la nor ro //
translated: The debts and the wealth of the life force are equal. In the lunar mansions Pushya and so on, the debts are by the sun's feet and the wealth is in the lunar mansions Mṛgaśirā and so on.

original: skar rtsis kyi cho gas mnyam pa ni 'pho ba so so'i nyin zhag ste /
analyzed: skar rtsis kyi cho gas mnyam pa ni 'pho ba so so'i nyin zhag ste /
translated: The equality by the method of astrology is the days of each revolution.

original: rkang pa dang bcas pa'i dbyug gu lnga bcu rtsa drug gi bdag nyid ni phyi rol du'o //
analyzed: rkang pa dang bcas pa'i dbyug gu lnga bcu rtsa drug gi bdag nyid ni phyi rol du'o //
translated: The external is the nature of fifty-six ghatis together with the feet.

original: nang du mnyam pa ni dbugs kyi bdag nyid de dus sbyor so so'i 'pho ba'i dbye bas so zhes pa ni 'pho ba bcu gnyis 'khor ba'o //🔽da ni re re zhes pa la sogs pas padma'i 'dab ma so so la dkyil @237a * //
analyzed: nang du mnyam pa ni dbugs kyi bdag nyid de dus sbyor so so'i 'pho ba'i dbye bas so zhes pa ni 'pho ba bcu gnyis 'khor ba'o // da ni re re zhes pa la sogs pas padma'i 'dab ma so so la dkyil @237a * //
translated: The internal is the nature of the breath, by the division of the transits of each of the houses. This is the cycle of the twelve transits.

original: 'khor rab tu 'bab pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'khor rab tu 'bab pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with “each,” he teaches the descent of the maṇḍala into each of the lotus petals.

original: 'dir phyi rol du nyi ma'i 'pho ba re re la nyin zhag sum cus dkyil 'khor lnga longs spyod cing nyin zhag drug gi dbyug gu sum brgya drug cus dkyil 'khor gcig longs spyod do //
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol du nyi ma'i 'pho ba re re la nyin zhag sum cus dkyil 'khor lnga longs spyod cing nyin zhag drug gi dbyug gu sum brgya drug cus dkyil 'khor gcig longs spyod do //
translated: Here, externally, in each solar transit, the five maṇḍalas are enjoyed by thirty days, and one maṇḍala is enjoyed by six days, with three hundred and sixty ghatis.

original: de bzhin du nang du dbugs brgya phrag bcva brgyad kyis dkyil 'khor lnga longs spyod cing /
analyzed: de bzhin du nang du dbugs brgya phrag bcva brgyad kyis dkyil 'khor lnga longs spyod cing /
translated: Similarly, internally, the five maṇḍalas are enjoyed by one thousand eight hundred breaths,

original: dbugs sum brgya drug cus dkyil 'khor gcig longs spyod par 'gyur pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs sum brgya drug cus dkyil 'khor gcig longs spyod par 'gyur pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: and one maṇḍala is enjoyed by three hundred and sixty breaths. That is certain.

original: 'dir 'pho ba so so'i 'dab ma la gnas lngar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir 'pho ba so so'i 'dab ma la gnas lngar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the transits are in the five places on the petals.

original: 'dab ma'i nub dang byang dang lho dang shar dang dbus so //🔽de la padma'i 'dab ma so so re re la 'bab par 'gyur te nub tu 'dzin ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'dab ma'i nub dang byang dang lho dang shar dang dbus so // de la padma'i 'dab ma so so re re la 'bab par 'gyur te nub tu 'dzin ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: They are in the west, north, south, east, and center of the petals.🔽The petals are the wind mandala, the water mandala, the fire mandala, the earth mandala, and the space mandala.🔽The wind mandala is in the west.

original: 'dab ma'i byang du chu'i dkyil 'khor 'bab bo //
analyzed: 'dab ma'i byang du chu'i dkyil 'khor 'bab bo //
translated: The water mandala is in the north.🔽The fire mandala is in the south.

original: lhor me'i dkyil 'khor 'bab bo //🔽slar yang shar du rlung gi dkyil 'khor rab tu 'bab bo //
analyzed: lhor me'i dkyil 'khor 'bab bo // slar yang shar du rlung gi dkyil 'khor rab tu 'bab bo //
translated: The earth mandala is in the east.🔽The space mandala is in the center.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.

original: 'dab ma'i dbus dag tu yang stod pa'i dkyil 'khor 'bab ste /🔽so sor dbugs sum brgya drug cu ni srog gi nus pa'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma'i dbus dag tu yang stod pa'i dkyil 'khor 'bab ste / so sor dbugs sum brgya drug cu ni srog gi nus pa'o //
translated: The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The transits are in the five mandalas.

original: de ltar dbye ba lnga yis 'pho ba so sor 'gyur ro //🔽dkyil 'khor 'di dag la dbugs sum brgya drug cu'i dbus nas rkang pa dang bcas pa'i dbugs bcu gcig bzung nas dus sbyor 'char ba'i mtshams su mnyam pa rab tu 'bab ste /
analyzed: de ltar dbye ba lnga yis 'pho ba so sor 'gyur ro //🔽dkyil 'khor 'di dag la dbugs sum brgya drug cu'i dbus nas rkang pa dang bcas pa'i dbugs bcu gcig bzung nas dus sbyor 'char ba'i mtshams su mnyam pa rab tu 'bab ste /
translated: The transits are in the five mandalas.🔽The

original: dman pa'i dbugs ni drug cu'o zhes pa ni rkang pa gsum dang bcas pa'i dbugs gsum gyis dman pa'i dbugs rkang pa dang bcas pa'i lnga bcu rtsa drug 'bab bo //
analyzed: dman pa'i dbugs ni drug cu'o zhes pa ni rkang pa gsum dang bcas pa'i dbugs gsum gyis dman pa'i dbugs rkang pa dang bcas pa'i lnga bcu rtsa drug 'bab bo //
translated: with three steps, the inferior breath flows with five steps and sixty.

original: de ltar 'pho ba'i dbye ba rnams ni nang du dus sbyor bcu gnyis kyi mtshams kyi rab tu dbye bas 'gyur ro zhes pa ni 'pho ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'pho ba'i dbye ba rnams ni nang du dus sbyor bcu gnyis kyi mtshams kyi rab tu dbye bas 'gyur ro zhes pa ni 'pho ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, the divisions of the transits are due to the internal divisions of the conjunctions of the twelve houses.

original: da ni stong pa zhes pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor lnga'i lhag pa'i lha gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni stong pa zhes pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor lnga'i lhag pa'i lha gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with “the void,” he declares the special deities of the five mandalas.

original: 'dir phyi rol du nyi ma ni lug la sogs pa mi mnyam pa'i dus sbyor la stong pa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa longs spyod cing glang la sogs pa mnyam pa'i dus sbyor la sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa longs spyod do //
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol du nyi ma ni lug la sogs pa mi mnyam pa'i dus sbyor la stong pa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa longs spyod cing glang la sogs pa mnyam pa'i dus sbyor la sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa longs spyod do //
translated: Here, externally, the sun enjoys the void mandala, etc., in the unequal conjunctions of Aries, etc., and enjoys the earth mandala, etc., in the equal conjunctions of Taurus, etc.

original: de bzhin du nang du stong pa la sogs pa de nyid lnga zhes pa ni stong pa dang rlung dang me dang chu dang sa'i dkyil 'khor rnams nges par byang du ste sna bug g-yon par rab tu 'bab bo //
analyzed: de bzhin du nang du stong pa la sogs pa de nyid lnga zhes pa ni stong pa dang rlung dang me dang chu dang sa'i dkyil 'khor rnams nges par byang du ste sna bug g-yon par rab tu 'bab bo //
translated: Likewise, the five circles of emptiness and so on, namely, the circles of emptiness, wind, fire, water, and earth, definitely flow into the left nostril.

original: sa la sogs pa zhes pa ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang stong pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams g-yas kyi sna'i @237b bug par 'bab bo //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa zhes pa ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang stong pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams g-yas kyi sna'i @237b bug par 'bab bo //
translated: The circles of earth and so on, namely, the circles of earth, water, fire, wind, and emptiness, flow into the right nostril.

original: g-yon dang g-yas kyi dkyil 'khor bcu po 'di dag la grangs bzhin du g-yon par stong pa'i dkyil 'khor rab tu 'bab pa'i dus su sgra gcan ni lhag pa'i lha'o //
analyzed: g-yon dang g-yas kyi dkyil 'khor bcu po 'di dag la grangs bzhin du g-yon par stong pa'i dkyil 'khor rab tu 'bab pa'i dus su sgra gcan ni lhag pa'i lha'o //
translated: In these ten circles of the left and right, Rāhu is the predominant deity when the circle of emptiness flows into the left nostril.

original: g-yas par dus kyi me'o //🔽g-yon par rlung gi dkyil 'khor la zla ba'o //🔽g-yas pa la nyi ma'o //
analyzed: g-yas par dus kyi me'o // g-yon par rlung gi dkyil 'khor la zla ba'o // g-yas pa la nyi ma'o //
translated: Kālagnirāhu is the predominant deity when the circle of wind flows into the right nostril.🔽Candra is the predominant deity when the circle of wind flows into the left nostril.

original: g-yon par me'i dkyil 'khor la gza' lag go //🔽g-yas pa la bkra shis so //
analyzed: g-yon par me'i dkyil 'khor la gza' lag go // g-yas pa la bkra shis so //
translated: Sūrya is the predominant deity when the circle of fire flows into the right nostril.🔽Budha is the predominant deity when the circle of fire flows into the left nostril.

original: g-yon par chu'i dkyil 'khor la pa sangs so //
analyzed: g-yon par chu'i dkyil 'khor la pa sangs so //
translated: Puṣya is the predominant deity when the circle of water flows into the right nostril.

original: g-yas pa la phur bu'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa la phur bu'o //
translated: On the right, the planet Ketu.

original: g-yon par sa'i dkyil 'khor la mjug rings so //
analyzed: g-yon par sa'i dkyil 'khor la mjug rings so //
translated: On the left, on the earth mandala, Rāhu.

original: g-yas pa la spen pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa la spen pa'o //
translated: On the right, Śukra.

original: de ltar na nam mkha' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams la bdag po zhing can bcur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na nam mkha' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams la bdag po zhing can bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, in the mandalas of space and so forth, there are ten lords of the fields.

original: de bzhin du zla ba drug la zla ba dbang phyug tu 'gyur te lug dang 'khrig pa dang seng ge dang srang dang / gzhu dang / bum pa'i khyim g-yon gyi rtsa la zla ba zhes pa khu ba'i khams dbang phyug ste byang dag tu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zla ba drug la zla ba dbang phyug tu 'gyur te lug dang 'khrig pa dang seng ge dang srang dang / gzhu dang / bum pa'i khyim g-yon gyi rtsa la zla ba zhes pa khu ba'i khams dbang phyug ste byang dag tu'o //
translated: Similarly, in six months, the moon becomes Īśvara, in the houses of Aries, Taurus, Leo, Libra, Sagittarius, and Aquarius. The moon, the element of semen, is Īśvara in the northern direction.

original: lho ru glang dang ka rka ta dang bu mo dang / sdig pa dang / chu srin dang / nya'i khyim la nyi ma ste rdul gyi khams dbang phyug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lho ru glang dang ka rka ta dang bu mo dang / sdig pa dang / chu srin dang / nya'i khyim la nyi ma ste rdul gyi khams dbang phyug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: In the south, the sun is in the houses of Taurus, Cancer, Virgo, Scorpio, Capricorn, and Pisces. The sun is Īśvara of the element of blood.

original: mi bdag ces pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: mi bdag ces pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: The lord of men is the one who is born.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the determination of the lords of the mandalas.

original: da ni de zhes pa la sogs pas srog la sogs pa'i rlung rnams gsungs te 'dir lte ba'i 'khor lo ni snying por 'dab ma bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: da ni de zhes pa la sogs pas srog la sogs pa'i rlung rnams gsungs te 'dir lte ba'i 'khor lo ni snying por 'dab ma bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Now, the winds such as life-force, etc., are mentioned beginning with “now, that,” etc. Here, the navel cakra is the essence with the nature of four petals.

original: de'i phyi rol du 'dab ma brgyad kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du 'dab ma brgyad kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Outside of that, it has the nature of eight petals.

original: de'i phyi rol du 'dab ma bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du 'dab ma bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Outside of that, it has the nature of twelve petals.

original: de'i phyi rol du 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid de 'dab ma'i sgras dbugs kyi chos can gyi rtsa rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid de 'dab ma'i sgras dbugs kyi chos can gyi rtsa rnams gzung ngo //
translated: Outside of that, it has the nature of sixty-four petals. The term “petals” refers to the channels that are the nature of breath.

original: lte ba'i 'khor lo de steng ste sor mo phyed dang bcas pa'i bcu gnyis kyi steng snying kha'i phyogs su rtsa yi 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa rtsa brgyad kyi bdag nyid yang dag par gnas so //
analyzed: lte ba'i 'khor lo de steng ste sor mo phyed dang bcas pa'i bcu gnyis kyi steng snying kha'i phyogs su rtsa yi 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa rtsa brgyad kyi bdag nyid yang dag par gnas so //
translated: That navel cakra, twelve finger-widths above, in the region of the heart, the channel cakra with eight spokes, with the nature of eight channels, is situated.

original: de rnams la srog la sogs pa'i rlung gi tshogs so //
analyzed: de rnams la srog la sogs pa'i rlung gi tshogs so //
translated: In them are the groups of winds such as life-force, etc.

original: padma nor gyi 'dab ma dag la /
analyzed: padma nor gyi 'dab ma dag la /
translated: On the petals of the lotus of wealth,

original: zla ba nyi ma me rnams te me zhes pa ni sgra gcan no //
analyzed: zla ba nyi ma me rnams te me zhes pa ni sgra gcan no //
translated: the moon, sun, and Rāhu, the so-called “fire.”

original: g-yon du zla ba'i rtsa ni ri bong mtshan ma 'bab ste kha dog dkar po'o //
analyzed: g-yon du zla ba'i rtsa ni ri bong mtshan ma 'bab ste kha dog dkar po'o //
translated: On the left, the lunar channel flows, with the sign of the hare, and is white.

original: g-yas su kha dog dmar po ste nyi ma'i rtsa 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas su kha dog dmar po ste nyi ma'i rtsa 'bab pa'o //
translated: On the right, the solar channel flows, red.

original: 'dab ma brgyad kyi dbus su dus kyi me'i gzugs sgra gcan gyi rtsa 'bab @238a * //
analyzed: 'dab ma brgyad kyi dbus su dus kyi me'i gzugs sgra gcan gyi rtsa 'bab @238a * //
translated: In the middle of the eight petals, the Rāhu channel flows, in the form of the fire of time.

original: bo ; / mnyam pa dag la dus sbyor 'char ba'i mtshams su rkang pa dang bcas pa'i dbugs lnga bcu rtsa drug go //
analyzed: bo ; / mnyam pa dag la dus sbyor 'char ba'i mtshams su rkang pa dang bcas pa'i dbugs lnga bcu rtsa drug go //
translated: In the equal ones, at the time of the rising of the lunar mansion, there are fifty-six breaths with the foot.

original: snying kha'i chu skyes rtsibs brgyad pa 'di la thun tshod 'pho ba'i rtsa rnams rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snying kha'i chu skyes rtsibs brgyad pa 'di la thun tshod 'pho ba'i rtsa rnams rig par bya'o //
translated: In this eight-petaled heart lotus, the channels of the movement of the periods should be known.

original: sna'i bug par dkyil 'khor lnga 'bab par byed pa ni 'di rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sna'i bug par dkyil 'khor lnga 'bab par byed pa ni 'di rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: These are the five maṇḍalas that flow in the nostrils.

original: rtsa dang rtsa la dbugs 'byung ba dang 'jug pa brgya phrag nyi shu rtsa bdun gyis srog yang dag par rgyu bar 'gyur te dbyug gu phyed dang bcas pa'i bdun gyis so //
analyzed: rtsa dang rtsa la dbugs 'byung ba dang 'jug pa brgya phrag nyi shu rtsa bdun gyis srog yang dag par rgyu bar 'gyur te dbyug gu phyed dang bcas pa'i bdun gyis so //
translated: In the channels, the life force moves correctly by twenty-seven hundred breaths, with seven and a half nāḍīs.

original: de la srog ni steng du 'bab bo //
analyzed: de la srog ni steng du 'bab bo //
translated: There, the life force moves above.

original: thur sel ni lte ba'i 'og tu 'bab bo //
analyzed: thur sel ni lte ba'i 'og tu 'bab bo //
translated: The downward-clearing wind moves below the navel.

original: mnyam gnas ni shar gyi 'dab ma'i rtsa snar ma la lhag pa'i lha'o //
analyzed: mnyam gnas ni shar gyi 'dab ma'i rtsa snar ma la lhag pa'i lha'o //
translated: The fire-accompanying wind moves in the channel tip of the eastern petal, the channel of the special deity.

original: gyen rgyu ni me'i 'dab mar rtsa lag ldan gyi lce la'o //🔽khyab byed ni lho'i 'dab mar rtsa dmar ser la'o //
analyzed: gyen rgyu ni me'i 'dab mar rtsa lag ldan gyi lce la'o // khyab byed ni lho'i 'dab mar rtsa dmar ser la'o //
translated: The upward-moving wind moves in the channel tip of the fire petal, the channel of the finger.🔽The pervading wind moves in the channel tip of the southern petal, the channel of the red-orange.

original: klu ni bden bral gyi 'dab mar rtsa rgyal la'o //🔽rus sbal ni chu'i 'dab mar rtsa rgyal ba la'o //
analyzed: klu ni bden bral gyi 'dab mar rtsa rgyal la'o // rus sbal ni chu'i 'dab mar rtsa rgyal ba la'o //
translated: The naga wind moves in the channel tip of the southwest petal, the channel of the king.🔽The tortoise wind moves in the channel tip of the water petal, the channel of the victor.

original: rtsangs pa ni rlung gi 'dab mar rtsa aa lam bu sha la'o //
analyzed: rtsangs pa ni rlung gi 'dab mar rtsa aa lam bu sha la'o //
translated: The lizard wind moves in the channel tip of the wind petal, the channel of the alambuśa.

original: lha sbyin ni byang gi 'dab mar rtsa ai da la'o //
analyzed: lha sbyin ni byang gi 'dab mar rtsa ai da la'o //
translated: The god-given wind moves in the channel tip of the northern petal, the channel of the ida.

original: nor las rgyal ba ni dbang ldan gyi 'dab ma la rtsa ku h'a la'o //
analyzed: nor las rgyal ba ni dbang ldan gyi 'dab ma la rtsa ku h'a la'o //
translated: The conqueror of wealth wind moves in the channel tip of the northeast petal, the channel of the kuhu.

original: srog ni rtsa su shu mna la'o //
analyzed: srog ni rtsa su shu mna la'o //
translated: The life wind moves in the channel of the susumna.

original: thur sel ni phyogs kyi grangs dung can ma gang gis byang chub kyi sems zag par byed pa de la lhag pa'i lha'o zhes pa de ltar rlung rnam pa bcu ni rtsa'i 'khor lo la las kyi dbye bas yang dag par gnas so //🔽srog la sogs pa 'di dag thams cad rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis po rnams la khyab pa ste 'on kyang gnas brgyad la skyes pa brgyad do //
analyzed: thur sel ni phyogs kyi grangs dung can ma gang gis byang chub kyi sems zag par byed pa de la lhag pa'i lha'o zhes pa de ltar rlung rnam pa bcu ni rtsa'i 'khor lo la las kyi dbye bas yang dag par gnas so // srog la sogs pa 'di dag thams cad rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis po rnams la khyab pa ste 'on kyang gnas brgyad la skyes pa brgyad do //
translated: The downward-clearing wind is the supreme deity in the channel-wheel of the navel, which is the direction of the ten channels.🔽All of these winds, such as the life-force wind, pervade the seventy-two thousand channels.

original: dud can mtha' yas ai da la sogs rang gi snying kha'i padma rtsa yi 'khor lo mtha' dag go zhes pa mnyam gnas la sogs pa rnams kyi skye ba'i gnas te snying kha'i 'khor lo'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: dud can mtha' yas ai da la sogs rang gi snying kha'i padma rtsa yi 'khor lo mtha' dag go zhes pa mnyam gnas la sogs pa rnams kyi skye ba'i gnas te snying kha'i 'khor lo'i nges pa'o //
translated: The eight winds that arise in the eight places are the life-force wind, the upward-moving wind, the pervading wind, the downward-clearing wind, the fire-coinciding wind, the fire-accompanying wind, the greatly fire-accompanying wind, and the wind that separates the pure and the impure.

original: da ni srog ces pa la sogs pas srog la sogs pa'i bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni srog ces pa la sogs pas srog la sogs pa'i bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning from “life-force” and so on, the functions of the life-force and so on are described.

original: 'dir lus la srog gis srog ste stobs byed do //
analyzed: 'dir lus la srog gis srog ste stobs byed do //
translated: Here, the life-force wind is the life-force of the body, which is the strength.

original: nyi ma zla ba'i lam na gnas par gyur pa na ste nyi ma'i lam ni dmar ser ram ra sa n'a'o //
analyzed: nyi ma zla ba'i lam na gnas par gyur pa na ste nyi ma'i lam ni dmar ser ram ra sa n'a'o //
translated: When it abides in the paths of the sun and moon, that is, in the rasanā, which is the path of the sun, which is red or yellow,

original: zla ba'i lam ni ai da'am la la n'a ste de'i lam la gnas pa ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i lam ni ai da'am la la n'a ste de'i lam la gnas pa ni gnas pa'o //
translated: and in the lalanā, which is the path of the moon, which is white, it abides in their paths.

original: kyang ni tshig phrad kyi don to //
analyzed: kyang ni tshig phrad kyi don to //
translated: Also means “and.”

original: bza' dang btung ba ma lus pa ni ro drug zos pa dang chu la sogs pa 'thungs pa ste /
analyzed: bza' dang btung ba ma lus pa ni ro drug zos pa dang chu la sogs pa 'thungs pa ste /
translated: All food and drink, that is, the six tastes that are eaten and the water, etc., that is drunk,

original: de dag ma lus pa thur sel gyi rlung gis 'og tu 'dren te zhes pa @238b ni lung ngo //
analyzed: de dag ma lus pa thur sel gyi rlung gis 'og tu 'dren te zhes pa @238b ni lung ngo //
translated: are drawn downward by the downward-voiding wind.

original: mtha' dag ro mnyam ste mtshungs pa'i ro'i bar du lus la mnyam gnas zhes bya ba'i rlung gis 'thob par byed de khams bdun ro mnyam par byed do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mtha' dag ro mnyam ste mtshungs pa'i ro'i bar du lus la mnyam gnas zhes bya ba'i rlung gis 'thob par byed de khams bdun ro mnyam par byed do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The wind called “abiding in the body” causes all of them to be of equal taste, that is, to be of the same taste. It causes the seven constituents to be of equal taste.

original: lus la gyen rgyu zhes bya ba'i rlung gis g-yo bar byed do //
analyzed: lus la gyen rgyu zhes bya ba'i rlung gis g-yo bar byed do //
translated: The wind called “upward-moving” causes them to move.

original: kha dang lag pa rkang pa rnams kyis glu dang zlos gar byed de lus 'di la gyen rgyu de nyid kyis khas glu la sogs pa dang dgod pa dang smra ba la sogs pa byed do //
analyzed: kha dang lag pa rkang pa rnams kyis glu dang zlos gar byed de lus 'di la gyen rgyu de nyid kyis khas glu la sogs pa dang dgod pa dang smra ba la sogs pa byed do //
translated: The upward-moving wind makes one sing, dance, and speak with the mouth, hands, and feet.

original: lag pa rkang pa rnams kyis zlos gar  dang 'gro ba la sogs byed do //
analyzed: lag pa rkang pa rnams kyis zlos gar  dang 'gro ba la sogs byed do //
translated: The downward-voiding wind makes one dance, walk, and so on with the hands and feet.

original: khyab byed kyis ni nad dag byed de rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis zhes pa ni chu'i rang bzhin gyi dbang gis te ji ltar lus ni 'jig pa ste de lta nyid du nad byed do //
analyzed: khyab byed kyis ni nad dag byed de rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis zhes pa ni chu'i rang bzhin gyi dbang gis te ji ltar lus ni 'jig pa ste de lta nyid du nad byed do //
translated: The pervading wind makes one sick, by nature and power.

original: klu yang sgregs pa byed pa nyid de gsal bar lag pa rkang pa bskum pa dag ni rus sbal rlung gis so //
analyzed: klu yang sgregs pa byed pa nyid de gsal bar lag pa rkang pa bskum pa dag ni rus sbal rlung gis so //
translated: The nāga wind makes one belch, and clearly contracts the hands and feet, by the tortoise wind.

original: de ni zhes pa khro ba dang g-yeng ba mtha' dag rtsangs pa'i rlung gis byed do //
analyzed: de ni zhes pa khro ba dang g-yeng ba mtha' dag rtsangs pa'i rlung gis byed do //
translated: The power wind makes one angry and distracted, by the lizard wind.

original: glal bdag kyang lha sbyin gyis byed do //
analyzed: glal bdag kyang lha sbyin gyis byed do //
translated: The life-upholding wind makes one yawn, by Devadatta.

original: lus ni lnga pa nyid du gyur pa nor las rgyal ba'i rlung gis gtong bar mi byed do //
analyzed: lus ni lnga pa nyid du gyur pa nor las rgyal ba'i rlung gis gtong bar mi byed do //
translated: The body, which is the fifth, is not released by the wind that conquers the wealth.

original: mi yi bdag po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: mi yi bdag po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: The lord of men is the one who is taken.

original: rlung gcig nor las rgyal ba'o zhes so //
analyzed: rlung gcig nor las rgyal ba'o zhes so //
translated: The wind is the one that conquers the wealth.

original: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas srog la sogs pa'i rlung rnams thams cad de rlung rnams kyis rang bzhin gyis gnas yon tan dag ni gtong bar mi byed de nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas srog la sogs pa'i rlung rnams thams cad de rlung rnams kyis rang bzhin gyis gnas yon tan dag ni gtong bar mi byed de nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan rnams so //
translated: Thus, by the sequence of statements, all the winds such as life are not released by the winds from their natural abodes, the qualities, the qualities of the nature of space, etc.

original: srog la sogs pa'i bya ba nges pa'o //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa'i bya ba nges pa'o //
translated: The function of the life, etc., is ascertained.

original: da ni dmar ser zhes pa la sogs pas rtsa'i ming mu stegs kyi ming rnams kyis gsungs te dmar ser phra mo dag kyang ai ta la sogs ni ai da la sogs pa rtsa gsum mo ;
analyzed: da ni dmar ser zhes pa la sogs pas rtsa'i ming mu stegs kyi ming rnams kyis gsungs te dmar ser phra mo dag kyang ai ta la sogs ni ai da la sogs pa rtsa gsum mo ;
translated: Now, with the words reddish-brown and so forth, the names of the channels are stated with the names of the tirthikas. The three channels are reddish-brown and subtle, and ida and so forth.

original: rnam gsum lam bgrod ces pa la zla ba'i lam la bgrod pa ni ai da'o //
analyzed: rnam gsum lam bgrod ces pa la zla ba'i lam la bgrod pa ni ai da'o //
translated: The one who travels the path of the three is the one who travels the path of the moon, ida.

original: nyi ma'i lam la bgrod pa ni dmar ser ro //
analyzed: nyi ma'i lam la bgrod pa ni dmar ser ro //
translated: The one who travels the path of the sun is reddish-brown.

original: sgra gcan gyi lam la bgrod pa ni su shu mna'o //
analyzed: sgra gcan gyi lam la bgrod pa ni su shu mna'o //
translated: The path of Rāhu is Suṣumnā.

original: snar ma ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: snar ma ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The path of Aśvinī is the fourth.

original: lag ldan lce ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: lag ldan lce ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The path of Puṣya is the fifth.

original: rgyal ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal ni drug pa'o //
translated: The path of Jyeṣṭha is the sixth.

original: ri yang rgyal ba zhes pa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: ri yang rgyal ba zhes pa bdun pa'o //
translated: The path of Mūla is the seventh.

original: aa lam bu sha ni nor dang zhes pa brgyad pa'o //🔽ku h'a ni dgu pa'o //
analyzed: aa lam bu sha ni nor dang zhes pa brgyad pa'o // ku h'a ni dgu pa'o //
translated: The path of Śravaṇa is the eighth.🔽The path of Bhadrapadā is the ninth.

original: phyogs kyi grangs ni dung can ma gang ste bcu pa dung can mas byang chub kyi sems bde ba'i mthar zag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi grangs ni dung can ma gang ste bcu pa dung can mas byang chub kyi sems bde ba'i mthar zag par byed pa'o //
translated: The path of Revatī is the tenth.

original: dpal ldan rtsa'i 'khor lo 'di ni rnam pa mang por 'gyur te tshigs kyi dbye ba du mas so zhes pas 'dir @239a * //
analyzed: dpal ldan rtsa'i 'khor lo 'di ni rnam pa mang por 'gyur te tshigs kyi dbye ba du mas so zhes pas 'dir @239a * //
translated: This glorious cakra of the nāḍīs has many aspects, due to the many divisions of the joints.🔽Here, there are 360 divisions of the joints in the body.

original: lus la tshigs kyi dbye ba'i grangs sum brgya drug cu ste tshigs kyi dbye ba de dag gis rtsa'i 'khor lo'i dbye ba sum brgya drug cur 'gyur zhing srog la sogs pa'i rlung gi bya ba'i dbye ba yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes pa ni rtsa'i
analyzed: lus la tshigs kyi dbye ba'i grangs sum brgya drug cu ste tshigs kyi dbye ba de dag gis rtsa'i 'khor lo'i dbye ba sum brgya drug cur 'gyur zhing srog la sogs pa'i rlung gi bya ba'i dbye ba yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes pa ni rtsa'i
translated: Those divisions of the joints are the 360 divisions of the cakras of the nāḍīs. The divisions of the functions of the prāṇa and so on should be understood in the same way.

original: 'khor lo'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i nges pa'o //
translated: The certainty of the wheels.

original: da ni dbang po zhes pa la sogs pas rtsa'i 'khor lo de nyid la dbang po la sogs pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni dbang po zhes pa la sogs pas rtsa'i 'khor lo de nyid la dbang po la sogs pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with “The consecration of the sense faculties,” he teaches the consecration of the sense faculties and so forth in those very channel wheels.

original: 'dir dbang po'i 'dab ma la thun tshod gcig gi bar du srog gi nus pas dbang po'i rang bzhin brten to //
analyzed: 'dir dbang po'i 'dab ma la thun tshod gcig gi bar du srog gi nus pas dbang po'i rang bzhin brten to //
translated: Here, for one period of twenty-four minutes, the power of the prāṇa supports the nature of the sense faculties on the petal of the sense faculties.

original: me'i 'dab ma la me'i rang bzhin no //🔽gshin rje'i 'dab ma la gshin rje'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: me'i 'dab ma la me'i rang bzhin no // gshin rje'i 'dab ma la gshin rje'i rang bzhin no //
translated: On the petal of fire, the nature of fire.🔽On the petal of Yama, the nature of Yama.

original: bden bral gyi 'dab ma la bden bral gyi rang bzhin no //🔽chu'i 'dab ma la chu'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bden bral gyi 'dab ma la bden bral gyi rang bzhin no // chu'i 'dab ma la chu'i rang bzhin no //
translated: On the petal of Nirṛti, the nature of Nirṛti.🔽On the petal of Varuṇa, the nature of Varuṇa.

original: rlung gi 'dab ma la rlung gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rlung gi 'dab ma la rlung gi rang bzhin no //
translated: On the petal of Vāyu, the nature of Vāyu.

original: nor sbyin gyi 'dab ma la nor sbyin gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: nor sbyin gyi 'dab ma la nor sbyin gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: On the petal of Kubera, the nature of Kubera.

original: dbang ldan gyi 'dab ma la dbang ldan gyi rang bzhin te de ltar 'dab ma brgyad po rnams la srog gi nus pa de yi rang bzhin rten zhing 'khor bar byed do //
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi 'dab ma la dbang ldan gyi rang bzhin te de ltar 'dab ma brgyad po rnams la srog gi nus pa de yi rang bzhin rten zhing 'khor bar byed do //
translated: On the petal of Īśāna, the nature of Īśāna. Thus, the power of the prāṇa supports and circulates the nature of those eight petals.

original: dbang po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi nges pa'o //
translated: The nature of the senses and so forth is ascertained.

original: da ni mgrin pa'i 'khor lo gsung pa te 'dir snying kha'i padma'i steng du sor mo phyed dang bcas pa'i bcu gnyis kyi mthar mgrin pa'i 'khor lo la gza'i tshogs dang bcas pa'i rgyu skar 'khor lo yang dag gnas te /
analyzed: da ni mgrin pa'i 'khor lo gsung pa te 'dir snying kha'i padma'i steng du sor mo phyed dang bcas pa'i bcu gnyis kyi mthar mgrin pa'i 'khor lo la gza'i tshogs dang bcas pa'i rgyu skar 'khor lo yang dag gnas te /
translated: Now, the throat cakra is speech. Here, on top of the lotus of the heart, the wheel of the lunar mansions with the host of planets is situated in the throat cakra, which has twelve fingerbreadths plus a half.

original: dbyug gu'i skar ma bzhi dang gtso bo'i rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa brgyad de 'di rnams kyis 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: dbyug gu'i skar ma bzhi dang gtso bo'i rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa brgyad de 'di rnams kyis 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The four dhanas and the twenty-eight primary lunar mansions are on thirty-two petals.

original: dbyug gu'i rgyu skar bzhi dor nas 'dab ma nyi shu rtsa brgyad po rnams la nyin mtshan gyis srog yang dag par rgyu ste /
analyzed: dbyug gu'i rgyu skar bzhi dor nas 'dab ma nyi shu rtsa brgyad po rnams la nyin mtshan gyis srog yang dag par rgyu ste /
translated: The life force moves through the day and night on the twenty-eight petals, excluding the four dhanas.

original: dbyug gu drug cu las chas thob pa ni 'dab ma so so la srog yang dag par rgyu'o //
analyzed: dbyug gu drug cu las chas thob pa ni 'dab ma so so la srog yang dag par rgyu'o //
translated: The life force moves through each petal in sixty dhanas.

original: tshangs pa'i yul sa dpal ldan dpral ba dag nas dbyangs kyis yongs su bskor ba'i thig le dkar po zag / mgrin pa'i padma de'i yang steng du sor mo phyed dang bcas pa'i bcu gnyis kyi mthar dpral ba'i padma 'dab ma bcu drug pa la 'dab ma gnyis
analyzed: tshangs pa'i yul sa dpal ldan dpral ba dag nas dbyangs kyis yongs su bskor ba'i thig le dkar po zag / mgrin pa'i padma de'i yang steng du sor mo phyed dang bcas pa'i bcu gnyis kyi mthar dpral ba'i padma 'dab ma bcu drug pa la 'dab ma gnyis
translated: Above that, on the lotus of the throat, which has twelve fingerbreadths plus a half, is the forehead lotus with sixteen petals.

original: dor nas 'dab ma bcu bzhi po rnams la nyin mtshan gyis srog yang dag par rgyu ste /
analyzed: dor nas 'dab ma bcu bzhi po rnams la nyin mtshan gyis srog yang dag par rgyu ste /
translated: Two petals are omitted, and the life force moves on the fourteen petals by day and night.

original: dbyug gu drug cu las bcu bzhi'i cha thob pas 'dab ma so so 'dor ro //
analyzed: dbyug gu drug cu las bcu bzhi'i cha thob pas 'dab ma so so 'dor ro //
translated: Since it takes fourteen parts out of sixty ghatis, it omits one petal.

original: thig le dang rnam par bcas @239b pa ni lte ba la rig par bya ste zla ba'i rkang pa rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: thig le dang rnam par bcas @239b pa ni lte ba la rig par bya ste zla ba'i rkang pa rgyu ba'o //
translated: The drop and the half-moon should be known to be at the navel, where the lunar mansions move.

original: slar yang lte ba'i 'khor lo la rtsa drug cu rtsa bzhi ni 'jigs ma la sogs pa'i ming rnams kyis so //
analyzed: slar yang lte ba'i 'khor lo la rtsa drug cu rtsa bzhi ni 'jigs ma la sogs pa'i ming rnams kyis so //
translated: Again, the sixty-four channels in the navel cakra are named after Jyeshtha and so on.

original: snying khar brgyad ni ai da la sogs pa'i ming rnams kyis so //
analyzed: snying khar brgyad ni ai da la sogs pa'i ming rnams kyis so //
translated: At the heart, there are eight, named after Idâ and so on.

original: mgrin par tha skar la sogs pa'i ming dang stong pa bzhi'i ming rnams kyis so //
analyzed: mgrin par tha skar la sogs pa'i ming dang stong pa bzhi'i ming rnams kyis so //
translated: At the throat, the nāḍīs are named after the lunar mansions and the four emptinesses.

original: dpral ba'i rtsa rnams la tshes gcig la sogs pa'i ming rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dpral ba'i rtsa rnams la tshes gcig la sogs pa'i ming rnams kyis so //
translated: At the forehead, the nāḍīs are named after the first day of the lunar month and so on.

original: gtsug tor la thun mtshams bzhi'i dbye bas de nyid bzhi'i ming rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gtsug tor la thun mtshams bzhi'i dbye bas de nyid bzhi'i ming rnams kyis so //
translated: At the crown, the nāḍīs are named after the fourfold reality, divided into the four periods.

original: mgrin pa dang dpral ba'i padma'i 'dab ma 'di rnams la nang du gyur pa ni 'khor lo 'dab ma brgyad par rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: mgrin pa dang dpral ba'i padma'i 'dab ma 'di rnams la nang du gyur pa ni 'khor lo 'dab ma brgyad par rigs par bya'o //
translated: The petals of the lotuses at the throat and forehead should be understood as the eight petals of the cakras.

original: de bzhin du lte ba dang snying kha dang mgrin pa dang dpral ba la 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi rang bzhin no //🔽gtsug tor la 'dab ma bzhi pa ni stong pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du lte ba dang snying kha dang mgrin pa dang dpral ba la 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi rang bzhin no // gtsug tor la 'dab ma bzhi pa ni stong pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Similarly, the cakras at the navel, heart, throat, and forehead have eight spokes and are the natures of earth, water, fire, and air.🔽The four petals at the crown are the nature of the empty.

original: lte bar 'dab ma bzhi pa ni ye shes kyi khams kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: lte bar 'dab ma bzhi pa ni ye shes kyi khams kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The four petals at the navel are the nature of the element of gnosis.

original: gsang bar 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis pa ste phyi rol gyi 'dab ma bcu drug rnams la dbyangs kyi rtsa'o //
analyzed: gsang bar 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis pa ste phyi rol gyi 'dab ma bcu drug rnams la dbyangs kyi rtsa'o //
translated: In the secret, there are thirty-two petals, and the sixteen outer petals are the nāḍīs of the vowels.

original: nang du 'dab ma bcu la phung po dang khams kyi rtsa'o //
analyzed: nang du 'dab ma bcu la phung po dang khams kyi rtsa'o //
translated: Inwardly, on the ten petals, there are the nāḍīs of the skandhas and dhātus.

original: de las nang gi 'dab ma rnams la stong pa drug gi rtsa'o //
analyzed: de las nang gi 'dab ma rnams la stong pa drug gi rtsa'o //
translated: On those, the inner petals have the nāḍīs of the six emptinesses.

original: de ltar na 'khor lo drug po rnams kyi grangs ni lnga bcu rtsa drug lhag pa'i brgya phrag gcig ste 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'khor lo drug po rnams la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'khor lo drug po rnams kyi grangs ni lnga bcu rtsa drug lhag pa'i brgya phrag gcig ste 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'khor lo drug po rnams la brjod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the number of the six cakras is one hundred and fifty-six, which will be described in the section on the six cakras.

original: 'khor lo drug gi nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo drug gi nges pa'o //
translated: The determination of the six cakras.

original: da ni rtsa ba zhes pa la sogs pas sna bug gnyis las dkyil 'khor lnga rab tu 'bab pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni rtsa ba zhes pa la sogs pas sna bug gnyis las dkyil 'khor lnga rab tu 'bab pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with “The root,” the five maṇḍalas flowing from the two nostrils are explained.

original: 'dir sna bug g-yon pa dang g-yas pa dag la rtsa ba ste 'og gi char sa'i dkyil 'khor 'bab bo //
analyzed: 'dir sna bug g-yon pa dang g-yas pa dag la rtsa ba ste 'og gi char sa'i dkyil 'khor 'bab bo //
translated: Here, the root, or lower, part of the left and right nostrils is the flow of the earth maṇḍala.

original: sna bug g-yon pa dang g-yas pa dag la g-yon du chu 'bab bo //
analyzed: sna bug g-yon pa dang g-yas pa dag la g-yon du chu 'bab bo //
translated: The left and right nostrils are the flow of water.

original: dbus kyi re kh'a la mngon par phyogs pa'i sna'i bug pa gnyis te thams cad kyi byang na lhun po'o zhes pa'i shes par byed pa las so //
analyzed: dbus kyi re kh'a la mngon par phyogs pa'i sna'i bug pa gnyis te thams cad kyi byang na lhun po'o zhes pa'i shes par byed pa las so //
translated: The two nostrils face the central channel.

original: g-yas su bsreg za'i dkyil 'khor dag ni rab tu 'bab ste /
analyzed: g-yas su bsreg za'i dkyil 'khor dag ni rab tu 'bab ste /
translated: The fire maṇḍala flows to the right.

original: g-yas dang byang gnyis ka'i phyi rol gyi sna'i bug pa'i cha'o //
analyzed: g-yas dang byang gnyis ka'i phyi rol gyi sna'i bug pa'i cha'o //
translated: The fire maṇḍala flows to the right and the left of the two nostrils.

original: sna bug gnyis ka'i steng du rlung gi dkyil 'khor 'bab bo //🔽sna bug gnyis kyi dbus su nam mkha' ste sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor @240a * //
analyzed: sna bug gnyis ka'i steng du rlung gi dkyil 'khor 'bab bo // sna bug gnyis kyi dbus su nam mkha' ste sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor @240a * //
translated: The wind maṇḍala flows above the two nostrils.🔽The space maṇḍala is in the center of the maṇḍalas of earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: 'bab ste / g-yon gyi dus sbyor rgyu ba la g-yon dang g-yas kyi dus sbyor rgyu ba la g-yas nas dkyil 'khor rab tu 'bab bo //
analyzed: 'bab ste / g-yon gyi dus sbyor rgyu ba la g-yon dang g-yas kyi dus sbyor rgyu ba la g-yas nas dkyil 'khor rab tu 'bab bo //
translated: The space maṇḍala flows in the center of the maṇḍalas of earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: slar yang sna bug gnyis la cig car du mnyam pa ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor 'bab ste srog gi nus pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang sna bug gnyis la cig car du mnyam pa ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor 'bab ste srog gi nus pa'o //
translated: The gnosis maṇḍala flows simultaneously into the two nostrils.🔽The gnosis maṇḍala flows simultaneously into the two nostrils.

original: 'di dag rnams ni 'bugs te zhes pa ni lte ba dang / snying kha dang / mgrin pa dang / dpral ba dang / gtsug tor dang / sna bug gi dkyil 'khor rnams dbyug gu dang / khyim dang thun tshod dang rgyu skar dang tshes grangs dang mtshams kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbye ba dag gis 'bugs par byed do //
analyzed: 'di dag rnams ni 'bugs te zhes pa ni lte ba dang / snying kha dang / mgrin pa dang / dpral ba dang / gtsug tor dang / sna bug gi dkyil 'khor rnams dbyug gu dang / khyim dang thun tshod dang rgyu skar dang tshes grangs dang mtshams kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbye ba dag gis 'bugs par byed do //
translated: These are the cakras of the navel, heart, throat, forehead, crown, and the middle of the nostrils. They are pierced by the divisions of the cakras of the ghaṭikās, houses, praharas, nakṣatras, lunar days, and sandhis.

original: nus pa ni srog gi nus pa 'gro ste mchog gi gnas ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nus pa ni srog gi nus pa 'gro ste mchog gi gnas ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: The power is the power of the prāṇa moving in the supreme place, which is the absence of an object.

original: bcu gnyis mtha' ni sor bcu gnyis kyi mtha'o //
analyzed: bcu gnyis mtha' ni sor bcu gnyis kyi mtha'o //
translated: The end of twelve is the end of twelve finger lengths.

original: cha yi mthar ni sor bcu drug gi mthar ro //
analyzed: cha yi mthar ni sor bcu drug gi mthar ro //
translated: The end of the parts is the end of sixteen finger lengths.

original: 'dir sa'i dkyil 'khor rab tu 'bab pa'i rlung ni sna bug nas sor bcu gnyis kyi mthar 'gro ste de nas ldog go /
analyzed: 'dir sa'i dkyil 'khor rab tu 'bab pa'i rlung ni sna bug nas sor bcu gnyis kyi mthar 'gro ste de nas ldog go /
translated: Here, the wind of the earth maṇḍala moves from the nostrils to the end of twelve finger lengths and then returns.

original: chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi rlung ni sor bcu gsum 'gro ste de nas ldog go //
analyzed: chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi rlung ni sor bcu gsum 'gro ste de nas ldog go //
translated: The wind of the water maṇḍala moves thirteen finger lengths and then returns.

original: me'i dkyil 'khor gyi rlung ni sor bcu bzhi 'gro ste de nas ldog go //
analyzed: me'i dkyil 'khor gyi rlung ni sor bcu bzhi 'gro ste de nas ldog go //
translated: The wind of the fire maṇḍala moves fourteen finger lengths and then returns.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi rlung ni sor bcva lnga 'gro ste de nas ldog go //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi rlung ni sor bcva lnga 'gro ste de nas ldog go //
translated: The wind of the wind maṇḍala moves fifteen finger lengths and then reverses.

original: stong pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rlung ni sor bcu drug 'gro ste de nas ldog go //
analyzed: stong pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rlung ni sor bcu drug 'gro ste de nas ldog go //
translated: The wind of the empty maṇḍala moves sixteen finger lengths and then reverses.

original: ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rlung sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi mthar de dag gi dbus su rab tu zhugs pa ni sna bug gnyis nas sor bcu gnyis 'bab bo //
analyzed: ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rlung sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi mthar de dag gi dbus su rab tu zhugs pa ni sna bug gnyis nas sor bcu gnyis 'bab bo //
translated: The wind of the gnosis maṇḍala moves twelve finger lengths in the center of the earth maṇḍala, entering through the two nostrils.

original: nam mkha'i mthar dbu mar zhugs pa'i sor bcu drug 'bab bo //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mthar dbu mar zhugs pa'i sor bcu drug 'bab bo //
translated: It moves sixteen finger lengths in the center of the avadhūti.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe phyi rol du 'phel bar gyur pa de'i tshe nang du thung ngur 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe phyi rol du 'phel bar gyur pa de'i tshe nang du thung ngur 'gyur ro ;
translated: Here, when it moves externally, it moves internally as short.

original: / gang gi tshe bcu drug la sogs pa las phyi rol du thung ngur 'gyur ba de'i tshe rlung gi rtsa'i dbang gis lte bar sor mo bzhi 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: / gang gi tshe bcu drug la sogs pa las phyi rol du thung ngur 'gyur ba de'i tshe rlung gi rtsa'i dbang gis lte bar sor mo bzhi 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: When it moves externally as short from sixteen, and so on, it moves four finger lengths at the navel through the power of the vāyu nāḍīs.

original: srog gi nus pa 'bab pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: srog gi nus pa 'bab pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the ascertained measure of the descent of the potency of life.

original: da ni zhing zhes pa la sogs pas zhing la sogs pa rnams gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni zhing zhes pa la sogs pas zhing la sogs pa rnams gsungs te /
translated: Now, the field, and so on, are explained by “field,” and so on.

original: 'di ltar lus kyi dpung pa'i tshigs gnyis la zhing gnyis so //🔽brla'i tshigs gnyis la nye ba'i zhing ngo //🔽nye ba'i dpung pa'i tshigs gnyis la tshan do ha gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di ltar lus kyi dpung pa'i tshigs gnyis la zhing gnyis so // brla'i tshigs gnyis la nye ba'i zhing ngo // nye ba'i dpung pa'i tshigs gnyis la tshan do ha gnyis so //
translated: Thus, there are two fields in the two joints of the arms.🔽There are two secondary fields in the two joints of the thighs.🔽There are two secondary fields in the two joints of the upper arms.

original: pus mo'i tshigs gnyis la nye ba'i tshan do ha'o //
analyzed: pus mo'i tshigs gnyis la nye ba'i tshan do ha'o //
translated: There are two secondary fields in the two joints of the knees.

original: lag pa'i tshigs gnyis la 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: lag pa'i tshigs gnyis la 'dus pa'o //
translated: There are two gatherings in the two joints of the hands.

original: rkang pa'i tshigs gnyis la @240b nye ba'i 'dus pa'o //🔽lag pa'i mthil gnyis la dur khrod gnyis so //
analyzed: rkang pa'i tshigs gnyis la @240b nye ba'i 'dus pa'o // lag pa'i mthil gnyis la dur khrod gnyis so //
translated: There are two secondary gatherings in the two joints of the feet.🔽There are two charnel grounds in the two palms.

original: rkang pa'i mthil gnyis la nye ba'i dur khrod gnyis so //🔽lag pa gnyis kyi sor mo la dur khrod chen po bzhi'o //
analyzed: rkang pa'i mthil gnyis la nye ba'i dur khrod gnyis so // lag pa gnyis kyi sor mo la dur khrod chen po bzhi'o //
translated: There are two secondary charnel grounds in the two soles of the feet.🔽There are four great charnel grounds in the fingers of the two hands.🔽There are four secondary great charnel grounds in the fingers of the two feet.

original: rkang pa gnyis kyi sor mo la nye ba'i dur khrod chen po bzhi ste zhing la sogs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis kyi sor mo la nye ba'i dur khrod chen po bzhi ste zhing la sogs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definition of the fields, and so on.

original: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las kun 'byung gi bden pa la sogs pa'i mdor bsdus chen po ste gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las kun 'byung gi bden pa la sogs pa'i mdor bsdus chen po ste gnyis pa'o /
translated: The Stainless Light, a commentary on the root tantra, the King of Tantras Called “Time,” which is a twelve-thousand-chapter summary of the truth of the origin and so forth, is the second.

original: // / da ni 'khor lo can zhes pa la sogs pas 'khor los sgyur ba dang kla klo'i 'khrug pa rang gi lus la gsungs te 'dir rang gi lus la ni mi'i lus la'o //
analyzed: // / da ni 'khor lo can zhes pa la sogs pas 'khor los sgyur ba dang kla klo'i 'khrug pa rang gi lus la gsungs te 'dir rang gi lus la ni mi'i lus la'o //
translated: Now, beginning with “the cakravartin,” the cakravartin and the barbarian war are taught in terms of one’s body. Here, “in one’s body” is in the human body.

original: phyi rol du le'u dang po las gsungs pa'i 'khor lo can gang yin pa de ni lus la rdo rje can te thugs rdo rje'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: phyi rol du le'u dang po las gsungs pa'i 'khor lo can gang yin pa de ni lus la rdo rje can te thugs rdo rje'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The cakravartin who is mentioned in the first chapter is the vajra holder in the body, that is, the mind vajra.

original: lha mchog bdag po dbang phyug la sogs pa bcu gnyis rnams gang yin pa de dag ni yan lag bcu gnyis 'gog pa rnams so //
analyzed: lha mchog bdag po dbang phyug la sogs pa bcu gnyis rnams gang yin pa de dag ni yan lag bcu gnyis 'gog pa rnams so //
translated: The twelve, such as the supreme god Maheśvara, are the cessation of the twelve limbs.

original: rigs ldan gang yin pa de ni lus la yang dag pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: rigs ldan gang yin pa de ni lus la yang dag pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The kṣatriya is the perfect gnosis in the body.

original: ni zhes pa ni rgyu de las so //
analyzed: ni zhes pa ni rgyu de las so //
translated: ni means from that cause.

original: phyi rol du glang po rta dang shing rta mngag gzhug pa gang yin pa de dag lus la /
analyzed: phyi rol du glang po rta dang shing rta mngag gzhug pa gang yin pa de dag lus la /
translated: What is the external, namely, the elephant, horse, and chariot, is the body.

original: 'phags pa'i tshad med pa bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i tshad med pa bzhi rnams so //
translated: The four immeasurables of the noble ones.

original: phyi rol du drag po gang yin pa de ni lus la rang rgyal gyi ye shes kyi ming can no //
analyzed: phyi rol du drag po gang yin pa de ni lus la rang rgyal gyi ye shes kyi ming can no //
translated: What is the external, namely, the fierce one, is the body.

original: phyi rol du ha nu m'an gang yin pa de ni nyan thos kyi ye shes te rang gi lus la 'khor lo can 'khor dang bcas pa dang rigs ldan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol du ha nu m'an gang yin pa de ni nyan thos kyi ye shes te rang gi lus la 'khor lo can 'khor dang bcas pa dang rigs ldan du 'gyur ro //
translated: What is the external, namely, the Hanumān, is the wisdom of the śrāvakas. In one's own body, one becomes the one with the wheel and retinue, and the one endowed with the clan.

original: de bzhin du phyi rol du gdug pa kla klo'i dbang po gang yin pa de ni lus la sdig pa'i sems so //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi rol du gdug pa kla klo'i dbang po gang yin pa de ni lus la sdig pa'i sems so //
translated: Similarly, what is the external, namely, the evil barbarian lord, is the sinful mind in the body.

original: phyi rol du byed pa'i blo gros sdug bsngal sbyin byed gang yin pa de ni lus la mi dge ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: phyi rol du byed pa'i blo gros sdug bsngal sbyin byed gang yin pa de ni lus la mi dge ba'i lam mo //
translated: What is the external, namely, the mind of action that gives suffering, is the path of non-virtue in the body.

original: phyi rol du rta la /
analyzed: phyi rol du rta la /
translated: What is the external, namely, the horse,

original: gnas pa gang yin pa de ni lus la ma rig pa 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa gang yin pa de ni lus la ma rig pa 'jug pa'o //
translated: is the body. What is the external, namely, the abode, is the entry of ignorance into the body.

original: phyi rol du lha min dpung glang po dang rta dang shing rta dang rkang thang rnams gang yin pa de ni lus la bdud kyi phyogs rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du lha min dpung glang po dang rta dang shing rta dang rkang thang rnams gang yin pa de ni lus la bdud kyi phyogs rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The external armies of the demigods, consisting of elephants, horses, chariots, and infantry, are the fourfold army of the demons in the body.

original: phyi rol du de'i g-yul la kla klo rnams sdud pa de ni rang gi lus la srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms pa'o //🔽phyi rol du 'khor lo can chen po dang rigs ldan gyi dpal ldan rgyal ba gang yin pa de ni rang @241a * //
analyzed: phyi rol du de'i g-yul la kla klo rnams sdud pa de ni rang gi lus la srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms pa'o // phyi rol du 'khor lo can chen po dang rigs ldan gyi dpal ldan rgyal ba gang yin pa de ni rang @241a * //
translated: The external gathering of barbarians in the battle is the internal destruction of the fear of existence in the body.

original: gi lus la thar pa'i lam rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: gi lus la thar pa'i lam rnyed pa'o //
translated: The external great universal emperor and the glory of the kṣatriya are the internal attainment of the path of liberation in the body.

original: phyi rol du kee l'a shar 'khor lo can chen po'i chos kyi sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi lus la srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'phrog pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du kee l'a shar 'khor lo can chen po'i chos kyi sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi lus la srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'phrog pa'o //
translated: The external great universal emperor’s gift of Dharma on Kailash is the internal taking away of the fear of existence in the body.

original: phyi rol du rdzas kyis gang ba'i sa gzhi gang yin pa de ni lus la khams kyi tshogs rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du rdzas kyis gang ba'i sa gzhi gang yin pa de ni lus la khams kyi tshogs rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The external ground filled with substances is the internal pure collection of elements in the body.

original: phyi rol du 'khor lo can gyi sras tshangs pa dang lha'i dbang por gyur pa rgyab kyi dum bu gcig tu chos ston par byed pa dang / mdun te mdun gyi dum bur kla klo'i chos zad pa don du gnyer ba gang yin pa 'jam dpal te de dang 'jig rten mgon po srid pa gsum las rnam par rgyal ba de ni rang gi lus la dpal ldan rdul dang byang chub kyi sems bde ba
analyzed: phyi rol du 'khor lo can gyi sras tshangs pa dang lha'i dbang por gyur pa rgyab kyi dum bu gcig tu chos ston par byed pa dang / mdun te mdun gyi dum bur kla klo'i chos zad pa don du gnyer ba gang yin pa 'jam dpal te de dang 'jig rten mgon po srid pa gsum las rnam par rgyal ba de ni rang gi lus la dpal ldan rdul dang byang chub kyi sems bde ba
translated: Externally, the son of Cakrin, who becomes Brahmā and Lord of the Gods, teaches the Dharma in one part of the back, and in the front, that is, in the front part, Mañjuśrī, who is intent on the exhaustion of the barbarian Dharma, and Lokanātha, who is Victorious in the Three Worlds, are in one’s own body, the glorious dust and the bodhicitta,

original: ster ba'am smon pa'i sems dang 'jug pa'i sems so //
analyzed: ster ba'am smon pa'i sems dang 'jug pa'i sems so //
translated: which bestows bliss or the aspiration and engaged bodhicittas.

original: rgyab kyi dum bur tshangs pa la sogs pa'i rigs rnam pa sna tshogs gang yin pa de dag ni rang gi lus la du ma'i sangs rgyas rnam par dag pa phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyab kyi dum bur tshangs pa la sogs pa'i rigs rnam pa sna tshogs gang yin pa de dag ni rang gi lus la du ma'i sangs rgyas rnam par dag pa phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: In the back part, the various types of castes such as the Brahmin, are in one’s own body, the nature of the many pure Buddhas, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: de ltar kla klo dbang po'i 'khrug par 'gyur te nges par lus can rnams kyis lus kyi dbus su'o //
analyzed: de ltar kla klo dbang po'i 'khrug par 'gyur te nges par lus can rnams kyis lus kyi dbus su'o //
translated: Thus, the barbarian is agitated in the sense faculties, certainly in the middle of the body of embodied beings.

original: sgyu ma'i gzugs kyang phyi rol du ni nges par mkha'i yul du kla klo 'khrug ste 'khrug pa min zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i gzugs kyang phyi rol du ni nges par mkha'i yul du kla klo 'khrug ste 'khrug pa min zhes pa ste /
translated: Also, the illusory form is definitely external, in the field of space, not a barbarian, not a fight, not a disturbance.

original: 'di ni rgyas par 'chad par 'gyur ba'i le'u lnga par mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes grub pa las brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyas par 'chad par 'gyur ba'i le'u lnga par mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes grub pa las brjod par bya'o //
translated: This will be described in the fifth chapter, which will be explained in detail, in the Establishment of the Supreme Unchanging Gnosis.

original: da ni dus kyi lo zhes pa la sogs pas dbu ma'i phyogs gsum dang lo gsum gyi dbye ba dag gis rigs gsum la sogs pas 'dus pa la sogs pa gsungs te 'dir dus kyi lo ni rtsa dbu ma'i lo'o //
analyzed: da ni dus kyi lo zhes pa la sogs pas dbu ma'i phyogs gsum dang lo gsum gyi dbye ba dag gis rigs gsum la sogs pas 'dus pa la sogs pa gsungs te 'dir dus kyi lo ni rtsa dbu ma'i lo'o //
translated: Now, beginning with “the year of time,” the three divisions of the central channel and the three years are stated in the Guhyasamāja, with the three families, and so on. Here, the year of time is the year of the central channel.

original: me grangs ni lo gsum gyi grangs so //
analyzed: me grangs ni lo gsum gyi grangs so //
translated: The number of fires is the number of the three years.

original: lo yi nyin zhag tshogs kyis bsgyur ba ni nyin zhag sum brgya drug cus bsgyur bar 'gyur ba ste nyin zhag gi tshogs stong brgyad cur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo yi nyin zhag tshogs kyis bsgyur ba ni nyin zhag sum brgya drug cus bsgyur bar 'gyur ba ste nyin zhag gi tshogs stong brgyad cur 'gyur ro //
translated: The transformation by the collection of days of the year is the transformation by the three hundred and sixty days, which becomes the collection of days of one thousand and eighty.

original: lo gsum po de nyid rigs gsum ste sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rigs so //
analyzed: lo gsum po de nyid rigs gsum ste sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rigs so //
translated: Those three years are the three families, the body, speech, and mind families.

original: lo'i dbye bas snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: lo'i dbye bas snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: By the division of years, they are of the nature of sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: nyin zhag gi tshogs de las bgrod pa'i dbye ba brgya brgyad cu'i chas thob pa ni rigs drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyin zhag gi tshogs de las bgrod pa'i dbye ba brgya brgyad cu'i chas thob pa ni rigs drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: From that collection of days, by the division of the passage of the asterisms, they are obtained by the factor of 180 and become the six clans.

original: slar yang nyin zhag gi tshogs de las zla ba'i dbye bas te sum cu'i chas thob pa ni rigs sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: slar yang nyin zhag gi tshogs de las zla ba'i dbye bas te sum cu'i chas thob pa ni rigs sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur te /
translated: Again, from that collection of days, by the division of the months, they are obtained by the factor of 30 and become the thirty-six clans.

original: ro yis bsgyur @241b ba'i ro zhes pa drug gis bsgyur ba'i drug ni /
analyzed: ro yis bsgyur @241b ba'i ro zhes pa drug gis bsgyur ba'i drug ni /
translated: The six obtained by multiplying by six are

original: sum cu rtsa drug ste /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa drug ste /
translated: the thirty-six.

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi rigs so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi rigs so //
translated: They are the clans of the yoginis.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: thabs rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: thabs rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: they are the clans of the yogis.

original: nyin zhag gi tshogs stong brgyad cu po de las gza' yis bcad pas thob pa ni rab gsal nges par dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor ba'i lha rnams te lnga bcu rtsa bzhi lhag pa'i brgya phrag gcig go //
analyzed: nyin zhag gi tshogs stong brgyad cu po de las gza' yis bcad pas thob pa ni rab gsal nges par dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor ba'i lha rnams te lnga bcu rtsa bzhi lhag pa'i brgya phrag gcig go //
translated: From that collection of 1,800 days, by the division of the planets, they are obtained and are the deities of the mandala of the Kalachakra, the ascertainment of the clear light, one hundred plus fifty-four.

original: lhag ma shes rab dang thabs zung zhig ste de ltar na lnga bcu rtsa drug lhag pa'i brgya phrag gcig ni dus kyi 'khor lo ste bdun gyi cha'i lhag ma ni rigs ldan gyi gnas kyi lhag pa'i lha'o //
analyzed: lhag ma shes rab dang thabs zung zhig ste de ltar na lnga bcu rtsa drug lhag pa'i brgya phrag gcig ni dus kyi 'khor lo ste bdun gyi cha'i lhag ma ni rigs ldan gyi gnas kyi lhag pa'i lha'o //
translated: The remaining [constellations] are the pairs of wisdom and means. Thus, the one hundred and fifty-six [constellations] are the Wheel of Time. The remaining [constellations] are the deities of the abode of the lords of the lineages.

original: lha dang lha mo'i 'khor lo dang rigs ldan gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: lha dang lha mo'i 'khor lo dang rigs ldan gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: [This is] the definition of the wheel of gods and goddesses and the lords of the lineages.
